Abelia Grandiflora, commonly known as 'glossy Abelia', is a quick growing evergreen shrub with branches arching from the base.  With it's glossy dark green leaves and white, slightly perfumed flowers, this beautiful exotic shrub provides a blaze of vibrant colour throughout summer and autumn with the new growth displaying a reddish tinge. The reddish coloured calyces are an added feature after flowering.This ornamental shrub is ideal for any domestic garden or  a landscape project whether it be a low informal hedge, a border shrub, mass planted or is equally stunning planted on its own.Plant Abelia Grandflora in full sun to partial shade with well-drained fertile soils with ample summer moisture. Prune to remove spent calyces and old basal shoots to maintain bushiness.Abelia Grandiflora can reach a height of 2 metres and a width of 2 metres.
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point/Ovate - Egg-shaped, Wide At Base

This golden Abelia is a striking golden foliaged evergreen shrub. Aurea, also known as the glossy abelia, forms a mound of foliage that will brighten any garden. An added advantage is that it flowers late in the season adding colour and interest in autumn when the bush is covered with tubular white flowers with a pinkish flush. The Abelia Aurea will tolerate partial-shade, making it very useful for lighting up a dull border or corner of the patio. Can be pruned at will, so makes an excellent pot specimen. Aurea also grows well in pots so is great for smaller or patio gardens, and also makes a striking alternative plant for hedging.Plant Abelia Aurea in full sun or partial shade in any reasonably drained soil with added humus.Abelia Aurea will grow to a height and width of 2 metres.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree

Acacia cognata Burgundy Cascade is a stunning shrub or small tree with cascading foliage. This Australian native has thin smooth green leaves with a burgundy edge that gives it an interesting range of colour throughout the year. The flowers are small, ball shaped, pale yellow and speckled throughout the foliage.This form of Acacia creates a stunning effect when planted in groups but is also equally great when used as a small specimen tree in any sized garden adding great colour and texture. Works well in large containers or as an informal hedge.Acacia cognata Burgundy Cascade prefers humus rich, moist, well drained soil in a sunny position and can tolerate most soils and most ph levels.Acacia cognata Burgundy Cascade grows to a height of 4 metres and a width of 3 metres.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Limelight is a prominent feature for any garden or landscape. Acacia cognata Limelight is equipped with a compact mounded weeping habit and produces soft decorative foliage in a brilliant lime green shade. The pendulous leaves are the focus for this plant as it does not flower, and is renowned for its lush display of foliage all year round. Acacia cognata Limelight is hardy, drought and frost tolerant, with a multitude of uses such as informal hedging, borders, feature planting, cascading down walls or retainers and in patio pots.  Limelight is also widely used in commercial plantings for contrast planting with great effect.  Plant Acacia cognata Limelight in well draining soils with full to part sun exposure. Acacia cognata Limelight is easy to grow with minimal maintenance required. Use a slow release fertiliser specific for natives in spring, and water occasionally during hot periods.Acacia cognata Limelight can grow to a height and width of 1 metre.

This South Pacific native shrub is known for its magnificent display of colour. With splashes of red, maroon, brown and crimson, Acalypha wilkesiana Red will provide a stunning contrast of colour in any garden or landscape. Acalypha wilkesiana Red is commonly used as a large informal hedge, screen or as a specimen shrub. The large leaves make this Acalypha idea for a tropical garden.Acaclypha wilkesiana Red  prefers a sunny, warm position and will tolerate light-filtered shade. Plant Acalypha wilkesiana Red in well drained soils, with the addition of quality organic matter to promote healthy growth. However it is hardy and will tolerate lesser soils. A waterwise plant once established however occasional watering is recommended during long dry periods in summer. Slow release fertiliser can be used in early spring or summer.Acalypha wilkesiana Red will grow up to a height and width of 3 metres but can be maintained at a smaller size if desired.
These are a 'uniform' growing tree ideal for driveways and avenues.Also a lovely specimen tree in the garden.This variety has exceptional autumn colour making it a 'standout' tree.

Palmate - Like A Hand With Fingers

This stunning red maple puts on a show of redish-orange foliage every autumn. Being a standout specimen tree it makes an excellent addition to larger gardens and park lands. Perfect for avenue planting, this variety is also a reasonably quick grower.The 'Fairview Flame' is one of the best 'red' maple cultivars supplying reliable autumn colour and maintains a nice shape.
Bronze, Brown, Copper, Green, Orange, Purple, Red, Yellow
Palmate - Like A Hand With Fingers

This variety of Acer has very impressive autumn colour starting green and turning a dark pinkinsh-red in autumn. the underside of the leaves also change from grey in spring to pink in autumn. This is a variety that changes a bit later than the others and holds its leaves longer into the season. The tree shape is oval/rounded shape once mature.Ideal specimen tree, group plantings or avenues.
Coastal, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Cherry Surprise is a naturally compact, extremely hardy lilly pilly with striking bright red new growth that contrasts superbly with the older green foliage. Small cream flowers appear in spring and summer. Perfect for hedging, screening or topiary. Can withstand light frost and is drought tolerant as well as psyllid resistant.  Mulch well after planting and water well in dry weather. Prune lightly after flowering to maintain as dense hedge. Fertilize with slow release fertilizer in late winter and early autumn.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

An ideal and popular choice for those seeking a screening plant for that extra privacy. Acmena smithii 'Goodbye Neighbours' is commonly known as the Lilly Pilly and has dense green and bronze foliage that will produce small white flowers throughout the year. These flowers will also entice a few birds to the garden.This native is best used for hedging or screening as it can be pruned to the desired look. Plant Acmena smithii Goodbye Neighbours in areas of full to part sun and in moist free draining soils. This variety is tolerant to most conditions including drought, wind, some slight  salt spray and light frost once established. It is also highly resistant to psyllids. Acmena smithii Goodbye Neighbours requires very little maintenance. Water the plant well until established. Occasional watering may be required depending on the climate. Prune as desired.Acmena smithii Goodbye Neighbours will grow to a height up to 10 metres high and a width of 2 metres.  Goodbye Neighbours can grow at a rate of 2m per year.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Acmena smithii Allyn Magic is an Australian native ideal for its use as a low hedge. Commonly known as the 'Lilly pilly', Acmena smithii Allyn Magic produces dark green foliage as well as a generous amount of new growth which are a deep bronze maroon shade, adding a spectacular contrast in any garden setting. Acmena smithii Allyn Magic will bloom small white flowers early to late summer. This plant is relatively low maintenance as it does have a high resistance to any sort of pest attack, in particular psyllids. Popular uses for Acmena smithii Allyn Magic include hedging, topiary as well as bonsai's. Its' dwarf habit makes it ideal as a low hedge for pathways. Plant Acmena smithii Allyn Magic in an area of full sun to part shade, with free draining soil. Avoid areas exposed to heavy frost.Water regularly while establishing the plant. Use a slow release fertiliser in spring and autumn as this plant is slow growing and regular fertilising will promote new growth. Prune as desired.Acmena smithii Allyn Magic will grow to a height and width of 50cm.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree

Acmena smithii Sublime is an evergreen Australia tree. It is a Lilly Pilly so it does provide the same uses such as screening and hedging if pruned to shape. This plant has vivid lime green new growth which slowly darkens over time. In summer Acmena smithii Sublime produces an abundance of fluffy white flowers that will further develop into edible deep mauve berries. This particular variety will tolerate a variety of conditions which include cold temperatures, light frost and is also equipped with a strong resistance to psyllids. Plant Acmena smithii Sublime in well drained to heavy clay loam. Acmena smithii Sublime requires little maintenance and is suited for areas across Australia. This plant can be trimmed as desired. Slow release fertiliser can be used to encourage new growth. Acmena smithii Sublime will grow to a height of 5 metres and a width of 2-3 metres or can be pruned to maintain height and shape.
Coastal, Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Adenanthos cunninghamii prostrate is an evergreen Western Australian native that has a spreading habit.  Young branches bronze in colour and are covered by short white hairs, but these are lost with age and change colour to silver/grey. As cunninghamii is a hybrid between sercius and cuneata so it has the best of both and is ideal for coastal planting and roadside planting.  The fine furry like foliage gives a soft appearance in the garden.  Can also be used for mass planting and mixed native gardens.  Waterwise once established and is very low maintenance.Best grown in full or part shade in well drained soil.  Tolerates light frost and dry conditions.  Adenanthos cunninghamii prostrate will grow to a height of 50cm and a width of 1m.
Coastal, Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Commonly known as the Woolly Bush, Adenanthos sericeus 'Pencil Perfect' is covered in fine silver/green foliage making it appear and feel soft. This West Australian Native produces small orange flowers for most of the year, however most find the foliage more of a feature in comparison. Adenanthos sericeus 'Pencil Pefect' is ideal for contrast in gardens or landscapes. Its soft foliage will create depth and variation as it is so unique. It can also be used as a hedge or specimen shrub, and also makes a suitable alternative to a Christmas Tree if grown in a pot or container. This plant prefers to be situated in areas exposed of full and partial sun, with free draining soils. Being native, it is incredibly hardy and drought tolerant, surviving on very little water once established. Prune as desired to create shape and maintain size. Adenanthos sericeus 'Pencil Perfect' can grow to a height of 3 metres.

This West Australian Native produces small red flowers in spring to autumn, however most find the foliage more of a feature in comparison.Adenanthos sericeus 'Silver Streak' is ideal for contrast in gardens or landscapes. Prune as desired to create shape and maintain size.Adenanthos sericeus 'Silver Streak' can grow to a height of 3 metres and a width of 2.5 metres if left unpruned.

Adenanthos sericea select is a medium sized shrub or small tree with upright branches.  The narrow, grey foliage is contrasted by bright orange, tubular flowers produced for most of the year.  Ideal for gardens, windbreaks and coastal planting.Plant in a sunny to partly shaded position in  well drained soil, but will tolerate lime.  Prune after flowering to maintain compact growth.Adenanthos sericea select will grow to a height of 2-3m and a width of 2-3m.
Evergreen, Fern, Indoor Foliage, Native Australian Plant, Perennial, Shrub, Vertical Gardens

Adiantum fragrans is commonly known as the Maiden hair fern, is one of the easiest Maiden Hair ferns to grown.  This delicate and compact little fern has creeping rhizomes that produce clusters of spreading pinnate, lacy, light green fronds on shiny black stalks. It is a pretty and delicate fern beautiful in courtyards or kept as an indoor plant in a high light position.It prefers organically rich soil and to be kept moist but not soggy in semi shade positions away from the hot sun and winds.Fertilise with a mild liquid fertiliser.Adiantum fragrans can grow up to 80cm high x 80cm wide but more commonly will be much smaller.

Agapanthus 'Baby Pete' is a dwarf compact form that produces an attractive display of blue to purple flowers, sitting high on top of the foliage. This particular variety blooms weeks earlier than other Agapanthus varieties, producing brilliant colour for longer. Agapanthus Baby Pete is also sterile and is breed to not produce fertile seed.This plant is suited for an abundance of uses; some include containers, mass plantings, edging for paths or driveways. Agapanthus 'Baby Pete' is easy to grow in most soil types that are well draining, with exposure to full sun. Agapanthus Baby Pete has low water requirements and has proven to be quite drought tolerant, only needing watering during hotter periods.  A slow release fertiliser can be used in spring. Pruning is unnecessary; however removal of dead flower stems will encourage further flushes. Agapanthus Baby Pete will grow to a height of 20cm with a width of 40cm.  Flowers can be 35cm high.

Agapanthus Black Magic is a stunning Agapanthus, featuring umbrellas of blackish buds opening to deep dark purple flowers over the Summer months. The dark green foliage from which the stems emerge provides a contrasting backdrop. Ideal for borders and around tubs, containers and trees or to edge pathways or driveways.It is the perfect plant in times of drought and water restrictions. Prefers full sun to part shade position.Agapanthus Black Magic will grow to a height of 1m and a width of 75cm.

It is vigorous growing and fast clumping.This variety is bred using tissue culture to ensure uniformity and stability of floweringThe foliage is lush green with strap-like leaves.As with all agapanthus it is hardy and suited to most soil types and waterwise.

Agapanthus orientalis 'Blue' produces an attractive display of blue to purple flowers from a terminal cluster that sit high on top of the strap like foliage. This species is commonly known as the Lilly of the Nile, with it originally discovered in South Africa. This plant is suited for an abundance of uses; some include containers, mass plantings, edging for paths or driveways. Agapanthus orientalis Blue is easy to grow in most soil types that are well draining, with exposure to full sun or partial shade. Agapanthus orientalis Blue has low water requirements and has proven to be quite drought tolerant, only needing watering during hotter periods.  A slow release fertiliser can be used in spring. Pruning is unnecessary; however removal of dead flower stems will encourage further flushes. Agapanthus orientalis Blue can grow to a height of 70cm by 50cm wide.  Flowers can reach up to 1m in height.

Agapanthus 'Summer Pearl' produces larger terminal clusters that form an abundance of individual blooms of crisp white flowers. These flowers sit high on top of the strappy evergreen foliage. This particular variety has a longer flowering period starting in early summer. This species is commonly known as the Lilly of the Nile.This plant is suited for an abundance of uses; some include containers, mass plantings, edging for paths or driveways. It also makes a stand out border when in flower.  Agapanthus 'Summer Pearl' is easy to grow in most soil types, with exposure to full sun or partial sun. Agapanthus 'Summer Pearl' has low water requirements and has proven to be quite drought tolerant, only needing watering during hotter periods.  A slow release fertiliser can be used in spring. Pruning is unnecessary; however removal of dead flower stems will encourage further flushes. Agapanthus Summer Pearl can grow to a height and width of 60cm with flowers reaching over 1m high.

Agave Silver Trim PBR is a fantastic low maintenance succulent with stylish fleshy grey-green foliage, with each leaf being bordered by a striking silver border.  Silver Trim PBR forms a neat rosette forming clump with pups forming at the base. An eye catching decorative addition to any garden and looks fantastic in pots, containers and mixed succulent gardens. Prefers a sunny to partly shaded position in free draining soil.Fertilise annually with a long term, slow release fertiliser and protect from frosts.Agave Silver Trim PBR will grow to 1m high x 1m wide.
Coastal, Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Succulent, Verge
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

A truly attractive plant with eye-catching foliage and tall flowers. This particular variety is more commonly known as the Century plant as it is said to take years to flower and after doing so it dies, with smaller new plants called 'pups' appearing at the base to continue on the growth. Agave attenuata forms rosettes of green to blue leaves and will add a definite feature to any garden or landscape. Placed in a pot and Agave attenuata will last for many years, adding character and texture to the garden. It can also be used in rockeries, courtyards and embankments. Agave attenuata is best grown in a well drained soil in full sun and will tolerate long periods of dryness but does need protection from frost. Once established, Agave attenuata is reasonably low maintenance and waterwise. It can be watered once a fortnight but will still thrive in periods of dryness. Be sure to situate this plant with fair space as it does tend to lean over its trunk and will flower up to 3m high when mature. For healthy growth, fertilise with a slow release fertiliser. Agave attenuata foliagfe can grow to a height of 1.5 metres and width of 80cm.
Coastal, Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Succulent, Verge
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

Agave attenuata Boutin Blue is a handsome blue Agave that resembles a large rosetting flower, it also has a bluer and broader leaves and upright flower stalks when compared to the species.Good for poolside gardens and containers Full sun in coastal areas, provide light shade in hotter climates.  Frost tender.Agave Boutin Blue will grow to a height of 1.5m and a width of 1.5m.
Liguate - Strap-like, Petal-like Flowers Of Daisies
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Ageratum Blue is an easy to grow annual that produces masses of soft, round, fluffy blue flowers contrasting beautifully against it's deep green, glossy foliage through out spring and autumn. Ideal for full shade or part sun garden beds, boarders, rockery pockets and containers Ageratum Blue prefers well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.This compact variety of Ageratum requires very little maintenance. Pinching back the growing tips of young plants will encourage new growth and form a bushier plant producing more flowers. Prune if desired in the plants advanced stages, cutting off dead flower heads will promote further flowering.Ageratum Blue plants grow to approx. 150mm high and should be planted 150mm apart.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial

Commonly known as the West Australian Weeping Peppermint, Agonis flexuosa can be found in many backyards, gardens, landscapes across the state. This medium sized tree produces pendulous green leaves with red new growth providing a stunning contrast. It has a weeping habit and produces masses of small white flowers in spring.Agonis flexuosa is an ideal specimen tree and once mature a very useful shade tree.  Agonis flexuosa is also a tough street tree or look stunning mass planted in parklands or along pathways.  As the tree ages the trunk takes on a character of it's own and has some interesting creases and bumps.  This particular variety prefers full sun, and will thrive on the coast in sandy well drained soils, which makes it suitable to many areas in the south west. Agonis flexuosa is hardy and withstands against drought and dry conditions.Agonis flexuosa is relatively low maintenance. For best results, opt for a slow release native fertiliser and feed during early spring.Agonis flexuosa will most of the time only grow to about 10 metres high, but can sometimes reach 14m and width of 10 metres.
Coastal, Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

A Western Australian Native commonly known as the 'Burgundy' Weeping Peppermint. Often confused with Afterdark, this particular variety produces spectacularly lush foliage, with new growth shaded a deep burgundy and reflecting a crimson colour when the light shines through the foliage.  As the leaves age they change to dark green leaving the colourful highlights at the tip of the plant. When crushed, the pendulous leaves produce a subtle aroma. During late spring it houses clusters of petite white flowers that peek through the dark foliage. Agonis flexuosa 'Burgundy' can be used for screening, as a feature tree. This plant will provide stunning contrast especially when positioned amongst plants with grey foliage. Being native, Agonis flexuosa 'Burgundy' is well suited to the ever changing Australian climate. This variety tolerates salt winds, and windy conditions. Plant Agonis flexuosa Burgundy in a sunny position with well drained soils. Agonis flexuosa 'Burgundy' is requires relatively low maintenance. Water well until established. This plant does benefit from regular pruning to maintain density.Agonis flexuosa Burgundy can grow to a height of 6 metres and a width of 4 metres.
Coastal, Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Agonis flexuosa nana is a highly attractive, compact, evergreen shrub that produces willow-like foliage with red new growth. Small white flowers in Spring. A pleasant peppermint smell is emitted when leaves are crushed.Ideal as a rockery shrub, in pots or as a low hedge/screening plant.Thrives in full sun to partly shaded position, in a well drained soil. Requires little maintenance. Agonis flexuosa nana will grow to a height of 1m and a width of 1m.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Verge
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Ajuga burgundy glow is also known as bugle, there are many selections and used widely as groundcovers for shady gardens. Burgundy Glow is one of the most popular, forming a spreading mound of leaves dappled in green, cream and smoky pink. Spikes of blue flowers appear in spring. Excellent autumn and winter effect, developing rich bronze and burgundy tones. A great plant for rock gardens and mixed container plantings, Ajuga hugs the soil and chokes out weeds with its dense foliage. Not only can it withstand foot traffic, autumn leaves can easily be raked off without damaging its foliage. Excellent for edging. May be used to cover small areas Evergreen in milder climates, Ajuga will grow in almost any type of soil condition, and in part to full shade. Fertilise in spring and remove spent flowers to encourage new growth. Be sure to remove any green or bronze shoots that may appear during the growing season. Ajuga Burgundy Glow will grow to a height of 15cm and a width of 45cm.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Alcantarea imperialis rubra is a large and stunning Bromeliad variety forming a rosette of glossy, fleshy leaves that colour burgundy in high sunlight. This stunning plant flowers just once before producing offsets with a large flower spike that is covered with hundreds of flowers that take over a year to all fully open. Thrives in an open, sunny position, moist, well drained soil. Fill reservoir when watering particlarly during dry weather.Alcantarea imperialis rubra will grow to a height of 2m and a width of 1.5m
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Almonds are a large papershell nut that have a sweet flavour and are broad and oval in shape. Self pollinating variety that fruits early March. An upright growth habit and a reliable cropper.Almonds are high in fibre and nutrients, as well as being cholestrol free. Eat fresh or roasted. Harvest when the shell starts to split open. Plant in a warm, protected area in well drained soil. Make sure you plant the bud union above the soil. Water in well and keep moist until established. Fertilise when planting and again when new growth appears. prune when planting.Almond self pollinating will grow to 2m high and a width of 2m.

A beautiful statement plant that will add a tropical desert feel to any garden or landscape. Aloe Always Red produces radiant red flowers that shoot up high above the spiky green foliage. These flowers will attract birds in droves. Aloe Always Reds' name derives from the fact that it will continue to flower for up to ten months of the year, including summer, autumn and winter.  Aloe Always Red is well suited for uses such as mass plantings, rockeries, containers or as feature plants. This plant prefers to be positioned in areas of full to semi sun, with well drained soils. Aloe Always Red is equipped with a moderate frost tolerance, as well as withstanding high levels of rain. Aloe Always Red does prefer occasional watering, particularly during summer months, but is classed a waterwise alternative. Aloe Always Red can grow to a height and width of 30cm.

This tough clumping aloe produces decorative foliage that forms a stunning spiral as it ages. During winter Aloe 'Gemini' blooms masses of long lasting pale orange flowers. Aloe Gemini is well suited for uses such as mass plantings, rockeries, containers or as feature plants. This plant prefers to be positioned in areas of full sun with well drained soils. Aloe Gemini is equipped with a moderate frost tolerance, as well as withstanding high levels of rain. It is a tough perennial and can thrive in harsh landscaping conditions.Aloe Gemini does prefer occasional watering, particularly during summer months and is a Waterwise plant. Aloe 'Golly' is a 'fat' leafed succulent with raised white spots. It is fast-growing and suited to all pot sizes. Succulents are the perfect plant to brighten any home or garden, with easy care requiring minimal attention,  anyone can successfully grow and look after these stylish plants.A beautiful statement plant that will add a tropical/desert feel to any garden or landscape. Aloe Golly has  been bred for long and prolific flowering, bearing pastel red to cream bi-coloured flowers which appear in mid winter, and for adaptability to nearly all garden conditions. Aloes are an increasingly popular choice as tough, long life perennials. Best grown as a pot specimen it can be planted in beds if the position is well protected and the soil is very free draining. This plant prefers to be positioned in areas of full to semi sun. Aloe 'Golly' has a moderate frost tolerance, as well as being able to tolerate moderate levels of rain. Prefers occasional watering, particularly during summer months, but is classed a water wise alternative.

This plant prefers to be positioned in areas of full to semi sun. Aloe 'Golly' has a moderate frost tolerance, as well as being able to tolerate moderate levels of rain. Prefers occasional watering, particularly during summer months, but is classed a water wise alternative.

Alstroemeria Amina produces masses of yellow lily like blooms. This series of Alstroemeria feature compact plants, with excellent branching that will produce a greater array of blooms. In the ground it is an attractive perennial, blooming for several months. Alstroemeria Amina is a wonderful plant to liven up garden beds, or to use as a cut flower as it has an exceptionally long vase life. They can also make a striking mixed border. Fantastic in pots, or grow in a well drained soil in sheltered position. Alstroemeria Amina prefers cool, moist and deep sandy loams with exposure to full to partial sun. Alstroemeria Amina is low maintenance. Mulch soil well, especially in frosty areas. Water regularly in dry weather and fertilise with a plant food high in potassium for best blooms. Alstroemeria Amina can grow to a height of 30 centimetres and a width of 40 centimetres.

Alyogyne hakeifolia 'Melissa Anne' is commonly known as the Native Hibiscus, producing delicate tulip shaped flowers that are pink with a deep red centre. The needle-like foliage of Alyogyne hakeifolia Melissa Anne provides the perfect backdrop in order for these stunning flowers to standout.This evergreen shrub can be used in many situations including an informal hedge or in native gardens. Alyogyne hakeifolia Melissa Anne prefers full sun exposure. 'Melissa Anne' originates from the harsh desert areas of both South and Western Australia in which it thrives, that proves this plant is extremely hardy. 'Melissa Anne' is low maintenance. Water well until established, occasional infrequent watering may be required during warmer periods. If required use a native, low-phosphorous fertiliser. 'Melissa Anne' responds well to pruning which can be done after flowering. Alyogyne hakeifolia Melissa Anne can grow to a height of 3 metres and a width of 2 metres.

Alyssum Cameo is an easy to grow; low growing annual that produces masses of tiny white, pink & mauve bee attracting perfumed flowers in dense clusters over vibrant green foliage. Alyssum has an incredibly long blooming period and should be planted in spring for masses of sweet smelling flowers in summer.Ideal for garden beds, borders, rockeries, hanging baskets and pots Alyssum Cameo prefers full sun but can also be planted in partial shade. Plant in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Alyssum requires very little maintenance when growing and is typically used as a ground cover because of it's low growing nature. Prune if desired cutting back after the first flush to promote further flowering.Alyssum Cameo plants grow up to approx. 100mm high and should be planted 150mm apart.

Amaranthus Flying Colours is an easy to grow annual with brilliant vibrant Red, Yellow and Green coloured foliage. Although it does not produce any flowers this bushy, multicoloured plant will add an exciting burst of colour to any home from early summer to late autumn.Ideal for garden beds, large containers and mass plantings Amaranthus Flying Colours is best suited to a position in full sun; this really helps intensify the colour of the plant. Plant in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly until the seedlings are established then water heavily once or twice per week depending on the condition of your soil. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Amaranthus is a low maintenance plant making it perfect for beginner gardeners. Be cautious of snails and other insects that cause damage to leaves when plants are young as the foliage is the attractive attribute to the plant. Once they have finished their season the plants can be recycled into compost or mulch and redistributed in the home garden.Amaranthus Flying Colours grow up to approx. 1 metre tall and should be planted 50cm apart.

Commonly known as the Smooth Barked Apple, Angophora costata an Australian Native and found along semi-coastal locations of Queensland to New South Wales. This large spreading tree is easily recognised in winter for its rusty red new bark that eventually flakes off grey. Angophora costata produces skinny dark green leaves and showy white flowers that bloom during summer. Angophora costata makes an excellent addition to parks, gardens as well as bordering wide streetscapes. This variety tolerates a variety of soil types and is very hardy once established. Plant Angophora costata in an area exposed to full to part sun, with free draining soils. It thrives in sandy, coastal positions. Angophora costata is relatively low maintenance. Water well until established. Ensure care is taken not to position this species where its branches will overhang a house.Angophora costata can grow to a height of 10 to 30 metres and a width of 6 to 15 metres.

Antirrhinum Coronette, more commonly known as Snapdragon is an annual that produces a mix of large flowers in a range of vivid colours like white, yellow, orange and red. They can be sown at almost any time of year and can be expected to flower 15-20 weeks from seed but autumn and early spring are the optimal flowering seasons for this particular variety. Ideal for Cottage Gardens, borders, rockeries, pots and beautiful cut flowers Antirrhinum Coronette is best suited to a position in full sun and require well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water heavily and regularly for longer displays of beautiful flowers but ensure the soil does not become too wet.Antirrhinum's are very susceptible to rust caused by pathogenic fungi. To limit the risk of your plants being affected by rust avoid over head watering and treat affected plants with fungicide to control the infection. Antirrhinum Coronette grows up to approx. 45cm high and should be planted 25-30cm apart.

Antirrhinum Red & Yellow more commonly known as Snapdragon is a dwarf annual that produces a mix of densely packed red and yellow bicoloured flowers along the stem. They can be sown at almost any time of year and can be expected to flower 15-20 weeks from seed but autumn and early spring are the optimal flowering seasons for this particular variety. Ideal for cottage gardens, borders, rockeries, pots and beautiful cut flowers Antirrhinum Red & Yellow is best suited to a position in full sun and require well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water heavily and regularly for longer displays of beautiful flowers but ensure the soil does not become too wet. Antirrhinum Red & Yellow grows up to approx. 30cm high and should be planted 25-30cm apart.

A deliciously popular apple variety, stocked and widely available at your local supermarket. Apple Golden Delicious was founded in West Virginia, USA in the 19th century and has been a staple for most families ever since. This tree produces a sweet bright yellow to golden apple with slight pink blush.  Its' an excellent eating apple with crisp and creamy white flesh, which has a sweet and juicy flavour. In spring the tree will bloom clusters of pink buds revealing creamy white flowers. Grafted onto dwarf rootstock makes this Golden Delicious Apple an ideal option for small areas and backyard. The fruit are not dwarf only the tree.The Golden Delicious Apple tree is self fruiting and does not require a pollinator however will produce more fruit if used. Ideal pollinators for Golden Delicious include Red Delicious and Granny Smith. Golden Delicious prefers areas of full sun with minimal chance of shade and free draining soils.Golden Delicious is relatively low maintenance. It does thrive with regular deep watering when dry and fertilising in winter. Fruit is ready to pick when its colour turns from a pale green to a golden green, usually from autumn through to winter. This dwarf Apple Golden Delicious will grow to a height and width of 2.5 metres.

This Australian developed hybrid has stocked the shelves of supermarkets and homes since the discovery in 1868 by 'Granny' Anne Smith of Ryde, New South Wales; hence the name. It's well recognised for its tart flavour and distinctive lime green fruit. During spring an abundance of pale white to pink flowers bloom.Grafted onto dwarf rootstock, Apple Granny Smith Dwarf is well suited to small gardens and pots due to its size, but still bears full size fruit. Excellent for those wanting the best of both worlds; traditional full sized fruit produced from limited space. This deciduous tree will fruit January to May and benefits from full sun exposure. Apple Granny Smith Dwarf is relatively low maintenance. It does prefer regular deep watering when dry and complete fertilising in colder winter months. It is ideal for another apple to be planted nearby; the most well suited being Golden Delicious.Apple Granny Smith Dwarf can grow to a height and width of 2.5 metres.

This Western Australian developed hybrid was first discovered in 1973 by John Cripps, who crossed two varieties; Golden Delicious and Lady Williams. Since then it has spread across the world and is grown in 15 countries and sold across more than 30. Today it is still Australia's favourite apple. Also known as Cripps Pink, Apple Pink Lady has a pink blush over a green base. The apple itself is crisp with a dense, firm flesh and a deliciously sweet flavour. This particular apple has a high sugar content making it ideal for cooking in sauces, pies and salads. Grafted onto dwarf rootstock this dwarf variety bears full sized fruit in limited space, perfect for those with small spaces to fill. They can also be planted in pots or containers. It is an ideal fruit tree and is best positioned in an area of full to part sun exposure, with free draining soils. Pink Lady Apple trees are self-pollinating, meaning it is the only apple tree specimen you need in the garden. Use a nitrogen fertiliser annually to feed. Apple Pink Lady Dwarf can grow to a height and width of 2.5 metres.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Apple Pinkabelle PBR is a compact dwarf fruiting tree with large green foliage and small blush-white flowers that appear during spring. The fruit is pink to pale red that is similar in taste to the Pink Lady. It produces full size, export quality fruit.Great for screens, hedging and pots or large containers that look great in patio and alfresco areas.  Plant in a sunny position with well drained soil.A robust, water efficient variety.Apple Pinkabelle PBR will grow to a height of 2m and a width of 1m.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Apple Red Delicious Dwarf is a dwarf deciduous specimen, producing excellent crops of bright red, large crunchy apples. The flesh is greenish white and has a crisp texture. They are great to eat straight off the tree. Produces bright green foliage and blush white blooms during spring.Suitable for large gardens, orcharies, paddocks and large pots.To pollinate, plant alongside a Granny smith, Pink Lady or a Red Fuji.Can handle warm and cool temperatures and is tolerant of periods of frost.Apple Red Delicious Dwarf can grow to 4m high and and 2.5m wide.

A heavy fruit bearer, Apricot Divinity has a very attractive fruit with a slightly red blush. Apricots are nutritious fruit, high in Vitamin A with an incredibly sweet, juicy flavour. This particular variety is also self-pollinating.  Apricot Divinity fruit matures early in the season late December to early January.Apricot Divinity will make an excellent addition to any garden, its foliage can provide screening  or can be used as a single feature tree. This variety is susceptible to early frost but is generally drought tolerant. Plant in a well drained soil with full to partial sun exposure. Water well and keep soils moist until the tree is established. Use a slow release fertiliser when planting and again after new growth appears. Prune if desired as this will encourage new healthy growth. Apricot Divinity can grow to a height and width of 4 metres.

Apricot  Moorpark has a clean, smooth skin shaded dark orange. Apricots are a nutritious fruit, high in Vitamin A with an incredibly sweet, juicy flavour. This particular variety is also self-pollinating.  Maturing mid to late season, late January to early February.Apricot  Moorpark will make an excellent addition to any garden and can be used as a feature tree.  Plant in moist well drained soil with full to partial sun exposure. Water well and keep soils moist until the tree is established. Apricot Moorpark is not drought tolerant regular watering is recommended. Use a slow release fertiliser when planting and again after new growth appears. Prune if desired as this will encourage new healthy growth.Apricot  Moorpark can grow to a height of 9 metres with a width of 6 metres.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Aralia elegantissima is a tall upright evergreen shrub or tree with long grey-green to purple-bronze foliage and toothed margins. An excellent indoor plant or for the patio in a warm, brightly lit area, away from draughts. If planting in tropical areas, choose a partly shaded position with moist well-drained, fertile soil.Protect from frost and water moderately during dry periods.Aralia elegantissima will grow to a height of 2-3m and a width of 1m.
Coastal, Conifer, Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Commonly known as the Norfolk Island Pine, this conifer is easily identified and popularly situated throughout coastal parks and beaches. This tree produces a formal pyramid shape with dense foliage. Araucaria heterophylla has become synonymous in Australia. Its' extreme toleration to salt and wind gives Araucaria heterophylla the ability to adapt and thrive in the most demanding coastal positions. Araucaria heterophylla is also a popular indoor plant, mainly used as an indoor Christmas tree. This variety prefers full sun, with moist free draining soils; but will adapt to lesser soils. Araucaria heterophylla requires minimal maintenance. When planting, consideration is needed to allow room for both upper crown growth as well as root expansion. Water Araucaria heterophylla well until it is suitably established. Araucaria heterophylla can grow to a height of 60 metres and a width of 15 metres.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Palm/Cycad, Perennial, Tree

Archontophoenix cunninghamiana is a tall and slender palm, more commonly known as the Bangalow Palm. Archontophoenix cunninghamiana forms feather-like dark green foliage, with a smooth grey trunk. During summer through to spring Archontophoenix cunninghamiana blooms fragrant mauve flowers, followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. Archontophoenix cunninghamiana can be used as a feature tree, or mass planted along streets. This palm is also ideal for those wanting to add a tropical addition to their everyday garden. Plant Archontophoenix cunninghamiana in a warm area with exposure to full sun and well draining soils. Water Archontophoenix alexandrae well until established. If using this palm indoors, ensure that the area is well lit. This palm does require more watering in comparison to other varieties. Archontophoenix cunninghamiana can grow to a height of 20 metres with a width of 3 metres.
