Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

One of the most common Avocados varieties, Hass produces a large oval shaped fruit with dimpled skin. When ripe the skin turns from green to a dark purplish-black and yields to gentle pressure, while the flesh has a creamy texture and great taste. The fruit is high in vitamin C, antioxidents and mono-unsaturated fat.  A mature tree can flower twice a year, with the fruit taking appoximately a year to develop in size. However in years of colder weather or frosts the trees may only bear fruit every other year. After a year of low yield it may be very high the next.Partially self fertile but prefers a pollinator.Prefers moist well draining soil in a warm, frost free position.  Avocado trees can dry out quickly so keep the watering frequent during the warmer months.Avocado Haas will grow to a height of 8-12m
Coastal, Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Baeckea virgata nana is commonly known as Miniature Baeckea.  A small and compact Australian native shrub with deep green linear leaves and clusters of delicate white flowers that bloom abundantly throughout summer.This tough plant is an excellent choice for shrubberies, rockeries, containers and low hedges; providing a suitable habitat for small native birds such as wrens and finches. For optimum results, position is a sunny to partly shaded position, tolerates most soil types as well as periods of drought and frost.Prune well after flowering to maintain a compact shape and promote fresh new growth.Baeckea virgata nana will grow to a height of 50cm and a width of 50cm.
Bamboo, Evergreen, Grasses, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

A very tidy form of bamboo, straight, thin-walled and strong dense clumping form. Graceful, pretty foliage, uniform and upright, Gracilis has a lovely classic bamboo look. Also suitable for container planting as can be invasive. Also it can be a lovely landscaping feature.Ideal for screening, is fast growing reaching up to 6 meters in 2 years, without taking up too much ground space. Base will grow to approx 1m wide but Gracilis will not mind been contained in an area only 50cm wide.  Great screen against noise pollution, and headlights etc.This bamboo originates from China, is a lush green colour with flowers that are rather insignificant and often hidden. Most popular variety grown in Australia.Bamboo can be planted anytime of the year although warmer times are recomended. Frequent watering after planting and much less once established. Will thrive on most fertilisers.
Evergreen, Herb, Outdoor, Perennial, Seedling, Shrub, Vertical Gardens
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Basil Aristotle is a very compact Greek basil with small leaves and neat habit. Basil is great for the home herb or vegetable garden and can be planted in pots and hanging baskets. The leaves can be used fresh or dried in salads, sandwiches, wraps, soups, tomato egg and cheese dishes. Keep Basil Aristotle moist in a warm climate and protect from frost. Before planting, mix in compost and complete garden fertiliser. For best results liquid feed regularly.Basil Aristotle is a very compact form only growing to a height and width of 30cm

A mix of Sweet Basil, Purple, Thai and Aristotle Keep Basil moist in a warm climate and protect from frost. Before planting, mix in compost and complete garden fertiliser. For best results liquid feed regularly.
Annual, Evergreen, Herb, Outdoor, Seedling, Vertical Gardens
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Basil Sweet is a popular herb with bright green glossy foliage. It is ideal for use in almost any dish including pasta, pizza, seafood chicken, soups and salad.Basil Sweet is best grown in warm to hot climates as it is sensitive to cold and frost.  In colder areas grow Basil Sweet in pots on the window sill to keep warm.  Plant is full sun to part shade with protection from winds.  Will benefit from rich moist soils.Basil Sweet will grow up to 45cm high and 30cm wide.
Coastal, Deciduous, Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

A small evergreen tree, Bauhinia variegata alba has an open upright growth habit and bears striking creamy-white flowers which are very orchid-like in appearance with a beautiful aromatic fragrance. This variety flowers in spring and intermittently in summer, followed by flattened brown seed pods. Bauhinias all have the characteristic 2-lobed leaves which when combined with the decorative flowers makes for a very decorative addition to any garden.Bauhinias are highly suitable as a display feature. They like full sun, a warmer climate, and a light well-drained fertile soil suits them best. Water well until established but then they are reasonably drought tolerant. Pruning is not usually neccessary although vigerous growth can be thinned after flowering, otherwise minimal or little maintenance is required.Bauhinia purpurea can grow 4.5 to 8 m and will eventually have a reasonable spread to 6m.
Lilaceous - Like The Blossom Of A Lily In General Form

Bauhinia x blakeana (Hong Kong Orchid Tree) is a striking evergreen tree that displays a rounded, spreading canopy composed of large, thick green bilobed leaves that grow to 7-10cm long and 10-13cm wide.Fragrant liliaceous pink-purple flowers bloom from late spring until early autumn, the large elegant flowers are 10-15cm in size.An excellent feature tree for medium to large gardens and for mass plantings in parks. An ideal specimen for coastal climates where it is protected from winds. Drought and frost tolerant once established.Suitable for full sun to partly shaded positions, however optimal growth will occur when planted in a area that receives direct overhead sunlight.Bauhinia x blakeana will grow to a height of 8m and a width of 5m.
Coastal, Evergreen, Grasses, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf
Panicles/Tubular - The Corolla Forms A Tube

Baumea articulata  is an attractive native sedge, it has drooping flowers/seed heads and bamboo-like stems on older growth. Flowering from spring to early autumn. It is excellent for water features and is a great habitat plant for nesting bird life.  It grows in water to 1m deep and likes either full sun or semi-shade. Great for boggy areas, ponds, dams, very hardy and long lived. No maintenance required. May be trimmed back (about 1/3 of leaf) if desired.Baumea articulata can grow to a height of 2.5m.
Annual, Climber, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Vegetable
Papilionaceous - Resembles A Butterfly, Pea Family
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Broan Beans or Fava Beans are easy to grow vegetables, ideal for the home garden. Broad beans can be used as a side dish or in salads.They will produce an abdundant crop of highly nutritious beans throughout Spring. Although they prefer a well- drained soil, the crop will tolerate heavier soils than other vegetables.Broad Bean will grow to around 1.5m tall with support and grow to 40cm wide
Climber, Coastal, Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Palm/Cycad, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Verge

Beaucarneas are a very intriguing looking plant, featuring a swollen stem base, a thickened central palm-like trunk, topped with long, thin, grass-like leaves up to 1 meter long. Their flowers, once the plant has reached more than 1 metre, are numerous, small and white flowers are borne on large panicles arising from the centre of the leaf rosettes. Occasionally the flowers can be followed by pinkish, three-winged fruit. Pony tail will have a single trunk until they reach approx 1meter and may then sprout new shoots. This will also happen if the top is removed or cut off.Ponty Tail Palms can be used as an indoor plant in a pot if have plenty of light, florishing well in a heated atmosphere.   In pots Pony Tail Palms might only reach a height of 1m. Outdoors these "palms" prefer a well-drained fertile soil in a sunny protected position. Water well while growing and sparingly during colder months or the stem may rot. Little or no maintenance required, just the removal of old leaves which generally shed naturally.Very old specimens can reach massive dimensions, the swollen base up to 3.5 metres wide with multiple trunks up to 4.5 meters plus tall. These are rare as Beaucarnea recurvata is very slow growing.
Beautifully sweet roots and deep purple leaves. This heirloom looks as good as it tastes.
Annual, Fruiting, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Verge

Diggers Beetroot mix feature a selection of the following varieties: Chioggia, Burpees Golden, White Blankoma and Bulls Blood. Chioggia makes an interesting addition to any dish with its concentric red and white stripes.Beetroot is a nutritious root crop vegetable belonging to the same family as spinach and chard meaning both the leaves and roots can be eaten. The leaves, which have a slight bitter taste are rich in calcium, iron, vitamin A and vitamin C and can be prepared and served in the same ways as spinach. It is an excellent source of fibre, potassium and folic acid and although can be eaten raw in salads, sandwiches and wraps, it is typically eaten cooked or pickled.Requiring a position in full sun, Beetroot should be planted in well-drained soil that has been that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Plant Beetroot along side Onions, Silverbeet, Kohlrabi, Lettuce, Cabbage and Dwarf BeansBeetroot reaches maturity at 8-10weeks and should be planted 15cm apart.
Annual, Fruiting, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Verge
This beetroot boasts exceptionally sweet roots and leaves. Ideal for salads and for messy eaters as it doesnt bleed as much as a normal red beetroot.
Annual, Fruiting, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Vegetable

Beetroot is a nutritious root crop vegetable belonging to the same family as spinach and chard meaning both the leaves and roots can be eaten. The leaves, which have a slight bitter taste are rich in calcium, iron, vitamin A and vitamin C and can be prepared and served in the same ways as spinach. The root is round, sweet and typically deep purple in colour. It is an excellent source of fibre, potassium and folic acid and although can be eaten raw in salads, sandwiches and wraps, it is typically eaten cooked or pickled.Requiring a position in full sun, Beetroot should be planted in well-drained soil that has been that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Plant Beetroot along side Onions, Silverbeet, Kohlrabi, Lettuce, Cabbage and Dwarf Beans.Beetroot reaches maturity at 8-10weeks and should be planted 15cm apart.
Begonia mix hanging basket has succulent green or brown stems, with small pink and white flowers.
Silver Lady Fern / Lucky Lady Fern
Evergreen, Fern, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Blechnum Silver Lady is a stunning medium growing fern which will develop a solitary black trunk to 90cm tall topped by a large neat rosette of fronds 60 to 90cm long and up to 30cm wide. The many soft, fresh green, gracefully arching fronds have numerous narrow segments only slightly narrower on the spore-bearing fronds. The new growth on this lush tropical fern can be pink to bronze in colour and provide an attractive contrast to the silver-green mature fronds.Silver Lady is the perfect specimen for your tropical look garden, in decorative containers, indoors or in the bathroom, or even in outdoor living areas as this very elegant fern will tolerate warm air more than most ferns. This easy-to-grow fern thrives in sheltered, moist areas, the edge of ponds and streams being highly favoured. They prefer humus-rich soil and part shade, are low maintenance, removing spent fronds, and enjoy regular slow-release fertilising.Silver Lady grows to 1.2m tall and up to 1m wide.

Blueberry Sunshine Blue has a dense, rounded, semi-dwarf form with glossy silvery-green leaves which are semi-evergreen and a gorgeous purple-red colour appears in autumn. In spring masses of hot pink flowers which gradually fade to white, grace the lovely branches followed by lots of berries.It is self pollinating so you only need to grow one and is easy to grow. A great choice for a container.Best in full sun or part shade in moist, well drained, acidic soil rich in organic matter.Blueberry Sunshine Blue will grow to a height and width of 3-4ft.
Climber, Coastal, Deciduous, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Bougainvillea x hybrid Mary Palmer is a vigorous evergreen climber with large green elliptic  foliage and a profusion of reddish-purple papery bracts that contain three small cream salverform flowers.  The flowers are diplayed over a long period.Bougainvillea's are colourful semi deciduous climbing plants with long lasting flowers that will add a tropical feel to any garden setting. Ideal for climbing over garden structures and for screening walls, fences and unsightly structures.Thrives in a warm and sunny position with well drained soil.  For best results keep the soil moist, however it is able to tolerate short periods of dryness once established.  It is important to plant Bougainvillea's in a position where they will be protected from frost damage.Prune after flowering to promote fresh new growth and continuous blooms.  Mulching the soil will help to preserve moisture in the soil.  For optimum results apply a low nitrogen fertiliser during spring.Bougainvillea x hybrid Mary Palmer will grow to a height of 6m and a width of 5m.
Deciduous, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring

Brachychiton rupestris is a semi-deciduous small to medium sized tree with a distinctive bottle-shaped trunk. The leaves are green and about 100 mm long and may have entire margins or be deeply lobed. The bell-shaped yellow flowers are followed by seed capsules which contain many large seeds. A magnificent looking tree for lawns or large parks and gardens. Prefers a sunny, open position in well drained soil. Fertilise in spring. It requires a large space as this tree can can grow quite large.Brachychiton rupestris will grow to a height of 15m and a width of 5m.
Coastal, Deciduous, Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Breynia nivosa rosea is an attractive and hardy foliage plant with distinct pink, white and green variegated foliage that have a mottled appearance and are ovately shaped.The highly ornamental foliage makes a colourful addition to any garden setting, particularly when planted en masse to create a distinctive hedge or when used as a feature plant in pots and containers.  Nivosa rosea prefers a sunny to partly shaded position in warm, humid conditions with moist, well drained soil.  Protect from frost.For best results water regularly and apply a complete fertiliser during the spring growing period.Breynia nivosa rosea will grow to a height of 1.2m and a width of 1m.
Annual, Fruiting, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Verge

A delicious vegetable brought about by crossing Broccoli with Kailan which produces long, slender, sweet shoots with an edible floret. Cut out the terminal head when it is about the size of a 50 cent coin. The plant will start producing primary shoots a few weeks later. Secondary shoots or florets can be harvested when approximately 20cms long for about 2-4 weeks. Up to 7 harvests can be obtained. Keep feeding plants throughout this period to prolong shooting.

Buxus microphylla japonica is a compact evergreen shrub with bright green, leathery obovate leaves. An excellent specimen shrub for formal gardens, hedging and topiary. Plant as a feature in decorative pots and containers to add lush greenery to a patio setting.This hardy variety excels in warm climates in a full sun to partly shaded position with moist, well drained soil. Requires regular watering during periods of drought.Prune regularly to maintain compact growth.Buxus microphylla japonica will grow to a height of 2m and a width of 2m.

Cabbage Savoy is a large, flat-domed cabbage with attractive, crinkled leaves. It can be eaten raw or steamed and tastes great in salads, sandwiches, wraps and Asian cuisine or as a tasty vegetable side fried with bacon and onion.Requiring a position in full sun, Cabbage Savoy should be planted in well-drained soil that has been that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Plant Cabbage Savoy alongside Beans, Beetroot. Celery, Mint, Thyme, Sage, Onions, Rosemary, Dill, Potatoes, Chamomile, Oregano, Nasturtiums, Tansy and CorianderCabbage Savoy reaches maturity at 11-14 weeks and should be planted 50cm apart

Calendula, often referred to as the Winter Marigold is a very tough winter plant whose foliage is slightly scented and is light green in colour. The variety Bon Bon produces an array beautiful yellow, orange, apricot and lemon coloured followers during autumn, spring and summer. Ideal for beddings, borders, containers, garden beds, cottage gardens and mass displays of annuals Calendula Bon Bon requires a position in full sun to achieve best results but ensure plants are protected from the intense heat of the afternoon sun during summer. Plant in a well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to develop large plants with good flowering potential.Calendula Bon Bon flowers are edible and used in a variety of salads and other forms of cooking to add a subtle spicy flavour to many dishes. Pinch blooms as they die off to encourage more growth and lengthen the flowering period. Prune flowers when they are well formed before the petals open up too far to achieve beautiful cut flowers.Calendula Bon Bon grows approx. 30cm high and should be planted 15-20cm apart.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point
Million Bells TM Bouquet Deep Red

Calibrachoa Bouquet Deep Red produces bright green lanceolate shaped foliage and masses of beautiful deep red flowers that bloom continuously from spring through to autumn. The Million bells series are fast growing small perennials that are versatile and impressive, forming either a mounding or trailing habit. An abundance of small petunia-like funnel form flowers are displayed in an array of colours throughout the warmer months. Their low maintenance and sun loving nature means they perform with little attention. An excellent specimen for hanging baskets, pots, containers and border plantings. They require a full sun position with well drained soil. Tolerant of heat and periods of light frost. Calibrachoa Bouquet Deep Red will grow to a height and width of 30cm.
Lanceolate - Pointed At Both Ends/Subulate - Tapering Point, Awl-shaped

Callistemon All Aglow is an upright, evergreen shrub with luminous pink new growth, which contrasts beautifully against the deep green mature foliage. Pinky-red bottle brush flowers bloom throughout spring.Grows best in a sunny to partly shaded position with well drained soil and is adaptable to most soil types.Ideal for hedging, screening, feature plant and container growing. Tolerates periods of frost and heat. Lightly prune to maintain shape if required.Callistemon All Aglow will grow to a height of 2.5m and a width of 1-1.5m.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Callistemon Captain Cook was named to commemorate the 200th anniversary of Captain James Cook's discovery of the east coast of Australia in 1770. This Australian native is one of the most popular bottlebrush cultivars, with dense evergreen foliage that bears clusters of bright red flowers at the ends of its branches during spring.This brilliant waterwise, bird attracting shrub will make an excellent addition to any garden or landscape. Suggested uses include screening, hedging and a low maintenance shrub for  small native gardens. Callistemon Captain Cook will tolerate drought, moderate frost and poor soils. Callistemon Captain Cook will thrive in a sunny to a slightly partly shaded position in well-drained soils. Prune after flowering to promote new growth.Callistemon Captain Cook can grow to a height and width of 1.5 metres.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Callistemon salignus Great Balls of Fire is an easy to grow, low maintenance Australian native that is grown for its striking foliage.  The green red lancolate foliage continues to produce intense red new growth throughout the year, emerging atop of the mature green foliage to create a dramatic contrasting effect.Ideal for use as an ornamental hedge, container plant or a colourful addition to native garden displays.  Great Balls of Fire is a hardy, drought and heat tolerant variety.  Plant in most well drained soils in a full sun position.Waterwise, soak only during periods of extended heat.  Prune as required to achieve fresh new growth.  Apply a native fertiliser during spring to prolong plant health and encourange new growth.Callistemon salignus Great Balls of Fire will grow to a height of 1.75m and a width of 1.75m.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree

Attract nectar-loving birds to your garden with the eye-catching small tree Callistemon 'Kings Park Special'. Throughout spring and periodically through autumn, Callistemon Kings Park Special forms masses of large pendulous, bright red bottlebrush flowers.This evergreen shrub will make an excellent addition to any garden or landscape. Suggested uses include screening, hedging, street tree, low maintenance and small native gardens. Callistemon 'Kings Park Special' will thrive in a sunny position in well-drained soils. Callistemon are hardy, adaptable shrubs that will tolerate the poorest soils and withstand water-logging for extended periods. They are also strong against moderate coastal exposure and short periods of dryness.Callistemon 'Kings Park Special' is waterwise and has a low water requirement once established.  Prune after flowering to promote strong new growth. Callistemon Kings Park Special can grow to a height of 4 metres and width of 4 metres.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Callistemon Little Jet PBR is a small to medium sized shrub with a compact, upright form and dense green foliage. Small red flowers appear along the stems throughout spring, and red tinged new growth will appear in the cooler months making a great contrast against the rich green foliage. Great for a hedge or feature plant, coastal gardens, poolside and low maintenance gardens in a sunny or light shade position with well drained soil.  Drought resistant and tolerates light frost.Callistemon Little Jet will grow to a height of 1-1.8m and a width of 1.2-1.8m
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Bred using the two species; Callistemon Captain Cook and Callistemon Little John, Callistemon Matthew Flinders adopts the dwarf, compact growth habit of Little John along with the leaf of Captain Cook.  Throughout spring and autumn, Callistemon Matthew Flinders forms masses of large, bright red bottlebrush flowers.This evergreen, bird attracting shrub will make an excellent addition to any garden or landscape. Suggested uses include screening,hedging, rockeries, low maintenance and small native gardens. Callistemon Matthew Flinders will thrive in a sunny position in well-drained soils. Callistemon are hardy, adaptable shrubs that will tolerate the poorest soils and withstand water-logging for extended periods. They are also strong against moderate coastal exposure and short periods of dryness.Callistemon Matthew Flinders is waterwise and has a low water requirement once established. Prune after flowering to promote strong new growth. Callistemon Matthew Flinders can grow to a height of 75 cm and width of 50 cm.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

Callistemon Wee Johnnie  is a hardy low maintenance, compact shrub with attractive grey foliage and mass bottlebrush red flowers which appear from middle to late spring. Ideal for mass planting, general landscape and home backyard garden use. Plant in a full sun to light shade position, adaptable to a range of soil types from sandy to well drained soils.  Water well until established and prune as required. Low water requirements once established, prune when necessary to maintain a compact shape.Callistemon Wee Johnnie grows to a height and width of 0.5m-1m.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Callistemon viminalis Better John is a small native shrub bred from the popular Little John. Fresh new growth is almost silver with the mature foliage is blue-green, contrasting well with the red cylindrical flowers when they appear in mid to late spring. Better John is a faster growing variety than Little John and is quicker to establish, this variety will reach its full height potential when well maintained, however when planted in tough roadside conditions, growth will be hindered. Better John is ideal for mass planting, general landscape and home backyard garden use. Plant in a full sun to light shade position, adaptable to a range of soil types from sandy to well drained soils. Better John is drought tolerant and has low to moderate frost tolerance. Water well until established and prune as required. Low water requirements once established, prune when necessary to maintain a compact shape. Callistemon viminalis Better John will grow to a height of 60cm - 1.2m and a width of 60 - 90cm.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Callistemon viminalis Green John is a compact dwarf variety with light green fresh new growth that contrasts well with the mature lanceolate shaped grey-green leaves. The red cylindrical flowers have a high impact against the foliage when they appear in mid to late spring. Green John is a faster growing variety than Little John and is quicker to establish, this variety will reach its full height potential when well maintained, however when planted in tough roadside conditions, growth will be hindered.Green John is ideal for mass planting, general landscape and home backyard garden use.Plant in a full sun to light shade position, adaptable to a range of soil types from sandy to well drained soils. Green John is drought tolerant and has low to moderate frost tolerance. Water well until established and prune as required.Low water requirements once established, prune when necessary to maintain a compact shape.Callistemon viminalis Green John will grow to a height of 0.6-1m and a width of 0.6m.
Evergreen, Native West Australian Plant, Perennial, Shrub
Acicular - Needle Shaped/Rosette Of Thickened Fleshy Leaves

Calothamnus graniticus is an erect, rounded West Australian native shrub with pine-like, dark, grey-green foliage and usually bright red flowers. It's leaves are cylindrical in shape and covered with short, white hairs giving the leaves a greyish tinge. The flowers are usually bright red but can sometimes be a cream colour flowering late autumn and through winter. This attractive shrub is best suited in a sunny position with well drained soil.  It is especially useful for controlling soil erosion and is an excellent specimen for beachside areas, roadside plantings and rural properties. It can become rather woody with age especially when carrying many seed capsules, but it responds to hard pruning and will tolerate extended dry periods once establishedCalothamnus graniticus will grow to a height and width of 1-2m.

Calothamnus hirsutus is easily recognised by the prominent hairs on the leaves that gives the plant an attractive, smokey appearance. It is a fairly slow-growing plant that is often less than a metre high. It forms a compact, multi-branched spreading shrub. The flowers are bright red but often held within the foliage. They contain nectar and are bird attracting to honey eating birds. Flowers are followed by large woody seed capsules which retain the seed for many years. The older stems thicken and are often corky. It will tolerate extended dry periods once established.
One Sided Bottlebrush, Common Net Brush
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree, Verge

Calothamnuis quadrifidus ia a tall ornamental Australian native shrub with grey-green needle like acicular leaves and a mass of spectacular red cylindrical flowers that bloom in abundance from late spring through to summer.This highly ornamental shrub is ideal for screening, hedging, windbreaks and is bird attracting.Quadrifidus is especially useful for controlling soil erosion and is an excellent specimen for beachside areas, roadside plantings and rural properties.Plant in a sunny to partly shaded position in well drained soil.  Tolerates coastal conditions, wind and drought.Prune after flowering to maintain a compact habit and encourage healthy new growth.Calothamnus quadrifidus will grow to a height of 2.5m and a width of 2.5m.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial

Calothamnus quadrifidus prostrate is a Western Australian plant from the southern regions. Growing naturally in a dry summer climate makes this an excellent plant for native gardens, rockeries and verge planting. Being very adaptable to a range of environmental and growing conditions it is suitable for use along the coast and windy situations, as well as some humid locations. The grey-green needle-like leaves are about 30mm long and 1-2mm wide and are usually hairy giving the foliage a lovely soft appearance. Unusual red/scarlet flower clusters are produced over a long period and are noticeably bird-attracting.  The common name - One sided Bottlebrush - alludes to the arrangement of the flowers in the inflorescence which line up along one side of the stem. Very hardy, minimal maintenance required and drought tolerant once established. Plant in a warm, sunny open position. Performs best with regular composting and the occasional application of a complete or balanced fertilizer.CALOTHAMNUS quadrifidus prostrate grows to a height of 0.8m and a width of 2m.
A mix of heirloom capsicums including Chinese Giant, Mini Yellow, Mini Sweet Chocolate and Mini Red.

Capsicum Yolo Wonder is a sweet, green, bell-shaped capsicum, which turns red on maturity. Capsicums are extremely versatile fruits that are rich in Vitamin C. They can be eaten raw on their own or in salads or cooked in stir-fries. Other methods include frying, roasting, stuffing, pickling and incorporating into salsas and other sauces. Requiring a position in full sun, Capsicums should be planted in well-drained soil that has been that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Plant Capsicums alongside Carrots, Onions and TomatoesCapsicums reach maturity at 11-14 weeks and should be planted 30cm apart
Red New Zealand, Trip Me Up
Evergreen, Grasses, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Carex testacea is a New Zealand native perennial hedge that forms mounds of olive-green and reddish-yellow foliage that turns orange-brown in autumn,iIdeal for pond margins, as an edging plant, in pots and containers and perfect for landscaping and mass plantingGrow in a sunny position in moist, well drained soil. Tolerant of a wide range of conditions including exposed and frosty sites.

Carnation Chabaud produce a spectacular mix of large, double flowers in a vibrant blend of red, rose, yellow and white. Plant in spring for stunning blooms with a subtle fragrance through summer.Ideal for pots, borders, cottage gardens and beautiful cut flowers Carnation Chabaud should be planted in a position in full sun in rich, well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly keeping the soil moist, adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil. Carnation Chabaud's petals are edible and used in a variety of salads and other forms of cooking to add colour and a clove like taste to many dishes. Pinch blooms as they die off to encourage more growth and lengthen the flowering period. Prune flowers when they are well formed before the petals open up too far to achieve beautiful cut flowers.Carnation Chabaud grows approx. 50cm high and should be planted 30-35cm apart.

Carrot Baby is a nutritious root crop of slender, sweet and crisp carrots, ideal for the home garden. For best reaults ensure the carrots are planted in a deep, well prepared bed of humas rich, well structured soil, topped with a layer of mulch. Baby carrots should be harvested early, if left for too long a period they will grow into larger carrots and lose their sweet characteristics. Carrot Baby makes a delicious vegetable side-dish to any meal, or can be used in soups,and casseroles or grated into sandwiches and wraps.
Carrot Rainbow is a mix of Purple, Yellow, Red, White and Orange carrots. They are great for adding some colour to a salad or even by them selves as a side dish.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Casuarina cunninghamiana is an Australian native commonly found along the Northern Territory, Queensland and New South Wales. The name 'Casuarina' originates from the word 'cassowary' - Casuarina cunninghamiana are recognised for their fine needle-like foliage that look like the feathers of a bird. Casuarina cunninghamiana is an ideal tree for river banks, coastal, screening, urban plantings and is commonly used as a windbreak. Plant Casuarina cunninghamiana in an area of full sun, with well drained soils. Once established, Casuarina cunninghamiana is waterwise and can tolerate drought, frost, seasonal water logging and moderate salinity.Casuarina cunninghamiana is a fast-growing, bird attracting tree that requires low maintenance, only needing watering occasionally through warmer months. Casuarina cunninghamiana can grow to a height of 30 metres and a width of 12 metres.

Cauliflower All Year Round is a quick growing, flavoursome vegetable that produces a crisp, edible white flower head. High in vitamin B, C and K and low in fat, carbohydrates and protein Cauliflower All Year can be enjoyed either raw or cooked and can be blanched, frozen, roasted and pickled. Requiring a position in full sun Cauliflower should be planted in well-drained soil that has been that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Plant Cauliflower alongside Beans and CeleryCauliflowers reach maturity at 8-10 weeks and should be planted 45cm apart.

Celery provides continuous, crispy, green stems over several months. It is low calories, and can be eaten in soups, stews, hot dishes, and salads or enjoyed as a snack with dip.Requiring a position in full sun, Capsicums should be planted in well-drained soil that has been that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Plant Celery alongside Tomatoes, Dill. Beans, Leeks, Cabbage, CauliflowersCelery reaches maturity at 12-14 weeks and should be planted 20cm apart.

Unusual shape and eye catching colour this novelty Celosia is great for adding colour and drama to landscapes. Planting this variety in the sun will create a darker foliage and flower than growing in the shade.

This amazing plant offers excellent contrast in any garden with it's beautifully vibrant red-green foliage and blazing red, long-lasting, feathery, plume-like flowers. A very versatile upright growing plant, Celosia 'Dragon's Breath' is perfect in patio containers, mass planted in garden beds and larger landscapes alike, requiring minimal upkeep for high impact.This lovely plant copes well in hot and humid conditions and can perform well under adverse garden conditions.Dragon's Breath is also ideal as added contrast in your cut flower arrangements.

Celosia Formula 'flowers' have one central spike of large, feathery plumes surrounded by several smaller ones. They come in a mix of vibrant colours from orange, red, yellow and pink and add a spectacular splash of colour to any home garden, blooming during spring and summer.Ideal for pots, borders, rockeries and beautiful cut flowers Celosia Formula should be planted in a position in full sun in rich, well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly until the seedlings are established then water heavily once or twice per week. Add mulch on top of your garden bed to help retain moisture in the soil.Celosia Formula makes excellent cut flowers. Plumes can also be hung upside down to dry out and then used as decoration in bouquets and dried flower arrangements. Once they have finished their season the plants can be recycled into compost or mulch and redistributed in the home garden.Celosia Formula mix is a dwarf variety of Celosia that grows approx. 20cm high and should be planted 15-20cm apart.
Dwarf variety that makes it great for pots or mass plantings for colour in your garden.

This variety of Cercis has bright green foliage resembling a 'stacked plate' arrangement which is quite unique. Multi branched as are the other varieties, this is a little more upright in form.Deep pink flower clusters appear on the bare stems and branches followed by heart shaped dark green leaves.After flowering attractive purple seed pods appear that add an additional decorative feature into summer.The foliage is also excellent for floral and foliage displays as well as an ideal specimen tree in those smaller gardens.

Cercis canadensis Forest Pansy is a small, compact deciduous tree with stunning deep purple heart shaped cordate foliage that matures to bronze-red over time.  A mass of rosy-pink libiate flowers emerge from magenta buds during spring, providing a colourful display of colour.A superb small tree that is an excellent choice for small areas and landscape designs where a colourful, elegant, feature foliage tree is required. Forest Pansy requires well drained, fertile soil to really be at its best and a position where it benefits from full sun.Benefits from an application of lime during autumn.  Water well during periods of dry weather.Cercis canadensis Forest Pansy will grow to a height of 3m and a width of 3m.
Chilli Mild has long, hot golden fruits. It is ideal for the home vegetable garden. Chilli Mild can be used in salads or cooked dishes. It is ideal for Asian cooking.

The Serrano Chilli is a Mexican chilli, producing small finger shaped fruit. A prolific bearer, the peppers are very hot when green and extremely hot when red. Chilli Serrano can be used fresh or in hot dishes to add spicy flavour. Before planting, mix in compost and complete garden fertiliser. For best results liquid feed regularly. Caution: When preparing chillis do not touch face or eyes and wash hands afterwards.

Chilli Trinidad Scorpion Cardi comes from the Trinidad Scorpion species and earnt its name due to its pointed end, resembling much like a scorpions stinger. It is yellow in colour, and was ranked the hottest chilli for 3 years until the Carolina Reaper became the hottest in 2012.

Also known as piri piri, the chilli plant is bushy with long leaves and the fruits can grow up to 8-10cm long. Chilli's are green in colour while young and turn red as they mature. Piri Piri Chilli grows well in pots or the garden in moist soil.
Herb, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Vertical Gardens
Garlic Chives are a herb with grass-like leaves. They have a tasty, mild garlic flavour. Add chopped garlic chives to egg dishes, cheese, dips or garnish baked potatoes, salads and soups
Herb, Outdoor, Seedling, Shrub, Vertical Gardens
Chives are a clumpng perennial with edible leaves which have a mild onion flavour. Chives are great as a garnish or for flavouring salads, dips, sandwiches, wraps and soups.

Chrysanthemum Snowland is a hardy annual that is traditionally given as Mothers Day gifts in Australia, either as a potted plant or in a bunch of flowers. Flowering through autumn and summer; Chrysanthemum Snowland produces masses of large, Daisy-like, pure white flowers with yellow centres that make attractive cut flowers. Ideal for pots, garden beds, containers and mass planting in the garden Chrysanthemum Snowland should be planted in full sun to partial shade in a rich, well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly keeping the soil moist, adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil. Chrysanthemum Snowland grows approx. 40cm high and should be planted 25cm apart.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Citrus aurantifolia Sublime is a compact, dwarf evergreen lime tree that is virtually thornless. The bright green lanceolate foliage is complimented by creamy white rotate flowers during winter.  Flowers are followed by the appearance of full size, round juicy fruits with thin, deep green skin.An excellent variety for pots which are perfect for enhancing patio, courtyard and balconies.  The fruit can be used for cooking and added to drinks for enhanced flavour.Tolerates a variety of temperatures and soil types, sublime is a very versatile specimen.For best results, plant in a full fun position with moist well drained soil.Fertilise annually with a  long term slow release citrus fertiliser.Citrus aurantifolia Sublime will grow to a height of 1.5m and a width of 1m.

Cockscomb produce a crested head of upright, feathery flowers, in an assortment of bright colours ranging from red and pink to yellow that resembles a rosters comb. Their beautiful flowers make an interesting addition to any garden and can be expected to bloom throughout late summer to late autumn.Ideal for garden beds, borders, rockeries, containers, mass plantings and cut flowers Cockscomb should be planted in a position in full to partial shade and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly until the seedlings are established then water heavily once or twice per week. Add mulch on top of your garden bed to help retain moisture in the soil.Although they don't have any fragrance, they maintain their shape when dried making them a perfect addition to dried floral arrangements as a cut flower.Cockscomb grows to approx. 1 metre high and should be planted 20-30cm apart.

Coleus is a tropical plant, grown in summer for its variously coloured foliage. It has dark red/burgundy leaves with a narrow yellow/green margin. Performs best in moist, well drained soil in shaded locations. This plant is heat tolerant, but not really drought tolerant. Can be used in shady outdoor spots or indoors in warmer climates.
Cream, Green, Maroon, Orange, Pink, Red, Yellow

Coleus, mostly used as a bright, multicoloured foliage plant, produces beautiful leaves in various different shades of pink, maroon, green, red, cream, yellow and orange. Ideal for garden beds, borders, rockeries, containers and mass plantings Coleus should be planted in a warm, partly shaded position in the garden or a position in full fun with ample moisture provided. Plant in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly with copious amounts of water to keep the foliage production strong. Add mulch on top of your garden bed to help retain moisture in the soil.Coleus does also produce small, blue spiked blooms amongst it's foliage throughout spring and summer but these are usually pinched back to keep the plant looking uniform.Coleus grows to approx. 30-40cm high and should be planted 25-30cm apart.

Coleus is a tropical plant, grown in summer for its variously coloured foliage. It has dark velvet red leaves with a narrow yellow/white margin. Performs best in moist, well drained soil in shaded locations. This plant is heat tolerant, but not really drought tolerant. Can be used in shady outdoor spots or indoors in warmer climates.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Perennial, Vertical Gardens
Tubular - The Corolla Forms A Tube

Convolvulus Full Moon is a trailing perennial with small leaves and many large lavender blue open, trumpet shaped flowers from spring to autumn. Perfect for covering banks, rockeries, cottage gardens, hanging baskets and containers. Trim and feed with a complete fertiliser to promote new growth. Prefers a full sun position
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Perennial, Vertical Gardens
Funnelform - The Corolla Shaped Like A Funnel

Convolvulus cneorum is a hardy, evergreen shrub with silky, silver-grey lancolate shaped foliage.  During spring and summer, masses of pink buds emerge, followed by large white funnelform flowers with yellow centres.Perfect for white or silver themed gardens, borders, containers and coastal areas.Thrives in a sunny position in moist, well drained soil.  Tolerant of light shade and dry periods, once established.  Lightly pruning to remove spent flowers as this will prolong flowering.Convolvulus cneorum will grow to a height of 40cm and a width of 60cm.

Coprosma Middlemore is a hardy evergreen shrub with a compact habit and small vibrant glossy green leaves. Ideal for mixed borders, water wise gardens, pots and containers. Prefers a position in full sun with well drained soil but is able to tolerate part shade, periods of drought, light frosts and coastal conditions. For best results, prune during late winter and feed with an application of long term slow release fertiliser.Coprosma Middlemore will grow to a height and width of 1m.
Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Tree

Cordyline Black Knight is a stunning evergreen, palm like tree forming a single truck. Featuring attractive long purplish-black leaves.  Foliage has an upright habit with year round display of colourful foliage. Ideal for adding a mediterranean or tropical feel in the garden. Perfect for pation containers and landscaping.Black Knight thrives in full sun to light shade in well drained soil. Cordyline Black Knight is waterwise and low maintenance once established.  Fertilise with slow release fertiliser to maintain lush growth.  Cordyline Black Knight will grow to a height of 3m  by 1.5m wide.

Cordyline Red Star is an attractive species of Cordyline that forms a single trunk and long broad foliage coloured red to burgundy. It is not noted for its flowers, but creamy white panicles form on older trees that later produce berries. 
Cordylines are a fantastic architectural plant for landscaping around pools and in garden beds. Cordyline Red Star is also ideal for specimen plantings, large pots and contemporary gardens. Plant Cordyline Red Star in an area of full to light shade; it will show its best colour in full sun. This variety is waterwise and will tolerate most well drained soils, coastal conditions as well as dry periods. 
Cordyline Red Star is relatively low maintenance and easily grown under all conditions. Water well until established. Remove spent flowers when necessary and fertilise annually with a long term slow release fertiliser.
Cordyline Red Star can grow to a height of 2.5 metres and a width of 1 metre.
Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Cordyline Electric Flash PBR is a compact, clump forming Cordyline that doesn’t develop a bare single stemmed trunk. Instead it develops side shoots that together with its slightly arching leaves provides dense foliage.  Multiple shoots form a clump of green and chocolate striped, strappy leaves.Makes a great plant for backyard gardens, landscapes, pots, containers and courtyards. Plant in a full sun position with well drained soil.Heat tolerant and cold hardy.Cordyline Electric Flash PBR grows to a height of 1.2m with a spread of 0.8m wide.
Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

'Electric Pink' is an ideal name for this vibrant Cordyline. It is an exciting statement plant that forms vivid pink and purple striped foliage ideal for contrasting against green or yellow dominant backgrounds. Cordylines are a fantastic architectural plant for landscaping around pools and in garden beds. Plant Cordyline 'Electric Pink' in an area of full to partial sun, however Cordyline Electric Pink will show its best colour in full sun. This variety will tolerate most well drained soils and has shown to have a resistance to crown rot. Once established, Cordyline Electric Pink is extremely heat tolerant, tolerating temperatures above 40 degrees Celsius. Cordyline 'Electric Pink' is relatively low maintenance. Water well until established and use a slow release fertiliser in spring. Cordyline Electric Pink can grow to a height of 1.5 metres and width of 1 metre.
Evergreen, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Cordyline Kaspar Green is known for its broad, lance shade green leaves and fragrant flower spikes.  This variety is a stunning choice for Mediterranean and tropical gardens. Cordyline Kaspar Green is equipped with a round branching habit, forming more compact and dense foliage. Cordylines are a fantastic architectural plant for landscaping around pools and in garden beds. Plant Cordyline Kaspar Green in an area of full to partial sun, however Cordyline Kaspar Green will show its best colour in full sun. This variety will tolerate most well drained soils and has shown to have a strong resistance to crown rot.Cordyline Kaspar Green waterwise and low maintenance. Water well until established. Remove spent flowers when necessary and fertilise annually with a long term slow release fertiliser.Cordyline Kaspar Green can grow to a height of 3 metres and a width of 1 metre.

Cordyline Red Fountain produces long, thin arching burgundy coloured leaves and multiple short stems emerge from the base, forming a deep red, grassy look.Cordylines are a fantastic architectural plant for landscaping around pools and in garden beds. Cordyline Red Fountain is also ideal for specimen plantings, large pots and contemporary gardens. Plant Cordyline Red Fountain in an area of full to light shade; it will show its best colour in full sun. This variety will tolerate most well drained soils, coastal conditions as well as dry periods. Cordyline Red Fountain is relatively low maintenance and easily grown under all conditions. Water well until established and during extremely dry periods. Remove spent flowers when necessary and fertilise annually with a long term slow release fertiliser. Cordyline Red Fountain can grow to a height and width of 1 metre.

Cordyline Red Sensation is an attractive species of Cordyline that forms a single trunk and bears several stout ascending branches that house long broad foliage coloured dark red. During early summer flowers are produced in terminal panicles.Cordylines are a fantastic architectural plant for landscaping around pools and in garden beds. Cordyline Red Sensation is also ideal for specimen plantings, large pots and contemporary gardens. Planting Cordyline Red Sensation in an area of full sun to light shade will show its best colour. This variety will tolerate most well drained soils, coastal conditions as well as dry periods. Cordyline Red Sensation is waterwise and relatively low maintenance and easily grown under all conditions. Water well until established. Remove spent flowers when necessary and fertilise annually with a long term slow release fertiliser.Cordyline Red Sensation can grow to a height of 2.5 metres and a width of 2 metres.

Lanceolate - Pointed At Both Ends/Strappy - Grass Like

Cordyline terminalis Ruby produces stunning two toned ruby red and deep burgundy foliage, creating a true stand-out display plant. This stunning indoor houseplant has a compact busy growth habit, creating a more dense appearance.Cordylines are a fantastic architectural plant for landscaping around pools and in garden beds. This variety is also ideal as an under-storey plant, adding a tropical feel to the garden. Plant Cordyline terminalis Ruby in an area of full to part shade; it will show its best colour in brighter areas. This variety will tolerate most well drained soils, coastal conditions as well as dry periods. Cordyline terminalis Ruby is relatively low maintenance and easily grown . Water well until established and during extremely dry periods. Fertilise annually with a long term slow release fertiliser. Cordyline terminalis Ruby can grow to a height of 1.2 metres and a width of 80cm.

Coriander is a fine herb with beautiful, aromatic, serrated foliage. The dried seeds are harvested when they turn brown. Use Coriander in hot dishes, particularily Thai cuisine, in pesto or as a garnish.

Coriander is a fine herb with beautiful, aromatic, serrated foliage. The dried seeds are harvested when they turn brown. Use Coriander in hot dishes, particularily Thai cuisine, in pesto or as a garnish.
Corn Bicolour is a super sweet, high yeilding corn. This corn is best used in salads, soups or as a side dish.

Sweet Corn is a sweet, high yielding corn which is ideal for growing in a home vegetable garden. It can be used in many ways in salads or as a side-dish. For a delicious treat, wrap whole corn cob, garlic, herbs and butter in foil. Place on BBQ, turning constantly until heated through. Perfect for any outdoor entertaining.

Corn Sweet is a sweet, high yielding corn which is suitable for the home vegetable garden. It can be used in many ways in salads or as a side dish, but for a delicious treat, wrap whole corn cob, garlic, herbs and butter in foil. Place on BBQ, turning constantly until heated through. Perfect for any outdoor entertaining.

Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Named after the founder of Benara Nurseries; Winifred James, Correa Wins Wonder is a small to medium shrub native fuchsia that displays the colour of Australia with its green and gold leaves and classic deep pink flowers during winter and early spring. This variety is ideal for bird lovers as it will entice nectar feeding birds to the garden.Correa Wins Wonder is used for many areas such as an informal hedge, or a well suited addition to a cottage garden. Correa Wins Wonder is also ideal for containers or pots. This particular variety thrives in a position of full to part sun, with well draining soils. Correa Wins Wonder is waterwise and will tolerate coastal areas, light frost and extended dry periods. Correa Wins Wonder is relatively low maintenance. Water well until established and keep soils moist through warmer periods.Correa Wins Wonder can grow to a height and width of 50 centimetres.
Coastal, Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Corymbia calophylla is usually a large tree and can reach 40m but when  in cultivation it becomes more a medium sized tree with a dense rounded canopy. In the flowering season in summer the buds burst into clusters of fluffy cream flowers which are held outside the canopy making a wonderful display. You may also see pinks and sometimes red as they can readily become cross-pollinated.The 'Calophylla' tree has a thick straight trunk and fibrous bark. The attractive lanceolate leaves hang vertically which are the perfect foil for the showy flower clusters.This lovely tree is native to the southern coastal areas of Western Australia and so tolerates the windy weather and is ideal as a screen on larger properties.'Calophylla' prefers moist, well drained soil  and can  do well in poor quality soils, and can withstand mild frosts. If you choose to fertilize, ensure it is suitable to natives; sustained release granules are a good choice; and spread them around the leaf line.Once established 'Callophylla' will tolerate drought.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Eucalyptus calophylla rosea is an ornamental gum bearing a profusion of pink, fluffy flowers in Summer & Autumn, followed by large decorative fruit. Ideal for large gardens, parks, roadsides, and rural plantings. a good shade or shelter tree that is suitable for windy, exposed sites. The flowers are bird attracting.Best grown in a sunny open position in moist, well drained soil, but withstands some shade. Will tolerate short periods of dryness, pollution and light frost, but avoid wet poorly drained soil.Growing 25m high x 13m wide
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Corymbia ficifolia is an ornamental small to medium Australian Native renowned for its brilliant floral display during summer. The flower colour is variable, ranging from deep red through to pink and bright orange. Foliage is grey-green and glossy.This lovely tree will make an excellent addition to large gardens, parks and landscapes. It makes a good shade or windbreak tree. Thrives in a sunny to partly shaded position in moist, well drained soil.Tolerates coastal conditions.  Protect from frost when young.Corymbia ficifolia grows 6-15m high and 5-10m wide.
Coastal, Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

This stunning, small native tree is spectacular. Bearing brilliant large, scarlet-red, staminate flower clusters during spring and summer this prolific flowering small tree is a great addition to any garden, large or small. The leaves are large, glossy dark green with a lighter underside and have a weeping habit. This tree is also ideal for parks and would be a strong feature in streetscapes. Suitable to most soil types makes it a versatile plant in many situations, tolerating frosts and drought once established/settled. Suitable to most areas in Australia. The beautiful flowers are bird attracting bringing nature to you. There is no pruning required as this tree maintains a good shape.The grafted ficifolia have a root stock more adaptable to different types of soil such as clay, loam and gravel making them more versatile than the non-grafted Corymbia ficifolia.Being grafted trees we need to ensure any shoots that develop from below the graft are removed as these will be root stock and may grow vigorously and overwhelm the selected Corymbia ficifolia above and you will lose the top tree and the desired flower of your selected colour.

Corymbia maculata is a tall, majestic Australian Native with a decorative silver-grey, spotted and dimpled trunk. White flowers are displayed from late winter until spring.An ideal specimen, shade or shelter tree for parks, farmlands and revegetation areas. Thrives in a sunny, open positions with plenty of room to mature. Tolerats most soil types but will prefer well drained soil.Water well until established. Grows quickly during the first ten years, eventually reaching 30m once mature.Corymbia maculata grows 15- 30m high and 12-15m wide.
Liguate - Strap-like, Petal-like Flowers Of Daisies

Cosmos Choca Mocha is an easy to grow perennial with amazing open star shaped dark reddish black flowers with a delicious, distinctive chocolate smell. Flowers appear in summer, autumn and spring.Ideal in the patio or in the home garden. Plant in a sunny position and keep moist.In cold areas a period of winter dormancy occurs. Plant in good friable garden soil with compost and slow release fertiliser. Re-fertilise 3 times a year. Remove spent flowers to encourage new growth. Cosmos Choca Mocha will grow to a height of 30cm and a width of 30cm.
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring

Cotyledon Delight is an impressive compact succulent producing silvery grey leaves that are bordered with purple margins. During winter and spring Cotyledon Delight blooms with pinkish orange flowers that are perched high above the foliage on a tall stalk. Cotyledon Delight is well suited for use as a feature plant in either the garden or pots and containers. Will also provide a colourful contrast against other green leaved plants.  Position Cotyledon Delight in an area of full to partial sun, with well draining soils.  Cotyledon Delight has low water requirements once established. Water well up until this point, and occasionally through warmer summer months. Cotyledon Delight can grow to a height and width of 40cm.
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring

Cotyledon Macrantha is an impressive succulent producing fleshy lime green leaves that are bordered with red margins. During winter and spring Cotyledon Macrantha blooms eye-catching red flowers that are perched high above the foliage on a tall stalk. Cotyledon Macrantha is well suited for use as a feature plant in either the garden or pots and containers. The flowers will also provide a colourful contrast against other green leaved plants.  Position Cotyledon Macrantha in an area of full to partial sun, with well draining soils.  Cotyledon macrantha has low water requirements once established. Water well up until this point and occasionally through warmer summer months. Cotyledon Macrantha can grow to a height and width of 90cm.

Crassula capitela thyrifora is an interesting architectural plant with layered ruby triangular leaves and tiny white flowers which can occasionally be tinged with pink. Foliage is prominently a dark, rich red but also includes shades of olive green and bronze and develops vibrant red edges in the cooler months. A small trailing perennial succulent which will flow over the edges of pots or baskets. Great for mixed planting to get that layered look. Best in filtered/partial sun with rich well drained soil. Drought and heat tolerant.Crassula capitela thyriflora can grow to a height of 10cm and a width of 30cm.
Jade Plant, Friendship Tree, Lucky Plant, Money Tree

Crassula Little Jade Tree is a fascinating succulent with an upright habit and tubular green leaves with flattened red-brown tips which resemble suction cups. An ideal for borders, rockeries, pots and containers. Best grown in a sunny position in well drained soil. Protect from frost.Apply a liquid fertiliser once or twice a year.Crassula Little Jade tree will grow to a height of 50cm x 50cm.

Crassula surprise party is a grey coloured succulent with soft  spiky foliage and great for use as a border plant and can flower all year round. Crassula Surprise is great for use in waterwise gardens as it is drought resistant and once established requires minimal maintenance.
Cucumber Burpless is a long, dark green fruit with low acid content, making them easy to digest. They are perfect for salads.
Cucumber Lebanese is a short, smooth skinned, green fruit with a crisp, sweet tase. It is ideal for salads.

Cucumber Patio Snacker is a mini version of cucumber, small in size with a long rounded, dark green body and short branching vines. Cucumbers are made up of 90% water and technically comes from a fruit family, much like tomatoes and squash. It Grows best in moist soil and sunlight.

Cuphea Compact White is a small, evergreen shrub which bears masses of dainty, white star-like flowers during summer above dense, dark green foliage.An excellent choice for backyard gardens that can be used in a variety of positions. Perfect for low, formal or informal hedges, borders, rockeries and container plantings.Cupheas grow well in most soil types, in full sun or part shade.Prune lightly after flowering to maintain a neat and tidy habit.Cuphea Compact White grows to 35cm high and 45cm wide.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Cuphea Rob's Mauve is a small, evergreen shrub which bears masses of small mauve star-like flowers above small green leaves in summer and autumn.An excellent choice for the home backyard garden and can be used in a variety of positions. Perfect for low, formal or informal hedges, borders, rockeries and container plants. Cupheas grow well in most soils, in full sun or part shade. Prune lightly after flowering to maintain neat and tidy habit.Cuphea Rob's Mauve grows 35cm high and 45cm wide.

Cuphea hyssopifolia alba is an evergreen, low growing, bushy shrub with masses of small, white flowers for most of the year.  A tough plant in a wide range of positions in full sun to part shade. Excellent choice for rockeries, containers and as a small hedge or bedding plant.Prune lightly after flowering to maintain a neat and tidy, bushy habit. Use a premium potting mix when planting in containers and fertilise with a slow release fertiliser.Cuphea alba will grow to a height of 50cm and a width of 50cm.

A vigorous, fast growing, evergreen conifer that eventually forms a dense, conical tree. This particular variety produces attractive bright golden-yellow foliage.Cupressocyparis 'Castlewellan Gold' can be used as a fast growing hedge, windbreak or screen especially for exposed or coastal sites. Plant Cupressocyparis 'Castlewellan Gold' in an area of full to part sun, with well draining soils. Cupressocyparis 'Castlewellan Gold' is cold hardy and will tolerate dryness. If used as a hedge, Cupressocyparis 'Castlewellan Gold' should be trimmed regularly for best results. Water regularly after planting. Tolerates dry conditions once established. Cupressocyparis 'Castlewellan Gold' can grow to a height of 7 metres and a width of 3 metres.
Conifer, Evergreen, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Cupressocyparis Leighton Green is a vigorous evergreen conifer that forms a dense, deep green tree.An excellent hedge, screen or windbreak, especially for coastal or exposed positions. Prefers a sunny well drained position. Can be used in many garden or landscape situations such as lining feature walls or fences, formal gardens, paths and driveways. Mulch well to suppress weeds and conserve moisture, Trim as required and fertilise every spring.Cupressocyparis Leighton Green will grow to a height of 10m and a width of 4m.

Commonly known as a Pencil Pine, Cupressus sempervirens 'Glauca' forms dense dark green-blue foliage in an upright columnar manner. This particular conifer produces less fruit than other pencil pine species, and has more blue shaded foliage. Cupressus sempervirens Glauca is used in many garden or landscape situations such as lining feature walls or fences, paths and driveways. They can also be planted in a pot or container. Cupressus Glauca thrives in moist, well drained soils with exposure to full sun, although it can adapt to suit semi shaded positions. This variety is frost hardy. Cupressus Glauca requires low maintenance. Prune as desired to encourage more compact growth. Keep plants well mulched and water well during dry spells. Cupressus Glauca can grow to a height of 15 metres and a width of 1 metre.
Evergreen, Fern, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Also known as the Australian tree fern, Cyathea cooperi is native to New South Wales and Queensland. This tree fern grows a slender trunk that supports a crown of large lacy fronds that are particularly attractive. Cyathea cooperi is perfect for shady gardens, public gardens or ferneries. This ornamental fern prefers protected, shady and moist conditions but can be grown in sunny areas as long as it is watered regularly. Cyathea cooperi is cold tolerant.This tree fern requires relatively low maintenance. Use a high-quality mulch to ensure soils are moist and nutrients are provided to the shallow root system. Cyathea cooperi can grow to a height of 6 metres and a width of 3 metres.

Cycas revoluta is commonly known as the Japanese Sago Palm, with it originating from southern Japan. This slow growing plant has a low thick trunk that supports a crown of feather-like dark green leaves that wrap around the circumference of the trunk. Cycas Revoluta will provide a definite feature and a tropical vibe to any garden or landscape. Cycas revoluta is widely used as an exotic feature tree in both gardens and pots or containers. This ornamental plant prefers full sun exposure and soils that are well draining and rich in organic matter. Cycas revoluta waterwise and can withstand light frost. Cycas revoluta requires little maintenance and once established it only requires water when almost dry. Use a fertiliser during spring and late summer. Cycas Revoluta can grow to a height of 3 metres and a width of 2 metres.

Dahlia Hi Dolly produce colourful, double flowers above compact, bushy plants. They come in a range of bright colours including red, yellow, orange, pink and purple and flower from summer through to early autumn.Ideal for garden beds, borders, containers and beautiful cut flowers Dahlia's prefer a position in full sun to partial shade and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly, keeping the soil moist throughout the growing season. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Remove spent blooms on your Cornflower plant to encourage new growth and keep your plants in continual flower.Dahlia Hi Dolly grow to approx. 45-60cm high and should be planted 30-40cm apart.

Damperia diversifolia is a low growing Australian native groound cover plant, which thrives in most well drained soils, and will tolerate some dryness. This perennial herb is covered in a mass of deep blue flowers from Spring to early Summer.  Thrives in a partly shaded position but withstands full sun, perfect for rockeries, hanging baskets, retaining walls & patio pots.Plant in a sunny area with well drained soil.They can grow up to 50cm high and 150cm wide.

Daphne Perfume Princess PBR is a unique and enchanting Daphne with an upright and slightly spreading habit and attractive glossy green foliage. Large blooms of pretty pink flowers release an intense perfume with soft citrus undertones during winter and spring. Plant in the garden, near a window, doorway or path to enjoy the aroma.Prefers a sunny or semi-shaded, frost free position with well drained soil.  Once established it requires only occasional attention and should only be pruned lightly. For best results apply a handful of slow release fertiliser after flowering.Daphne Perfume Princess PBR will grow to a height of 1.2m and a width of 1m.

One of twenty species of Darwinia, citriodora is lemon scented and can be found in the southwest of Western Australia. This plant grows to height of 1- 1.5m and is a compact rounded shrub. The leaves are attractive in winter with traces of purple-red which accentuates the newer growth. The leaves carry numerous oil glands and when picking leaves from this plant a lovely lemon scent is produced.  The common name for this plant is Lemon Scented Mytle. 
Darwinia citriodora flowers July to January, each flower formas a pendulous cluster of four, sometimes this can grow to five or six, and are about 1cm long. Colour change may occur in the flowers from yellow with red stigmas to and orangey-red.
Pruning is not required however an occasional clip of shoots following flowering will be beneficial. Normal fertilizing applies in early spring and a good helping of mulch will ensure continued growth and healthy plants. Pests stay away from this plant and is relatively free of disease and it is a waterwise plant.
Darwinia citriodora will grow to a height and width of 1.5 metres.

Delonix regia is commonly known as the Poinciana Tree. Delonix regia is a member of the bean family Leguminosae and is widely regarded as on of the most beautiful tropical trees in the world. This tree produces striking scarlet /orange flowers in summer which stand out from the delicate feathery foliage. Delonix regia is waterwise but may will drop it's leaves through extended dry periods or during very cold conditions.  As the tree grows, a  broad umbrella shaped crown develops making it an ideal shade tree. Delonix regia has brown woody seed pods that reach up to 60cm long and turn almost black when ripe. Delonix regia can grow to heights of 10 - 15m and leaf length can get to 30-50cm.

This popular, compact 'soft' succulent plant has grey-green fat 'angular' leaves and bares yellow daisy-like blooms in spring.It is a densely leafy perennial plant forming cushion with a tap-root and some additional adventitious roots on sprawling, prostrate stems.Delosperma lehmannii will grow and thrive in most conditions. It does not require any special soil, almost anything will do, although it will thrive in rich, well-draining soil. It is also drought and salt-tolerant. Excellent in succulent mix bowls as a decorative feature almost anywhere in your home.Ideal in cactus gardens, containers, wall pots, hanging baskets & 'green walls'.Water occasionally and less in winter.

Dianella Cassa Blue is a compact, upright, clumping rather than spreading variety of Dianella, suited to any commercial or home garden. Once established Cassa Blue is one of the toughest Dianella grasses. The rich blue foliage is an eye catching contrasting feature in any garden.  Cassa Blue will flower more than most other Dianella for about 2 months in Spring followed by berries.Ideal for coastal plantings, mass planting and exposed positions.Dianella Cassa Blue is waterwsie and frost tolerant once established and  is suitable to most soil types and areas. Fertilise with slow release fertiliser once a year and trim foliage to give a neat vibrant look to the plant. Grows to 50cm in well drained soil types.

Dianella Breeze is a tidier form of Dianella caerulea, without the unattractive messy canes that descend over the plant. It is equipped with cascading dark green foliage and the occasional spray of delicate blue flowers in spring followed by an array of rich purple berries. Dianella caerulea Breeze tolerates a variety of situations including drought, windy and salt laden positions and heavy frost; growing well in full sun and moderate to heavy shade positions. Dianella Breeze is very fast growing.With the many characteristics as noted above, Dianella Breeze is perfect for erosion control, mass plantings and great as an under storey plant for both dense and light tree plantings. Its' underground root structure will fill gaps and will outperform against weeds, making it key to cover the border of paths and roads.  Ideal for both commercial and domestic landscapes Breeze looks great mass planted.Dianella Breeze is waterwise.  Regular watering is required for the first 2-3 months to establish the plant, however often further watering is not necessary unless set in sandy conditions. Dianella Breeze can tolerate excessive dry and wet conditions. Dianella Breeze can grow to a height and width of 60cm.

Dianella Tasred is a compact Australian native with bright green and red strap-like leaves, a real showpiece for any garden. In cooler weather, the red tones radiate from the plant's crown into the leaf margins; spring brings a show of rich blue flowers. Its dense and tidy appearance has the abilty to cope with full sun to full shade. Dianella Tasred has beautiful wide leaves, making it one of the most popular choices of Dianella. Masses of purple berries appear in spring and summer. Can be described as an ornamental flax requiring fertilising once in spring, well suited in any soil and great for any garden or border.  Dianella Tasred is an ideal waterwise plant for any commercial or domestic planting and looks great mass planted.Dianella Tasred will grow to 45 centermetres high by 40 to 50 centermetres wide.

Dianella hybrid variegated is an evergreen perennial and is a great addition to any garden. The foliage has a unique appearance with creamy white margins bordering wide green leaves. Stalks of shiny blue berries appear above the foliage in autumn and winter and create a colourful accent in the garden.  Dianella hybrid variegated has proved itself in the landscape over the many years it has been in production.  It is suited to both domestic and commercial plantings and also performs well in the north west of Western Australia.  Dianella hybrid variegated is waterwise once established and will grow in full sun to part shade.  autumn and winter is a good time to cut back to reinvigorate them for spring and will produce healthy new growth. A good balanced slow realease fertiliser in spring every 1-2years can help performance. This plant is tough and heat resistant in a well drained soil area. Can grow up to 1 metre high and wide if in an irrigated landscape, otherwise in most landscapes it might stay around 50cm high.

Dianella Ruby Green is an Ozbreed plant with green to bronze leaves and little red tinge in the middle. It has an attractice clumping habit and it will produce amazing blue flower stems in early october.Ruby Green is a low maintenance plant and can be used as an accent plant or in a group of planting for contrast. It would go well any backyard garden. Prefers full sun to part shade areas and tolerates drought and frost. Well drained soils are preferred as well.To establish, water well for 8 to 13 weeks and then after make sure not to over water. Plant in well mulched areas and use slow release fertiliser.Dianella Ruby Green can grow up to 60cm high and 50cm wide.

Dianella Streetscape is a tough clumping grass, which was developed from a cross with a Cape York Dianella species and Dianella caerulea. The geographical tolerances of the parent species are inbuilt in Streetscape enabling it to cope with a wider range of temperature. Streetscape is well suited for planting in median strips, borders next to pathways, driveways, courtyards or wherever a low growing variety is required. Ideal for use in the domestic or commercial landscapes.  Streetscape is low maintenance and looks great in mass plantings. Its roots grow at twice the speed of Dianella caerulea so it establishes quickly after planting. Dianella Streetscape is a waterwise plant once established.  Cut back as required to encourage new healthy growth.Streetscape will grow to a height of 50 centermetres by 60 centermetres wide.

Dianella Wyeena is a great Australian plant in any frost affected area compared to other Dianellas. The stiking foliage makes a great eye catcher in any garden and works well as a contrast. Ideal for mass planting or a foliage feature in any ceramic pot. Grow Wyeena in full sun to any range of shade, suits any soil type and is a asset to any garden. Remove any leaves that get scrappy in spring. Fertilise with a slow release compound occasionally if required.Dianella Wyeena can grow to a height of 90 centermetres by 70 centermetres wide.

Dianella Weeping Kate is well known for it's distinctive weeping foliage and stand out blue/purple flowers and berries throughout the year.  Weeping Kate makes an ideal potted specimen, garden plant or mass planted in a commercial landscape.  Weekping Kate is a low growing, compact Dianella.
