With striking two-tone green/blue foliage, Dianella revoluta Revelation is a compact clumping form of Dianella revoluta. From mid spring to early summer Dianella revoluta Revelation will produce masses of blue flowers followed by edible purple berries in late summer. Dianella revoluta Revelation tolerates a wide range of soils and climates, and prefers full sun as well and shady positions. Being hardy, drought and frost tolerant, Dianella Revelation is suitable for mass planting, along paths and roads. Its underground root structure enables it to spread and fill the planting area. It is also suitable for raised or depressed areas. Little or no maintenance is required to assist Dianella Revelation. Water well until established as well as planting it in a well mulched garden. Slow release fertiliser can be used every Spring if necessary. Dianella Revelation can tolerate periodic wet feet a lot better than Dianella revoluta.Dianella revoluta Revelation can grow to a height and width of 50cm.

Dianella Blaze produces rich red to dark foilage. This new release Dianella Blaze is the first true dark foilaged Dianella. The exceptional foliage colour darkens as the weather cools and slowly turns to a green shade with some dark colouring flushes over the warmer months. Blaze provides a striking feature in the garden growing 40cm tall and 40cm wide, mass or accent planting are among the many uses this attractive native is ideal for.

Dianella caerulea Lucia is the fastest spreading form of Dianella.  Its complex yet non-invasive root structure gives Lucia the ability to spread into gaps as well as being able to recover and repair itself from damage. Its strappy green foliage produces mulberry flower buds that form in early spring, further creating an array of purple flowers, followed by berries in summer. This variety grows well in full sun to semi shade, preferring free draining soils. Dianella caerulea Lucia has proven to work very well in large mass plantings, borders and as a dense ground cover. Dianella Lucia may discolour in winter in very cold climates but handles frost.Water regularly until the plant is established. Slow release fertiliser can be used in spring. Prune as necessary to remove mature leaves.  Dianella caerulea Lucia can grow to a height of 40cm and a width of 50cm.  |  https://www.ozbreed.com.au/plant-ranges/strappy-leaf-plants/lucia-dianella/

Dianella Tas Destiny® is a stand out variegated Flax Lily perfect for mass plantings, accent gardens and patio pots. It is a very compact form, relatively drought tolerant and very frost tolerant.Plant in full sun to moderate shade in a well mulched garden (chunky mulch recommended). Ensure crown or base of plant is not below soil or mulch level. Tolerates well drained soils to clay soils. Avoid very poor soils.Water as required for 8-13 weeks until established then water as required. Use slow release fertiliser in spring. Remove dead leaves as required or cut back every 1-3 years (will look better with pruning every year, this depends on your requirements).Grows to 35cm high x 35cm wide.

Dianella caerulea Little Jess is a hardy native grass with glossy dark emerald foliage. Little Jess is a dwarf with a clumping growth habit. Its' short, compact canes produce masses of bold violet flowers which cascade and contrast against its' vibrant green foliage. In summer it will produce attractive clusters of purple berries. Dianella Little Jess can be used in a variety of areas including most commercial and residential plantings, mass plantings, roadsides, and excellent for erosion control. It prefers full sun and moderate to heavy shaded positions. Little Jess is waterwise and has the ability to tolerate drought and humidity making it suitable for a variety of soils. Water until established, further watering will depend on climate. Plant in a well mulched garden, and prune as desired. Slow release fertiliser can be used every spring if necessary.Dianella Little Jess will grow to a height and width of 40cm.

Dianella revoluta Little Rev is a clump forming grass with green/blue foliage and a slight silver hue. The foliage spikes upwards, creating a more modern and contemporary look. Its masses of petite indigo flowers soften the look that come in late spring. This variety prefers full sun to moderate shade and tolerates frost and drought. It is best planted in raised or flat landscapes, suiting moderate heavy to free draining soils. Due to its striking appearance, Dianella Little Rev is commonly used in modern commercial and residential landscapes including borders, as foliage contrast and in planter boxes. Once established, Dianella Little Rev requires little or no maintenance. Water regularly until the plant is established. Slow release fertiliser can be used in spring. Commonly know as Kidney Weed, Dichondra repens is native to New Zealand and many parts of Australia. Dichondra leaves are kidney shape hence giving it the common name of Kidney Weed.  Dichondra is an excellent groundcover and will spread by putting its' own roots where each node meets the soil, making it an ideal lawn substitue in cooler areas of Australia or in small and partly shaded gardens in other areas where lawn mowers are hard to use.  Dichondra is best used between informal stepping stones and to fill small gaps in gardens.  Dichondra is waterwise and frost resistant once established.Dichondra repens will only grow to 10 centermetres high by 30 centermetres wide.  For best coverage, break plants apart to cover a larger area.

Dietes bicolour is an evergreen perennial grown for its attractive, yellow, iris-like flowers. These flowers sit high above the lime green, sword-shaped leaves which form in large clumps. Dietes flower continuously over long periods in spring and summer, providing prolonged colour to any garden or landscape. Dietes bicolour is a versatile plant that can be used for borders, water gardens, mass plantings and is also well suited to patio pots and containers. Plant Dietes bicolour in an area of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil that is rich in organic material. Once established, Dietes bicolour is quite hardy.Dietes bicolour is waterwise and low maintenance. Fertilise occasionally and water during dry spells. Do not remove flower stems as they continue to flower for several years.Dietes bicolour can grow to a height and width of 1 metre.

Dipladenia My Fair Lady is a stunning evergreen climber with dark glossy leaves. This variety produces showy pink flower buds, opening to snow white trumpet-shaped flowers with a yellow centre and splashes of pink. Dipladenia My Fair Lady is ideal for large patio pots or in well drained garden areas. They are a well suited species for covering walls, fences and unsightly areas. Dipladenia My Fair Lady can also be mass planted without climbing support to provide a striking feature. Plant Dipladenia My Fair Lady in an area of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil. Dipladenia My Fair Lady is relatively low maintenance and is frost tender. If grown in a container, ensure that the potting mix is free draining. Prune lightly to keep the plant compact. Feed with a slow release fertiliser in spring and summer for optimum results. Dipladenia My Fair Lady can grow to a height of 5 metres with support and a width of 2 metres.

A stunning Australian hybrid succulent that flowers virtually all year round. xDisphyllum Sunburn is a crossed between two plant genera, one Autstralian and one South Africa. The seed parent is Disphyma crassifolium ssp. clavellatum an Australian native, and the pollen parent is Glottiphyllum longum, a native of South Africa. The genus Disphyma distinctly has pink, pink/white or rarely white flowers. The genus Glottiphyllum distinctly has larger yellow flowers. This union produced a beautiful golden (50 mm+) yellow/orange flower. All the best features of both parents are evident in xDisphyllum Sunburn.This fast growing plant is a relatively compact groundcover, suitable for garden beds, cascading over retaining walls in vertical gardens or containers. Prune occationally to maintain a neat habit. Feed with slow release fertiliser in early spring and agin in sutumn. xDisphyllum Sunburn is heat, light frost and drought tolerantxDisphyllum Sunburn will grow to a height of 10cm and a width of 1m.

Dracaenas are members of the ancient dragon tree family, which produce stunning sword-like leaves. This particular variety, Black Knight, is a small, upright, evergreen tree that forms dark green, spiky foliage. The foliage colour is enhanced by sun exposure. Dracaena Black Knight is an ideal feature tree in parks, landscapes and gardens. It is also ideal for patio pots and containers. Plant Dracaena Black Knight in an area of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil. If planting indoors, ensure that the area is well lit. Dracaena Black Knight copes with reasonably cold winters, but not frost and grows best in tropical and subtropical gardens, including coastal locations. Dracaena Black Knight is a low maintenance plant. Prune the stems in spring to encourage better branching. Liquid fertilise regularly and water only when dry.Dracaena Black Knight can grow to a height of 2 metres and a width of 1 metre.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Tree

Dracaenas are members of the ancient dragon tree family, which produce stunning sword-like leaves. This particular variety, Colorama, is a small, evergreen tree that forms slender, lance-like leaves in shades of red, pink and cream. It is the ideal foliage plant for brightening up the home, patio or garden.Dracaena Colorama is an ideal feature tree in parks, landscapes and gardens. It is also ideal for patio pots and containers. Plant Dracaena Colorama in an areas of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil. If planting indoors, ensure that the area is well lit. Dracaena Colorama copes with reasonably cold winters, but not frost and grows best in tropical and subtropical gardens, including coastal locations. Dracaena Colorama is a low maintenance plant. Prune the stems in spring to encourage better branching. Liquid fertilise regularly and water only when dry.Dracaena Colorama can grow to a height of 2 metres and a width of 1 metre.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Tree
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

Dracaenas are members of the ancient dragon tree family, which produce stunning sword-like leaves. This particular variety, Draco, is a slow-growing, evergreen tree that forms stiff, blue-green leaves. This variety also produces insignificant flowers that are followed by orange berries in summer. Dracaena draco is an ideal feature tree in parks, landscapes and gardens. It is also ideal for patio pots and containers. Plant in an area of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil. If planting indoors, ensure that the area is well lit. Dracaena draco copes with reasonably cold winters, but not frost and grows best in tropical and subtropical gardens, including coastal locations. Once established, Dracaena Draco is hardy and drought tolerant.Dracaena draco is a low maintenance plant. Prune the stems in spring to encourage better branching. Liquid fertilise regularly and water only when dry.Dracaena draco can grow to a height of 9 metres and a width of 4 metres.

Dracaena 'Malay Stripe' is a compact form of Dracaena with strappy short light and dark green variegated leaves.This very versatile plant will adapt to many situations, including indoors in a well lit position, in pots and tubs in your outdoor entertaining areas, or planted in the garden to give that tropical feel. It will also do well in a sheltered full sun position as long as it is watered regularly and  introduced to the full sun position slowly if raised in a shade house, to allow acclimatization or it may burn. It will also tolerate periods of dryness while still providing a lovely lush display of bi-colored foliage.The Dracaena 'Malay Stripe' is a  'sculptured' plant as it grows and thickens. Dracaena 'Malay Stripe' prefers a well-draining soil and is an outstanding performer in pots.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Tree

Dracaenas are members of the ancient dragon tree family that produce stunning sword-like leaves. This particular variety, marginata, produces narrow, bright green leaves that are bordered by deep red margins. Dracaena marginata is an ideal feature plant either indoors or outdoors. It is also suited to mass plantings, or large patio pots and containers. Plant Dracaena marginata in an area of full sun to shade, with well drained soil. It copes with reasonably cold winters, but not frost and grows best in tropical and subtropical gardens. Dracaena marginata is a low maintenance plant. Prune the stems in spring to encourage better branching. Water well when the soil surface is dry and apply a liquid fertiliser throughout the growing season.Dracaena marginata can grow to a height of 6 metres and a width of 3 metres.

Dracaena Song of India is a great tropical foliage plant, multi-stemmed with strappy green and yellow variegated leaves. A fantastic specimen plant for the tropical gardens outdoors in full sun to part shade or a hardy indoor plant in low light levels. Best with moist, well drained soil. Prefers tropical or sub-tropical climates or warm protected positions in temperate climates.Dracaena Song of India will grow to a height of 3-5m and a width of 3m.

Duranta Geisha Girl have fragrant vanilla flowers that are purple with white centres and wavy petal edges. It is a fantastic plant for hedging, and they grow very succesfully in containers.  Originating from Japan, it is a stunning deep blue form of Duranta repens.  The delicately perfumed deep blue flowers are beautifully complimented by white centres & wavy borders of white on the petals edges.  Flowers are produced on the terminal growth of its graceful weeping branches.  Leaves are soft & shiny.  Flowers appear throughout Spring, Summer & Autumn.  Geisha girl will tolerate light frosts.  For best flowering results plant in full sun. Prune to shape after flowering.  Fertilise with a slow release fertiliser after pruning

Dypsis lutescens is a decorative and very hardy tropical palm, with up to about a dozen golden coloured trunks but no main trunk and they curve out from the base. Used for both landscaping duties, as well as an indoor plants. Great around pools, patio's and an ideal tub specimen. Indoors in a warm spot in filtered light or outdoors in a sunny to partly shaded position which is free from frost.  Fertilise regularly during the warmer months. Fantastic at cleaning chemicals from the air and improving air quality. Dypsis lutescens will grow to a height of 6-8m and a width of 2-2.5m.

A spectacular succulent native to the Americas, Echeveria Big Red is a rosette of rounded leaves that change from green in Summer to wine red in Winter. An indistinct flower blooms in Summer on a stem to 60cm tall.  The rounded leaves of Big Red contrasts well with other Echeveria varieties.Echeveria Big Red can be used as a border plant, in rockeries or makes an ideal feature potted display.  Preferring full sun to part shade, Echeveria Big Red is a low maintenance plant, grows will in free draining well mulched soil.  Water well until established, additional watering in Summer will promote growth.  Echeveria is drought tolerant, water wise and sun hardy.  Echeveria Big Red grows to a height of 30 - 40cm, and 30 - 50cm in width, with flower stems to 60cm.

These succulents have very attractive foliage, with stunning colour and growing habit. ideal for containers, patios, balconies, small courtyards, or in an open position of the garden.Echeveria Blue Curl have very attractive frilly edged blue/green leaves, that turn shades of pink in Spring and Autumn.  Mostly grown for it foliage it does produce flowers in Summer, rose pink in colour, tubular shaped on long stalks.A very versatile succulent can be grown in pots for patios, balconies, but also ideal in the garden either as a specimen plant or border. Also ideal in rockeries and low-water gardens 'Blue Metal provides year-round interest and vibrant colour. During there is the added interest of lovely multiple pail pink flowers borne on spikes up to 30cm tall.

Echeveria Capri is a stunning succulent with rosettes of fleshy, spoon shaped blue/green leaves that come to a point at the end and fading to magenta on the margins. Echeveria Capri will grow to a height of 20-30cm and a width of 20-30cm.

Elaeagnus angustifolia is an exotic small, usually thorny, deciduous tree or large shrub that is typically grown for its silvery foliage, small fragrant yellow flowers, olive-like fruit and ease of cultivation. The fruits are edible and sweet, though with a dryish, mealy texture. Easily grown in average, dry to medium, well-drained soils in full sun to part shade.  Best in light, sandy loams in full sun. This is a vigorous, fast-growing plant that tolerates a wide variety of soils including both poor dry soils and wet heavy clays. It responds well to clipping and can be grown much shorter as a hedge. Branches and trunk are covered with exfoliating brown bark that is attractive in winter. Elaeagnus angustifolia can grow to a height and spread of 12-20 feet.

Elettaria cardamomum is an evergreen perennial with erect stems and pointed glossy leaves. White flowers with a pink to violet striped lip are borne on a loose spike during summer, followed by pale green to beige, capsule seed pods.The green seed pods of the plant are dried and the seeds inside the pod are used in Indian and  Asian cuisines, either whole or ground.Great for tropical gardens and indoor decoration. Suitable for pots, containers and shaded garden beds. Plant in a shaded position with filtered light and good quality, well drained soil.Mulch well to retain moisture and supress weeds.Elettaria cardamomum grows 2-4m high and 2-4m wide.

Erythrina is a medium-sized, showy, deciduous tree normally growing to around 10m. Young stems and branches are thickly armed with stout conical spines up to 8 mm long,which fall off after 2-4 years. Rarely, a few spines persist and are retained with the corky bark. Bark is smooth and green when young, exfoliating in papery flakes, becoming thick, corky and deeply fissured with age.Flowers in bright pink to scarlet erect terminal racemes, 15-20 cm long stamens will protrude slightly from the flower. the rich, red blooms make their striking appearance among theleafless branches from winter through to spring . The short lived flowers are quicklyfollowed by the new leaves in early summer. A coral tree in full bloom is like an aviary, attracting numerous bird species aswell as bees that swarm round to eat nectar, pollinating the trees.

Eucalyptus caesia 'Silver Princess' also known as Gungarru, is a delightful small tree for any garden or landscape. Native to the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia. The branches, leaves and flower buds and fruit are silvery-white giving it the name Silver Princess. The bark of Silver Princess changes colour throughout the seasons with branches that can weep to the ground. The foliage is silvery blue with large red - pink or sometimes white flowers that are 40 - 50cm in diatmeter followed by large silver gumnuts to 30mm in diameter, which are a food source to native birds. Silver Princess is waterwise and is widely grown as an ornamental tree, however has become quite rare in the wild. Silver Princess can be pruned to maintain shape or cut right back to the ground to produce a mutli stem mallee type look. Eucaluptus Silver Princess can grow to approximately 7 metres tall.

Eucayptus cladocalyx nana, known as the Dwarf Bushy Sugar Gum, is a member of the Myrtaceae family. Its bark is grey/blue mottled and smooth, which is shed in late Summer and Autumn.  Foliage is a shiny dark green lanceolate shape, with prominent veining.  Buds are in thick clusters forming white flowers late summer, followed by barrel shaped gum nuts.Eucalyptus cladocalyx is a native of South Australia and Western Australia, most prominent on Eyre Peninsula and Kangaroo Island. It is a small native suitable for suburban gardens and parks, preferring a sunny position with well drained soil.  Eucalyptus cladocalyx nana is drought tolerant and very hardy.  Can reach a height of up to 10 metres and 5 metres in width, and forms a nice round shape.

Eucalyptus erythrocoys is an evergreen medium sized tree, which bears yellow, fluffy flowers in Autumn, emerging from green flower buds with a vivid red, warty cap. This Eucalyptus is native to the southwest of Western Australia, also referred to as Tuart. Eucalyptus gomphocephla was a previously sought hardwood timber after for construction and a popluar choice for furniture due to its' grain and colour. Tuarts' are now a protected species due to over logging. Eucalyptus gomphocephala has glossy lanceolate light green foliage, white flowers during Autumn and Winter, and produces large amounts of nectar for honey.  Tolerant of coastal winds and sandy alkaline soil.  Due to the size Eucalyptus gomphocephla grows to, it is not suitable for small suburban gardens, but is idealy used for street plantings, parks and larger back yards.  Eucalyptus gomphocephala can grow to 30 metres high by 15 metres wide.

Eucalyptus rudis is a native of Western Australia, from Geraldton to Albany, growing in most soil types in wet areas such as swamps, lake edges and floodways. Known as the Flooded Gum it grows 20 metres high and 4 metres wide.  Foliage is dull grey to blue green, shaped like an elongated egg when young and changing to linear shape when mature.  White flowers appear during Summer and Autumn, attracting birds and bees to the nectar. A fast growing tree ideal for wind breaks, street trees, feature tree or shelter for stock.  Eucalyptus rudis will grow in heavy clay soils and is very tolerant of waterlogging, moderate drought and salt tolerant.

Eucalyptus Todtiana is easily recognised by its often sprawling habit and yellowish, rough bark. Masses of white flowers appear in summer and early autumn on drooping branchlets which contrast with the dullish, yellow-green or pale green to green foliage.Eucalyptus todtiana has proven very useful as a shade tree for livestock, and due to its spreading habit and dense canopy, this species has excellent potential for windbreak and screening purposes.Low maitenance once established. Mulch well to keep moisture up and roots cool and fertilise with slow release native fertiliser. Prune when young to strengthen and maintain good structure. Responds well to pruning.Eucalyptus todtiana can grow to a height of 6m and a width of 4-10m.

Lipstick produce bright pink flowers freely in late winter, spring and summer. Best results in well drained soul and a drier environment in winter.Prune lightly in summer months if required.Grows to 1m high and wide
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Evolvulus Blue my mind is a dwarf herbabeous perennial with stunning deep sky blue flowers with Silver/Green toned foliage.It loves hot weather, in fact , the hotter the better.It will perform best in full sun and needs to be protected from even light frost. It is drought tolerant, once it is established. Plants do need to be watered well for several weeks during root establishment. Ideal for containers, ground cover and landscapes.Deadheading is unnecessary. A good dose of compost or slow release fertilizer will improve performance.Blue my mind will grow to a height of 6-12inches and a spread of 2ft.
Bamboo, Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Fargesia Fortune are commonly known as Fountain bamboo, Fortune has a vertical visual pattern. new culms emerge purple with a white powdery coating.An excellent specimen for a large hedge or screen. Fargesia bamboo is a viable non-invasive option for the home backyard garden. Able to withstand cold winters and windy condition, it also grows well in full sun or part shade. Fargesia bamboo thrives in rich organic soils and is relatively drought tolerant once established. For optimal growth, water twice a week and mulch through the summer.Fargesia Fortune can grow to a height of 4m and a width of 2m.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Fatsia japonica is a hardy evergreen shrub with attractive deeply lobed, shiny green foliage. Clusters of globular white flowers appear during autumn are are followed by small black fruit.Ideal as an indoor plant and perfect for patio pots and shady corners of tropical and sub-tropical gardens. Prefers a well lit position indoors or a shaded, warm, frost-free position outdoors. Prune to maintain shape and apply liquid fertiliser to potted plants regularly during the growing season.Fatsia japonica grows 1-2m high indoors and 3-6m high outdoors with a spread of 1-4m wide.

Fennel is a delightful home garden variety which develops an edible bulbous base at maturity. It is ideal for the home vegetable garden and can be used as a vegetable or a herb. Fennel is best used in tea, salads or as a side dish.

A clumping, grass like plant with reedy, arching stems. flowers and seed heads are not showy but add interest in autumn.Ideal for along stream beds and around ponds and dams where the evergreen foliage serves to soften harsh edgesBest grown in a sunny position in moist soil
Dwarf Sabre Leafed Fig / Long Leaf Fig
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Ficus Alii Petite is a compact ornamental foliage plant with long spear shaped leaves and dense green foliage. This particular variety is slow growing and has a strong resistance to leaf drop and lower light levels. Ficus Alii Petite is ideal as a container plant indoors and out.  Great for patios, pool areas or to create a tropical look. It can be grown as a small tree or hedge and can be pruned into a topiary shape. Ficus Alii Petite thrives in a wide range of soils and conditions, but prefers a sunny, open position in moist, well drained soil. It is recommended watering is commenced during warmer weather, as well as mulch to retain moisture. Allow to dry out between waterings. Prune to shape as required, this will encourage dense growth. Protect from frost in cooler climates. Fertilise with a slow release fertiliser for added growth.Ficus Alii Petite can grow to a height of 1.5 metres and a width of 75 centimetres.

Ficus busy prince is an excellent compact, dwarf growing shrub of slightly weeping branches covered with slender dark green, glossy leaves.  It is an excellent specimen for a containesr, makes an ideal indoor plant. In pots or in the garden bushy prince can be pruned into a range of topiary shapes adding interest to a dull spot. Alternatively bushy prince can be grown as a small tree or hedge.  In cooler climates, protect from frost by growing bushy prince in a sheltered area such as a patio or courtyard.Water and fertlise regularly with slow release fertiliser to improve growth.Ficus Bushy Prince can grow up to 2m high and 1.5m wide.

This highly sought fashionable plant is perfect for indoors.They feature a heavily-veined, very large violin-shaped leaf, 38cm long & 22cm wide, growing upright on a tall plant.Perfect specimen plants for well lit foyers and function areas or just in your living areas at home.Ideal in floor-standing pots where the plant is allowed to grow 2m or more.These are also relatively tough plants so minimal care is required, kept moist and a light liquid feed occasionally. A quarter-turn of the plant weekly is beneficial.
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Ficus benjamina Midnight Beauty is a tall spreading shade tree with a tight conical growth habit, creating a dense and bushy appearance. This tree produces small, shiny dark green leaves. Midnight Beauty is ideal as a container plant on patios and decks, a great shade tree for the garden and excellent planted along paths and streets. This tree can also be planted in pots indoors. It thrives in a wide range of soils and conditions, but prefers a sunny, open position in moist, well drained soil. This evergreen tree is also frost hardy and resistant to leaf dropping. Midnight Beauty is waterwise once established, water during warmer weather, as well as mulch to retain moisture. Prune to shape as required, this will encourage dense growth.Ficus benjamina Midnight Beauty can grow to a height of 9 metres and a width of 5 metres if not pruned to desired shape and height or contained in a pot.

Ficus Figaro PBR is a naturally compact, bushy shrub with dark, glossy green foliage. spectacular pink flushes appear in spring as the plant protects its new foliage growth. Ideal for hedging, screening and large containers. Grows in full sun or semi shade, tolerates light frosts and coastal conditions. Can be shaped to very narrow positions. Very low water requirement once established.Ficus Figaro PBR can grow to a height of 3m and a width of 3m.
Climber, Evergreen, Ground Cover, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Vertical Gardens

Ficus pumila is a tough and adaptable climbing plant with small, attractive green foliage. Requires no support as it is self clinging, making it ideal for covering unsightly structures, exposed walls, fences and pergolas. It is also suitable for ground covers, hanging baskets and growing indoors. Thrives in a sunny to partly shaded position outdoors and a well lit position indoors.Prune lightly to maintain shape. Ficus pumila grows 20cm high and 2.5-4m wide as a ground cover.
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Ficus Ruby is a striking robust, very hardy evergreen plant with beautiful red-pink and white variegated foliage and green overtones. Ruby is suitable for pots and large container planting. So if you're the indoor grower who is in search of a tree-like plant species with a decorative leaf, this is the plant for you! Great indoor plant in a well lit position. Also perfect for patios and verandahs. Keep moist but not wet, drier in winter. For lush healthy growth apply a complete fertiliser regularly. Ficus ruby will grow to a height of 2m.

Enjoy the fruits of labour and plant Fig Brown Turkey in your garden. Figs are delicious tossed through salads, serve them with cheese or eat them straight off the tree. With the majority of figs; the riper the sweeter the flavour. Fig Brown Turkey will often bear two crops in a year with the second crop extending further into autumn. This variety produces purple-brown fruit with sweet pink flesh in summer.Figs thrive in Australia's 'Mediterranean' climate and are the ideal size for most backyards. They are best grown in well drained soils with full sun exposure. Mature trees tolerate cold and frost, however protection is needed for new plantings until fully established. Once established, Fig Brown Turkey is hardy, and requires minimal maintenance. It is one of the toughest fig varieties.  While they prefer a warm, dry climate Figs appreciate plenty of water while the fruit is developing.  Apply a fertiliser annually in winter. Ensure you have a defence against birds when the tree starts fruiting. Fig Brown Turkey can grow to a height of 6 metres with a width of 5 metres.
Bronze, Burgundy, Copper, Gold, Orange, Red, Yellow

Fraxinus Raywood is a deciduous tree with attractive, bright claret coloured foliage in Autumn. An excellent ornamental shade tree, Claret Ash is suitable for larger gardens, parks and street plantings and has been a very popular landscape tree in Australia for many years. Fraxinus Raywood is frost tolerant, prefering an open sunny potistion in well drained soil. Fraxinus Raywood can grow to a height of 10 to 15 metres high by 6 to 9 metres wide.

Fraxinus Griffithii is a fast growing small tree, evergreen except in cooler climates where it is semi-deciduous.It has green shiny leaves on the top and hairy silver coloured underneath. Beautiful white flowers are produced in panicles during spring. Ideal feature tree or in parks and gardens. Can also be used for street and avenue planting. Best in a full sun to partly shaded position in moist rich, well drained soil. Tolerates drought and frost. Keep moist in dry weather. Mulch well.Fraxinus Griffithii will grow to a height of 6-8m and a width of 4m.
Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Succulent
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring

Furcraea Jet Stream is a very hardy tropical evergreen plant with attractive, broad succulent striped foliage, that is deep green along the margins with a cream stripe on the centre. Fragrant greenish to cream flowers are produced along a tall inflorescence.An excellent architectural plant for adding colour contrast to the landscape. Grow in a full sun to partly shaded area of well drained soil. Fertilise annually with a slow release fertiliser.Furcraea Jet Stream can reach a height of 1.5m and a width of 1.5m.
Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Succulent
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring

Furcraea Mediopicta is an exotic, palm like perennial with dramatically striped foliage and strongly fragrant, pale greenish to white flowers. Wonderful architectural plant for gardens or containers. Prefers a sunny or lightly shaded site with well drained soil. Tolerates dry spells once established.Furcraea mediopicta can grow to a height of 1.5m and a width of 2.5m.

Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Gardenias are a stunning evergreen shrub with lush glossy dark green foliage and beautifully perfumed flowers. Florida is an exceptional variety producing large, double, milky-white flowers. The beautifully formed flowers produce a heavenly perfume which can be enjoyed from late spring and through the warmer months.Ideal as a container plant, pots may be postioned near windows where their perfume can be enjoyed. Plant in a full sun or part shade area that is well drained and humus enriched acidic soil. Feed Gardenias regularly to promote lush foliage and heavy flowering.Gardenia Florida will grow to a height of 1.5m and a width of 1-1.2m.
Rosaceous - Like A Rose In Shape Or Appearance

Gardenia Gold Magic provide an additional touch of interest to the garden with the large, double blooms that age from white to cream to yellow from late spring and through to the warmer months. The heavenly perfumed flowers are displayed against lush, glossy dark green foliage. Ideal for pots on alfresco decks where they release their perfume on summer evenings and general gardens. Plant in warm, partly shaded areas that are well drained and humus enriched acidic soil. Feed Gardenias regularly to promote lush foliage and heavy flowering. Gardenia Gold Magic will grow to a height of 1-1.5m and width of 1-1.2m.
Tubular - The Corolla Forms A Tube

Gardenias are a stunning evergreen shrub with lush glossy dark green foliage and beautifully perfumed flowers. Gardenias are recognised as being some of the most highly fragrant flowers in the world. Romance produces large, soft-petaled, creamy-white double flowers which are long-lasting. These beautiful plants are suited to many situations including hedging, decorative containers in courtyards, bedding close to buildings, mass plantings and under-planting just to mention a few.Plant in a partly shaded sheltered area that is well drained and humus enriched acidic soil. Gardenias do like their water and will wilt when thirsty so mulching is beneficial and regular watering during flowering season is important. If watering is maintained and some shade provided, Gardenias will tolerate some high temperatures. Feed Gardenias regularly to promote lush foliage and heavy flowering particularly during growing season. Flowering occurs during late spring and throughout the warmer months. Gardenia Romance can be pruned/trimmed/shaped after flowering. Gardenias can also be topiarised and make a beautiful standard as a feature plant.Gardenia Romance grows to 1m high and 60cm wide.

Gazania Buccaneer is a hardy, mat-forming perennial with cheerful golden yellow, daisy like flowers that cover the plant during spring and summer. The foliage is silvery grey and forms to make a dense ground cover. Ideal for low water wise gardens and good for covering banks and on retaining walls. Keeps the weeds down.Grows to a height of 15cm high and 30cm wide.

Compact sturdy plants with bright pink flowers.  Drought tolerant variety great for borders or garden edging or containers.

This unique variety of Geranium produces larger, semi double, brilliant red blooms and attractive dense dark green foliage of a semi trailing habit. Flowering occurs through the warmer months. Big Red is ideal for hanging baskets, pots and planted throughout the garden. Plant in full sun or semi shaded area. Heat and drought tolerant, Water well until established, feeding with a controlled release fertiliser. Remove old flowers to encourage further flowering and prune to maintain shape.

Geranium's are ideal for any hot, sunny position in rich well drained soil. They are also perfect for containers both indoors and out. Keep well watered and apply fertiliser regularly to increase the size of the blooms.

The robust Garvinea hybrids are unlike any other Gerbera and are proven performers in sunny garden beds, borders and terraces! Coming in a wide range of brilliant colours, the flowers are long lasting, stemming from lush plants and can produce up to 100 flowers from early spring until the cold sets in. The 'Sweet Dreams' daisy-like flower is an amazing dark pink with 'dark' eyes and flowers prolifically through the seasons giving you constant bright colour.Being very versatile, these lovely plants are ideal mass planted, used along borders, in decorative containers, and fantastic as cut flowers, and the whole plant can be brought inside as temporary decorations for your entertainment and  function areas.Weekly watering is generally enough once established but more frequently in hotter weather and windy times.Very pest and disease resistant, this is a lovely addition to any garden.Mulching is always beneficial, and application of a slow-release fertilizer every 3-4 months.Gerbera Garvinea Sweet Dreams will grow to a height of 45cm and a width of 40cm.

Gleditsia Limegold is an elegant, attractive deciduous medium-sized tree perfect for creating a shady, cool area in your garden. The foliage is compiled of graceful fern-like leaves which during spring and early summer is a lovely fresh golden shade while later in summer the leaves turn a cooling lime-gold. In autumn the foliage turns yellow before falling. Being deciduous makes this the ideal tree to cover a tropical garden as the dapled shade is ideal. The flowers on this thornless tree are inconspicuous green racemes which are produced in spring. After flowering large brown legumes are produced and these tend to persist on the tree well into winter. Being a vigorous grower this tree is highly suitable as a shade tree in many situations including larger properties, domestic gardens, also as street trees. This popular cultivar  is best grown in full sun and performs better in moist, deep, fertile soils but will tolerate a wide range of soil types including moderately saline soils, urban areas, coastal locations, air pollution, as well as some levels of drought and flooding; will tolerate poor drainage. As with most plants, Gleditsia is waterwise but water well until established, also mulching is beneficial to retain moisture. In the early years an annual autumn pruning of the long 'whippy' branches will promote a strong framework and maintain shape as a feature tree.Gleditsia Limegold will grow to 9 to 12m tall and 6m wide.
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Gleditsia Ruby Lace is a medium sized deciduous tree with a rounded and open somewhat spreading habit, glossy, bronzy-green bipinnate leaves turning yellow in autumn. New foliage is ruby-red becoming purplish. Can tolerate urban sites, air pollution, moderately saline soils, low levels of drought and occasional wetness. performs in best in moist, deep fertile soils in a full sun position. relatively pest and disease free. Gleditsia adds colour and contrast to the landscape and provides dappled shade in parks and gardens.Grows to a height of 8m high and 6m wide.
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Gleditsia triacanthos var. inermis 'Shademaster' is a fast growing deciduous tree with attractive fine, lacy, dark emerald-green foliage and develops graceful ascending branches with a slight weeping habit. The flowers on this thornless tree are inconspicuous green racemes which are produced in spring. After flowering large brown legumes are produced and these tend to persist on the tree well into winter. Shademaster is relatively pest and disease free.As with most plants, Gleditsia is waterwise once established, also mulching is beneficial to retain moisture. In the early years an annual autumn pruning of the long 'whippy' branches will promote a strong framework while maintaining good shape as a feature tree.Gleditsia Shademaster will grow up to 15m tall and 8m wide.

Very popular as a street tree or in carparksThey prefer an open, sunny position in moist well drained soil and will tolerate frost and droughtGrows to a height of 8m high and 8m wide.

Grevillea Flat Jack is a hardy Australian native prostrate shrub with creamy white bird attracting fragrant spider flowers in winter and spring and narrow green spiky leaves with arching branches. Grevillea Flat Jack is an ideal groundcover suitable for embankments, coastal gardens and ladscapes.  Prefers a full sun position and well drained soil. A very tough plant that tolerates drought and frost. Low maintenance but will benefit from pruning after flowering, fertilise with a low phosphorus fertiliser in early springGrevillea Flat Jack grows to a height of 50cm with a spread of 2m wide
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Grevillea Crimson Villea is a compact dense small shrub with masses of stunning bright crimson flowers in autumn, winter and early spring and small dark green leaves.It is a tidy hardy plant ideal for mass plantings, native gardens, rockeries. It prefers a full sun position with well drained soil. It is drought, frost and moderately tolerant of humidity. It benefits from a light prune every couple of years and an application of slow release fertiliser annually.Grevillea Crimson Villea grows to height of 80cm with a spread of 80cm wide.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

This showy Grevillea is a very popular shrub due to its waterwise properties. Apricot Glow has dense, deep-green foliage and displays a profusion of spider-like glowing apricot flowers produced for an extended period from spring through to late winter. This Australian native has an upright growing habit with densely packed foliage. The native Grevillea is perfect for attracting birds to your garden. This particular Grevillea is ideal as a hedge, perfect for your native garden, or as a member of your general garden. Popular with landscapers for mass plantings and ideal as a screen.Grevilleas prefer full sun and are hardy and drought tolerant once established. They will grow in a large range of soil types, including coastal areas but will benefit from deep watering occasionally in dry weather. Apricot Glow is low maintenance, although pruning after flowering maintains the dense, compact growth. Feeding with a low phosphorus controlled release fertiliser in early spring or late summer is beneficial. Mulch to suppress weeds and retain soil moisture.Grevillea apricot glow will grow to a height of 3m and 1 - 2m wide.

Prune after flowering and fertilise with a long term, slow release, native fertiliserGrows to a height of 80cm high and 1.2m wide.

Grevillea Cherry Burst is a dense spreading shrub with greyish-green foliage, produces stunning cherry flowers from winter to spring, attracts nectar feeding birds. Grevillea Green Carpet is a dense spreading grevillea with soft silver green foliage and masses of white flowers in spring.An ideal ground cover plant for embankments, under planting deciduous trees, rockeries and landscapes. Grevillea Dorothy Gordon is a large compact evergreen shrub with large two toned purple/ mauve pink flowers and bronze new growth. Showy bright green foliage with bronze tips. Prefers a sunny position with well drained soil but will tolerate some shade. Drought hardy. Water well in dry periods and mulch well. Use native plant fertiliser in late spring and autumn.Grevillea Dorothy Gordon will grow to a height of 3m and a width of 2m.

Grevillea Ellabella is a natural hybrid forming a vigorous attractive groundcover. Produces soft green foliage and attractive red spider flowers from autumn right through spring.Ellabella is suitable for covering embankments or to cascade over retaining walls. It requires full sun and will grow in a wide range of soils including coastal areas and also attract nectar feeding birds.Can withstand periods of dryness once established and light pruning will encourage its compact growth habit.Grows to a height of 1m high and 3m wide.

Grevillea Ellendale Dragon is an attractive native shrub with clusters of large red pendulous spider flowers in winter and spring and arching grey foliage branches. Grevillea Firesprite is a spectacular hybrid between Grevillea venusta & Grevillea longistylla.  Bright green deeply lobed foliage is extremely attractive.  Flowers are flame red 8-10cm, terminal brushes ocurring on and off throughout the year, offsetting the foliage beautifuly, an extremely bright & eyecatching flower.Grows 3mtr high by 2mtr wide forming a dense shrub in an average to well drained sunny position, ideal for screens or hedges firesprite will make a colourful addition to any garden.  Can be pruned to form a neat rounded shrub.Firesprite is a ready made food bar for the parrots & honeyeaters that will flock to its flowers making it an ideal choice for the bird lovers garden.

Grevillea Hookeriana is an upright, evergreen shrub with lush dark green foliage and masses of deep red, toothbrush-like flowers from winter to spring. Plant in a sunny or partial shade position in well drained soil.   Useful screening and shelter shrub, excellent container plant and for embankment plantings. Flowers attract nectar feeding birds and are excellent for cutting. Tolerant of heavy frost and extended dry periods once established. Prune for compact growth.grevillea Hookeriana will grow to a height and width of 2-4m.

value: Grevillea Loopy Lou is a small, free flowering shrub producing masses of flowers all year round. The flowers are quite large considering the compact nature of the plant, birds love them and the colour changes between yellow, pink and red. 'Loopy Lou' is very hardy with a low water requirement once established.Ideal for low hedging  and borders. suited to a range of climactic conditions and soil types.Prune to shape once or twice a year.Grows to a height of 50cm high and 1.5m wide.
Coastal, Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Verge

Grevillea New Blood is a low spreading shrub with masses of deep red spider like flowers from autumn to spring and through out most of the year and small fine green leaves. An ideal plant for ground cover, courtyards, poolsides, containers, and coastal gardens. The flowers are bird attracting, and brings bees, and butterflies to the garden. Suits a sunny position and well drained soil, fast growing, hardy, and low maintenance.Grevillea hybrid New Blood grows to a height of 25cm with a spread of 1.5m wide.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Grevillea Jenkinsii is a densly foliaged shrub with broad soft grey-greenish leaves.  From Winter to Spring it bears a profusion of red spider like flowers.  The dense foliage of this Australian native plant makes it ideal for hedges.  Suitable for shrubberies & general garden use.  Grows well in a sunny position in well drained soil.  Tolerates drought, light frost & poor soils.  Prune after flowering to maintain compact growth.Grows to a height of 1m high and 1m wide.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Grevillea Liliane is an ornamental Australian native shrub with bird attracting dainty pink spider like flowers and dense leaves with weeping branches. An ideal plant for rockeries, native gardens, and containers. Once established it is frost and dry tolerant, prefers a full sun to part shade position in well drained soil. Prune after flowering to promote dense growth.Grevillea Liliane grows to a height of 1m with a spread of 1.5m wide
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

This attractive, wide spreading evergreen groundcover with bright green new growth and red flowers appearing almost year round.Adds colour to any garden over a long period. Flowers attract nectar feeding birds, is widely used and versatile groundcover for commercial or residential purposes. This plant thrives in a sunny well drained position. tolerant of light shade, dry periods, coastal conditions and frosts.Grows to a height of 30cm high and 2m wide.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Grevillea olivacea red is a Western Australian native. Commonly known as the olive leaf Grevillea due to the shape and colour of the foliage. This showy Grevillea is very popular due to its waterwise properties. Olivacea red has dense, deep-green foliage and displays a profusion of spider-like red flowers produced for an extended period from winter through to late spring. This native has an upright growing habit with densely packed foliage. This particular Grevillea is ideal as a hedge, perfect for your native garden, or as a member of your general garden. Popular with landscapers for mass plantings and ideal as a screen, it is also perfect for attracting birds to your garden.Grevilleas prefer full sun, they are hardy and drought tolerant, and will grow in a large range of soil types, including coastal areas. Will tolerate periods of dryness once established, but will benefit from deep watering occasionally in dry weather. Olivacea red is low maintenance although pruning after flowering maintains the desired shape. Feeding with a low phosphorus controlled release fertiliser in early spring or late summer is beneficial. Mulch to suppress weeds and retain soil moisture.Grevillea olivacea red will grow to a height of 2.5 to 4m high  and 2.5 - 4m wide.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Grevillea Outback Sunrise is a compact shrub with vibrant, green foliage and distinctive, yellow flowers and bright red styles blooming all year round. This variety of Grevillea bred by Kings Park and Botanic Gardens.A great addition to native gardens, mixed garden beds and is great for creating an informal screen. Plant in a full sun position with well-drained soil. Lightly prune to maintain a dense, compact habit. For optimal growth apply a slow release native fertiliser every 6-12 months.Grevillea Outback Sunrise will grow to a height of 2m and a width of 1m.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

Grevillea Gilt Dragon is a softer variety of Grevillea, is low-growing with a slight weeping effect which makes it an attractive plant even when not in flower. The foliage is grey-green in colour, looking almost lacey and compliments the red flowers perfectly. Grevillea have exotic flowers in many colours, and Gilt Dragon is no exception. Each flower-head is made up of small flowers which are densely crowded onto heads or spikes with their most conspicious feature being the long styles which are first bent over like a hair pin and then straighten out. The main flowering time for Gilt Fragon is spring through summer.These excellant waterwise natives are ideal for verge planting, cascading over banks, in mass plantings or even as a bedding shrub. Birds are highly attracted to grevillea flowers for the nectar.Grevillea enjoy full sun, thrive in well-drained, slightly dry, neutral to acid soil. Moderately frost hardy to frost tender and generally pest free. Gilt dragon doesn't mind a trim so can be shaped /pruned to suit almost any situation. Once established minimal water required, this is a very hardy plant! Moderately frost hardy to frost tender and generally pest free.Grevillea Gilt Dragon can reach a meter in height and 1 meter wide.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Grevillea Robyn Gordon ia a small-growing, popular evergreen native shrub, which produces a profussion of red flowers that are very popular with native birds. Grevillea have exotic flowers in many colours, and Robyn Gordon is no exception.They are deep red, not unlike a tooth-brush in shape. Each flower-head is made up of small flowers which are densely crowded onto heads or spikes with their most conspicious feature being the long styles which are first bent over like a hair pin and then straighten out. This bushy shrub has attractive lobed foliage and due to it causing skin irritation to some people it is advised to plant in an area where brushing past them can be avoided. Being a variety that flowers virtually all-year-round makes this a very decorative plant in any garden.This lovely Grevillea is very suitable for use as a boundary, in rockeries, cottage gardens, great as a hedge or screen, fine along fencelines, suitable for containers in courtyards and can be mass-planted.Robyn Gordon enjoys full sun to part-shade and as with most Grevillea, can tolerate many kinds of soil as they are very hardy and resilient. So almost any well-drained soil is preferable.As with most of these hardy natives, once estalished these tough plants require occasional watering during the dry hot months. Mulching to retain moisture and control weeds is an advantage. This grevillea doesn't require trimming but will tolerate a moderate to heavy pruning if required. Fertilisers containing phosphorus are best avoided.Grevillea Robyn Gordon can reach 2m in height and 1.5m wide.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

This new variety of Grevillea bred by Kings Park and Botanic Gardens for the RSL, to commemorate the Anzac Centenary, marking 100 years since Australian and New Zealand forces first stormed the shores of Gallipoli and the many other conflicts since then. The Grevillea has thrived and survived, as has the ANZAC spirit in times of hardship.The RSL Spirit of ANZAC Grevillea was selected for its lush bird attracting red flowers that appear from autumn to summer and its trans-Australian heritage and the tough geographical conditions in which it grows and thrives. This variety will thrive in well drained soils and is very drought tolerant. Prune in spring to keep compact and promote mass flowering, if left to grow to its full potential it will reach 2m height x 1.5m wide. Once established it will grow and flower well with twice weekly irrigation over summer and rainfall during the winter months.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

As part of the Kings Park plant breeding program ‘Scarlet Moon’ is another very successful grevillea hybrid which can be grown virtually anywhere in Australia This lovely plant is a hardy bird attracting shrub that boasts vibrant silvery-green foliage and white flower buds which open to become beautiful large and spectacular scarlet flowers that continue to bloom throughout the year.Attracting birds and nectar-loving insects, 'Scarlet Moon' brings life and tranquility to your garden.An ideal specimen for an informal screen, it reaches 1.6m tall and 1.6m wide. Suitable for all native and rock gardens, mass planted, or as a feature in a larger decorative container in your outdoor entertainment areas.Like all grevillea, 'Scarlet Moon' thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Lightly prune the plant to maintain a dense compact habit. Apply slow release native fertilizer every 6-12 months as required.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

This low-growing, spreading shrub with deep green foliage and masses of red, spider-like flowers in winter and spring, useful for coastal gardens and ideal for containers, embankments, rockeries and borders. ideal refuge for smaller birds. flowers attract nectar-feeding birds.Grows well in a sunny position in well drained soil, tolerant of light shade, drought and moderate frosts. Prune after flowering to maintain compact growth.Grows to a height of 50cm high and 1m wide.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

Grevillea Mini Marvel is an evergreen, attractive, fine-foliaged, mid-green spreading prostrate native which has bright-scarlet flowers ideal for attracting nectar-seeking birds. The fine foliage is almost web-like or lacey and very attractive in its own right. Each of the scarlet flower-heads is made up of many small flowers which are densely crowded onto heads or spikes with their most conspicious feature being the long styles which are first bent over  like a hair pin and then straighten out giving them a spider-like appearance. These appear over a long period of time and can continue all year.This hardy native is ideal as a ground cover, mass plantings, sprawling over embankments, cottage gardens and especially good for underplanting and roadside planting  Mini Marvel will perform better in full sun or part shade and will also tolerate poor soils although prefers a well-draining loam, sand or clay as well as coastal areas. Once Mini Marvel is established it is waterwise and requires minimal water although in extended dry periods will appreciate a deep watering occasionally and mulching to retain moisture is beneficial. After flowering a light prune will maintain the desired shape.Grevillea thelmania 'mini marvel' will grow to 50-100cm wide and 30cm high.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

Grevillea Red Lantern is one of the softer-foliaged low-growing varieties. The fine foliage is almost web-like or lacey and very attractive in its own right. Each of the bright-red flower-heads is made up of many small flowers which are densely crowded onto heads or spikes with their most conspicious feature being the long styles which are first bent over  like a hair pin and then straighten out giving them a spider-like appearance. These appear over a long period of time and can continue all year.This hardy native is ideal for mass plantings, sprawling over embankments, cottage gardens and are especially good for underplanting and in decorative pots in courtyards; also suitable as a low hedge.  Red Lantern will perform better in full sun or part shade and will also tolerate poor soils although prefers a well-draining loam, sand or clay as well as coastal areas. Once Red Lantern is established it requires minimal water although in extended dry periods will appreciate a deep watering occasionally and mulching to retain moisture and control weeds is beneficial. After flowering a light prune will maintain the desired shape and incourage a more a more bushy habit.Grevillea thelmania Red Lantern grows 1.5m tall by 2m wide.

Grevillea Warby Ranges is a tough growing, medium native Grevillea with grey, soft foliage and red and yellow spider flowers during the warmer months. Tolerates very dry conditions once established. This beautiful hardy screening shrub is a fast grower bearing yellow and pinkish red flowers which can appear  to be a soft gold colour.Avery versatile plant, 'Wimpara Gold' has many uses: hedging,traffic islands, cut foliage,front-line coastal plantings and screening as previously mentioned.Preferring full sun this hardy plant is also lime and coastal spray tolerant as well as frost hardy. Grows vigorously in sand, clay, alkaline or acidic soils.Attractive to nectar loving birds it brings nature into your garden.Drought tolerant once established it can be classed as waterwise.

Hedera canariensis is a vigorous fast growing climber & ground cover grown for their ornamental foliage.  A hardy plant which adapts well to indoors, ferneries, patios & the open garden. Hemerocallis stella bella is a hardy, easy to grow dwarf day lily with striking evergreen strappy foliage that will continually flower for up to 6 months of the year. Hemerocallis or Day Lily as they are more commonly known are ideal in mass in garden beds or potted into containers. These tough stunning perennials require little maintenance are are dwarf compact forms suitable for borders.

This delicate fern is beloved by houseplant collectors for its perfectly deep green and shiny, heart shaped leaves grow on short fuzzy stems. The dwarf growth habit of the Heart Fern makes it a perfect choice for small spaces. What's more, since the it loves water, this fern is ideal for containers with or without drainage, and can happily be planted in an enclosed terrarium. The Hemionitus arifolia thrives in medium to bright indirect light, and needs to stay moist at all times. Unlike many houseplants which don't like to stay wet, this sweet fern is perfect for that indoor gardener who wants to "over-love" their plants.

Herb Hanging Baskets are a great addition to any garden. Depending on season, the herbs alternate between;  Basil, Oregano, Parsley, Peppermint, Marjoram, Thyme or Coriander.Herbs are used for many things such as traditional medicines to flavouring foods. They add fragrance and aroma to all parts of the gardens.It prefers to sunny to partly shaded position in moist areas. Enrich soil with compost and feed with complete fertilser and liquid fertiliser.

Herb Pack is a delicious mix of aromatic herbs including Chives, Italian Parsley, Coriander and Sweet Basil. These herbs are ideal to use with meats, fish, poultry, salads and vegetables. They like to be planted in full sun to part shade in moist, well drained soil. Harvest frequently to encourage new growth. Herb pack is suitable for pots and containers.

This lovely, low-maintenance, native ground-cover produces masses of bright yellow flowers throughout late Autumn and Spring.Golden Sunburst is a cheerful mounding plant which forms a good shape naturally and so requires little or no pruning and is beneficial to any garden as it improves the water-holding capacity of the soil for other plants as well as assisting to suppress weeds.The lovely lush green foliage is a wonderful contrast to the bright 'buttercup' yellow flowers.Golden Sunburst will do well in soils ranging from quite acid to alkaline but good soil preparation is recommended when planting all plants to achieve the best results.Ideal in native and cottage gardens as well as verge planting, and perfect as a border in formal and informal gardens.initial fertilizing with a slow release fertilizer will help the plant to become established and following up with the occasional reapplication  of fertilizer when required.

Hibbertia scandens produce large golden-yellow flowers for most of the year amongst dark green glossy leaves on twining stems. This plant is an Australian native well accustomed to Australia's ever-changing climate meaning it is extremely hardy and will tolerate the sometimes harsh conditions.Hibbertia scandens is an ideal groundcover, especially over embankments and with support can become a climbing plant used to cover fences, walls, pergolas and buildings. Hibbertia scandens is best grown in a sunny, open position in well drained soil, but will tolerate part shade. Hibbertia scandens is hardy and will withstand coastal conditions, including salt-laden winds.Hibbertia scandens requires relatively low maintenance. Probably one of the most popular selections made by those who visit Benara Nurseries. Hibiscus tiliaceus rubra, also known as the Cottonwood Hibiscus, is a rounded medium sized native tree with heart shaped,deep green to red foliage. During spring this tree produces attractive pastel yellow flowers that stand out against the dark foliage. Hibiscus tiliaceus rubra is an incredibly versatile tree and commonly used as a dense screening tree, hedge, or as a shade or feature tree. It thrives in areas of full sun and is adaptable to most soils however it does prefer moisture. Hibiscus tiliaceus rubra has a tolerance to drought and will attract birds to the garden.Hibiscus tiliaceus rubra is a relatively low maintenance, waterwise plant. Being an Australian native, it is well accustomed to Australia's ever-changing climate meaning it is extremely hardy and will tolerate the Australia's sometimes harsh conditions.Hibiscus tiliaceus rubra can grow to a height of 8 metres and a width of 5 metres.

Hibiscus Tradewinds Samoa Wind is a gorgeous compact shrub with beautiful, large butterfly attracting pink flowers with dark pink centers which bloom from spring though to summer. The glossy green leaves on this plant is a great contrast to the vibrant flowers making it a great addition to your home or garden. Ideal for pots, containers and planting around a pool as it does not drop its leaves and adds a tropical feel.  Prefers full sun to part sun areas, well drained soils and is light frost tolerant. Lightly prune to encourage dense new growth and apply a general purpose fertiliser during the growing season.Hibiscus Tradewinds Samoa Wind will grow to a height of 1.2-1.8m and a width of 1.2-1.8m.

Prefers full sun and part sun areas with well drained soils and is light frost tolerant. Prune to encourage dense new growth and apply general purpose fertiliser during the growing season.Hibiscus Tradewinds Tonga Wind will grow to a height of 1.2-1.8m and a width of 1.2-1.8m.

Commonly known as the Kentia Palm, Howea forsteriana is an Australian native species that originates off the east coast on Lord Howe Island. Howea forsteriana is a relatively slow-growing palm that has a slender trunk with feather shaped, drooping fronds. Howea forsteriana has been used as an indoor plant since Victorian times and has proven to be as popular today as it was then. Howea forsteriana can tolerate low sunlight exposure, air conditioning and central indoor heating. Howea forsteriana is relatively low maintenance. When indoors, ensure Howea forsteriana is planted in an area of decent but indirect sunlight exposure, and do not overwater. If outdoors, situate in a shady area and avoid pruning as this can lead to fungal infections.Howea forsteriana can grow to a height of 9 metres and a width of 4 metres.

A fragrant and fast growing native tree with deep green foliage and yellow or white-yellow flowers. Hailing from more tropical forests of the east coast, the Native Frangipani has been well utilised in gardens and landscapes in the west. Visible in verge and island plantings throughout the streets of Perth with its delicate, fragrant flowers that last for a lengthy period in spring, it adapts to a wide range of well-drained soils. Sometimes quite erect in  habit the moderately-sized tree can grow to be more dense and bushy with pruning, further increasing it versatility. It enjoys full sun but can manage in part shade comfortably, meaning versatility in gardens, parks, lawns, streetscapes or landscapes.Grows in full sun - part shade, in most well-drained soils. Responds to pruning and that encourages more bushy growth habit. Mature height: 4 - 10m ; Mature width; 2 - 6m

Hypoestes Confetti Mix is an attractive, low maintenance plant that produces beautifully marked foliage in shades of burgundy, pink, white and carmine. Plant in spring, outside for best results. If you displaying the plants inside they can be sown all year round.Ideal for protected areas in the garden outside, well lit areas inside and sunrooms Hypoestes performs best in a partially shaded position and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly, keeping the soil moist throughout the growing season. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Hypoestes grows to approx. 25-35cm tall and should be planted 20cm apart.

Impatiens Apricot is a very popular plant that produces stunning apricot coloured flowers all year round, peaking from spring to autumn atop lush green foliage.Ideal for garden beds, borders, pots, containers, hanging baskets and mass plantings Impatiens prefer a potion in partial to deep shade but can survive in full sun provided they are sheltered from the intense sunlight in the middle of the day. Plant Impatiens in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to keep the plants from wilting. Add mulch on top of your garden bed to help retain moisture in the soil.Impatiens are fairly easy to grow and maintain. Spent blooms don't need to be deadheaded as impatiens self clean but fertilising your plants will help keep flower production strong. Cutting back your plants once they have fully bloomed will help encourage new growth.Impatiens grow to approx. 30cm high and should be planted 20cm apart.

Impatiens are beautiful, bright and compact plants that flower for long periods. Bring these cheery impatiens in a mixture of colours indoors and enjoy the way they brighten your home and your spirits with their vivid, happy colours. Impatiens are ideal for a light to part shade position in your garden. They are perfect for containers, both indoors and out. Keep them well watered and apply fertiliser regularly to maintain vigour.

Ipomoea Sweetheart Light Green is an eyecatching foliage plant. They have compact, bright lime green heart shaped leaves with a clumping habit that make them ideal for containers, hanging baskets and garden landscapes as a ground cover. They can tolerate in either full sun or semi shade, they are very hardy and fast growing Ipomoea Sweetheart Light Green grows to a height of 30 - 40cm with a spread of 1m wide

Ipomoea Sweetheart Purple is an eyecatching foliage plant. They have compact, dark purple, heart shaped leaves with a clumping habit that make them ideal for containers, hanging baskets and garden landscapes as ground cover

This South-African native has been widely planted globally due to its elegant long-lasting flowers. These lilac-blue, tubular flowers bloom during spring to summer and provide stunning colour during these months. Jacaranda mimosifolia forms semi-evergreen attractive fern-like foliage.Jacaranda mimosifolia is ideal as a feature tree in avenue or street plantings; however its moderate size means it is also well suited to suburban gardens as stunning specimen or feature tree. Jacaranda mimosifolia grows well in a sunny to partly shaded position, with moist, well draining soil. Jacaranda mimosifolia is waterwise and will benefit from light watering during summer months. Jacaranda mimosifolia can grow to a height of 15 metres and a width of 10 metres.

Juncus Krausii has tough, spine tipped green/brown leaves that can grow from 40cm - 150cm. It is commonly known as Salt Marsh Rush, Jointed Rush or Sea Rush and has dark reddish/purplish flowers clustered towards the end of the stem.

Juncus Pallidus, or more commonly known as Pale Rush or Great Soft Rush is a native species to southern Australia. This hardy grass grows from 70cm to 135cm in height and is usually found around fresh waterways, creeks and swamps that are subject to flooding.
Conifer, Evergreen, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Juniperus Conferta is a hardy, ground cover conifer, that tolerates salt-laden winds and grows well in most soil areas.Prefering full sun Juniperus conferta is extremely hardy and an ideal plant for roadsides, coastal planting, median strips, rockeries and parklands were a low maintance ground cover may be required.  Juniperus conferta is waterwise once established. If grown well Juniperus conferta will form a dense, green mat that will suppress weed growth.Juniperus conferta can grown up to 30cm high and 2m wide.
Conifer, Evergreen, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Juniperus procumbens nana is a low spreading, attractive confier with blue/green foliage on long, stiff, mat forming branches.An ideal, hardy ground cover that looks brilliant mass planted. Suits being grown under trees and is low maintenance due to it's slow growth habit.  Great plant commonly used for bonsai.  Prefers a well drained soil in a full sun or part shade position.Can grow up to 30cm high and 150cm wide.
Evergreen, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Succulent

Kalanchoe Silver Velvet Ears is an attractive rosette forming succulent with fine velvety white hairs that cover the brown tipped silver foliage. The thick fleshy leaves are soft to touch. A great plant for those borders, rockeries, mixed containers, at the base of trees or around structures and pools. Grows best in a full sun or lightly shady position with well drained soil. Fertilise with a liquid fertiliser during spring. Tolerates coastal and dry conditions. Kalanchoe Silver Velvet Ears will grow to a height of 45cm.

Kale Curly Blue is a green vegetable with tender, curled leaves which harvest best in cooler months with regular watering and nutrient rich soil. Great as an addition to salads as it is seen as a super food.
Deciduous, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Kniphofia Papaya Popsicle has a very short compact habit with charming, grass-like foliage and is an all-summer bloomer with beautiful orange-red flowers from spring through to autumn. A great addition to any garden and is perfect as a border plant, pathways, containers, or even when used for small spaces. Plant in full sun in well drained soil, it will need a little supplementary watering during dry periods.Kniphofia Papaya Popsicle will grow to a height of 12" and a width of 18".

Lagerstroemia Acoma is a small deciduous tree with pure white flowers in summer to early autumn attractive bark and foliage that changes colours in the cooler months before dropping.They are an excellent specimen tree for small gardens, or large containers.Lagerstroemia Acoma is a powdery mildew resistant cultivar, it is hardy and best suits a full sun position with well drained slightly acidic soil. It has moderate drought and heat tolerance.Lagerstroemia Acoma grows to a height of 3m with a spread of 3m wide.

Lagerstroemia indica Biloxi is a small deciduous tree with an upright, vase shaped canopy. The foliage changes from green to tones of yellow, orange and red during autumn. Impressive pale pink flowers are produced over an extended period from mid summer to early autumn.  The bark has an intriging pattern and is classified as one of the major features on this ornamental tree.Excellent for feature planting in large gardens and parks. It is also suitable for planting in pots, tubs and large garden beds.Prefers a full sun to partly shaded position with well drained soil. For best results plant in a location where there is adequate protected from hot, dry winds. Mulch well to supress weed growth and fertilise during spring. Prune to shape when required. Biloxi is a mildew resistant tree.Lagerstroemia indica Biloxi can grow up to 6m high and 4m wide.

Lagerstroemia Natchez is a small to medium sized deciduous tree with green foliage that turns shades of red and bronze during autumn. Pretty white flower clusters bloom during the summer months.  An excellent specimen tree for small gardens that looks great when planted in  decorative feature pots and large containers.Prefers a full sun position with well drained, slightly acidic soil. Lagerstroemia Natchez is a powdery mildew resistant cultivar with a moderate tolerance of heat and drought.Lagerstroemia Natchez grows to a height of 7m with a spread of 5m wide

Lagerstroemia Tuscarora is possibly the best of the red-flowering cultivars in the Indian Summer® range. It is a small deciduous tree with attractive bark and green foliage that turns shades of red and bronze during autumn. Vibrant coral-red flowers are produced during summer.The flowers and highly ornamental bark make this variety an ideal street tree. It is perfect for screening, small gardens and is suitable for pots and large containers.Produces best results when planted in a full sun position with well drained, slightly acidic soil. Lagerstroemia Tuscarora is a powdery mildew resistant cultivar. It is hardy and has a moderate tolerance of drought and heat.Lagerstroemia Tuscarora can grow to 6m high and 4m wide.

Lantana montevidensis is a small evergreen spreading ground cover it has masses of mauve flowers all year round but mainly through spring and summer and dark green serrated highly scented leaves. A very hardy plant low maintenance, ideal for rockeries, dry areas, containers. It prefers a sunny position, and is drought tolerant. Lantana Montevidensis grows to a height of 45cm - 90cm with a spread of 1.8 m wide

Larkspur Giant Imperial produces exquisite long spikes full of flowers in striking colours of pink, purple and white above elegant, green, feathery foliage. Ideal for garden beds, borders and cottage gardens and beautiful cut flowers Larkspur Giant Imperial prefers a position in full sun and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly, keeping the soil moist throughout the growing season. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Larkspur can sometimes attract Aphids which can attack new growth, treat Aphids with an insecticidal spray/soap or simply rinse them off with water but be cautious of over-watering; over-watering can lead to leaf spotting and root rot which can be lethal to your plants.Larkspur Giant Imperial grows up to 75cm high and should be planted 25cm apart. yHypthethe
Evergreen, Hedge, Herb, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree

Commonly known as the Bay Tree, Laurus nobilis is an aromatic, evergreen medium tree that produces dark green aromatic foliage and small yellow flowers. This slow growing tree is noted for its flavoursome leaves, which are usually dried and added to dishes such as soups, stews and spaghetti. Laurus nobilis is an ideal tree for topiary, hedging and screening.Plant Laurus nobilis in an area of full sun to part shade, with well draining soils. Laurus nobilis is frost tolerant, waterwise and low maintenance. Water well until established. Prune as desired as this will encourage more dense, compact growth. Laurus nobilis can grow to a height of 15 metres and a width of 3 metres.
