Lechenaultia Electric Blue is a small evergreen native shrub, with a mounding habit and delicate, green needle-like foliage and brilliant bright blue flowers that bloom abundantly during late Winter and Spring. Ideal for rockeries, borders, cottage gardens, and also suitable for pots. Plant in full sun with well drained soil and feed lightly during Spring with a native fertiliser. Drought tolerant.Lechenaultia Electric Blue will grow to a height and width of 60cm.
Leek has thick, edible, white stems with lush green leaves. It is more flavoursome when picked smaller. Leek is perfect not only for soups and casseroles, but also when paired with fish and seafood.
Lemon Balm has a flowery citrus flavour with a wide variety of uses in cooking and herbal teas. Prefers rich moist soil in partial shade.

This perennial herb is commonly cultivated for medicinal and culinary purposes for uses in things such as asian cuisines, teas, curries, oils, insect repellents and in antiseptics. Despite it being a common insect repellent, its scent can actually be used to attract honeybees.
Lemon-scented Tea Tree, Minature Tea Tree

Little Lemon Scents is a graceful weeping, evergreen, Australian native. It has a spectacular display of snow-white flowers in Spring and the foliage has a delightful fresh lemon scent when crushed. The compact habit of Little Lemon Scents PBR is far smaller growing and compact plant than its parent, Leptospermum petersonii (Lemon-Scented Tea Tree). It is an ideal specimen shrub for today's gardens and an excellent landscape plant. It may be pruned and kept to any height. Little Lemon Scents PBR is very adaptable, grows well in a range of soil conditions, tolerates extended wet or dry period and light frosts. Ideal for coastal regions. Little Lemon Scents PBR will grow to a height of 1.5 to 2 metres and 1.5 metres in width
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

The ideal Australian native hedge! Bred in Australia for Australian conditions. This plant is the perfect alternative to traditional English Box hedging! A versatile landscape performer with outstanding resilience to the harshest coastal conditions. Leptospermum 'Fore Shore' tolerates salt sprays and salt laden winds making it ideal for difficult coastal sites. It boasts stand out grey-green foliage with bronze coloured new growth. Very hardy, drought tolerant and a low water user, 'Fore Shore' is stand out performer for any garden or public landscape.Plant in most soil types that are well draining. Best grown in full sun but will tolerate part shade Lightly trim to maintain shape if desired. Water requirements are low. One established it is reasonably dry tolerant only occasionally requiring deep watering during extended periods of heatHedging - space approximately 30cm apart. Difficult sites such as coastal plantings, poolside landscapes, roadside verges, parks and other public open space. Smaller spaces such as patios and courtyards. Use in containers. Responds well to pruning, and great when clipped as a topiary

Leptospermum nanum rubrum is a species of tea tree that produces prolific flower displays of deep red to burgundy during winter to spring. This evergreen shrub is incredibly versatile and equipped with a compact, dwarf growth habit; creating denser foliage. Leptospermum nanum rubrum makes an ideal low hedge or a perfect addition to waterwise gardens. This variety is a stunning feature when in flower. Plant Leptospermum nanum rubrum in an area of full sun to semi shade with well draining soils. This species is hardy and tolerant of drought, frost, wind and overall coastal conditions.Leptospermum nanum rubrum requires low maintenance. Prune after flowering as this will encourage dense new growth. Use a suitable mulch to prevent weed growth and to retain soil moisture.Leptospermum nanum rubrum can grow to a height and width of 1 metre.

Lettuce Baby Bunting is delightful home garden variety which develops a small head at maturity. It is ideal for the home vegetable garden.  Lettuce Baby Bunting is used in salads, sandwiches and wraps.

Lettuce Cos is a loose leaf, uprught lettuce ideal for the home vegetable garden or containers. Plant or place in a full sun position in your garden. Lettuce Cos can be used in salads, sandwiches, wraps or as a garnish. Particularily suited for Caesar Salads.
Lettuce Frizzmo is, as its name suggests, bright green with frilly leaves. These leaves can be picked one leaf at a time as required. Use Lettuce Frizzmo in salads, sandwiches and wraps.
Lettuce Iceberg is a loose leaf lettuce ideal for the home garden or containers. It may be picked one leaf at a time. Use Lettuce Iceberg in salads, sandwiches, wraps or as a garnish.

Lettuce Mignonette green is a small, bright green butterhead lettuce. It is ideal for containers and the home vegetable garden and should be placed in full sun. Lettuce Mignonette Green is best picked one leaf at a time, as required. It can be used in salads, sandwiches, wraps and as a garnish.

Lettuce Mignonette Red is a small, bronze butterhead lettuce. It is ideal for containers and the home vegetable garden and should be placed in full sun. Lettuce Mignonette Red is best picked one leaf at a time, as required. It can be used in salads, sandwiches, wraps and as a garnish.

Lettuce mix has a selection of lettuce that may include Buttercrunch, Cos, Coral and Oakleaf. Harvest one leaf at a time. Use Lettuce Mix as a foundation for salads, in sandwiches and wraps or as a garnish.
Lettuce Oakleaf is a green lettuce with curly, crispy leaves. You can pick leaves continuously throughout the season. Use Lettuce Oakleaf in salads, sandwiches and wraps.

Lettuce Revolution is a sensational gourmet lettuce which is deep red to black in colour. It is a vigorous lettuce which matures in 48 days. It is slow to bolt and has good flavour. Lettuce Revolution can be used in salads, sandwiches and wraps.
Lanceolate - Pointed At Both Ends/Subulate - Tapering Point, Awl-shaped

Leucodendron Ebony is a stunning compact perennial shrub with dark red to purple foliage and vibrant, perfumed red flowers that are tinged with green and yellow. Ideal for the smaller garden and great in containers. Plant in full sun or part shade position in well drained soil. Prune in late winter to early spring to encourage flowering. Frost tolerant. Very low water requirement.Leucodendron Ebony will grow to a height of 2m and a width of 1.5m.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Leucadendron is a well known shrub that is suitable as a display shrub as well as for cut flowers. Baby bouquet is a small Leucadendtron, growing to about 1m tall and equally broad. The flowers on this particular variety are tiny, but the leaves near the flowers are strongly coloured, variegated yellow and orange. these ornamental leaves colour best in full sun, and will remain showy for several weeks either on the shrub or as a cut flower. Leucadendron grow best and produce the most colour in full sun. These plants must have well drained soils.

Leucophyta Silver Nugget is an unusually eye-catching shrub that produces silver-grey foliage in a tight, compact mound. This Australian native has a dwarf growth habit, creating a dense appearance and perfect for those small spaces in gardens or landscapes. Leucophyta Silver Nugget is a hardy and adaptable plant which is well suited to rockeries, borders and ideal for coastal landscapes.This variety thrives in sunny to partly shaded positions, with well drained soils and is both drought and frost tolerant. Leucophyta Silver Nugget requires low maintenance. Keep soil moist during hot dry weather and apply a liquid fertiliser during spring.Leucophyta Silver Nugget can grow to a height and width of 50 centimetres.

Commonly known as the Sweet Gum, Liquidambar styraciflua is a highly valued deciduous tall tree that forms attractive corky bark and decorative maple like leaves. During Autumn this ornamental specimen produces brilliant autumn colour with tones of red, yellow, orange, crimson and purple. Liquidambar styraciflua is an ideal shade tree for large gardens and parks. It also makes an excellent specimen or lawn tree. This variety thrives in an open, sunny position with moist, well drained soils. Liquidambar styraciflua is frost tolerant, as well as moderately coastal tolerant. Liquidambar styraciflua is relatively low maintenance. Fertilise in spring with a slow release fertiliser. Mulch well to suppress weeds and conserve soil moisture. Liquidambar styraciflua can grow to a height of 30 metres with a width of 8 metres.
Evergreen, Grasses, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens

Liriope Silver Lawn is a low growing plant with green and cream variegated strappy foliage that looks almost silver in the distance. Ideal as borders, shrubberies, groundcover and looks great in mass plantings as the colour would be a great contrast any plant in any garden. Prefers full sun to heavy shade postiions and works well in most sl conditions. Light frost and drought tolerant.Trim older leaves or cut back once a year to promote new growth.Liriope Silver Star can grow up to 35cm high and 40cm wide.
Evergreen, Grasses, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens

Emerald Cascade' is a stand out tough-as-nails garden performer, tolerating a wide range of adverse conditions. Not only will Emerald Cascade tolerate extended periods of dryness in situations such as beneath the eaves of a home, or under the canopy of a tree, it also does well with minimal care inside the home or office. 'Emerald Cascade' has dramatic weeping emerald green foliage, and produces cobalt blue berries in the spring and summer. It is non-invasive, spreading slowly to form graceful thick mounds of foliage, and makes for a dense ground cover when planted en masse. It's for this reason that it lends itself perfectly to low maintenance landscapes, in both the domestic and public open space environments. Emerald Cascade is without a doubt, one of the toughest plants available for the landscape and will find itself at home in most situations.Extremely low water requirements once established, requiring only occasional deep watering during extended periods of heat. Emerald Cascade grows well in most soil types and is low maintenance. No pruning required. Simply feed in spring with a slow release general purpose fertiliser according to manufacturer directions for optimum resultsSmall gardens, patios and courtyards. Indoors, requiring low light and is very tough.  Mass planting as a low maintenance ground cover. Planting beneath open canopy trees. Ideal for edging garden beds or paved surfaces (plant 20cm apart). Use around poolside landscapes and entertainment areas to add a lush atmosphere.
Evergreen, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring

Liriope Evergreen Giant is an attractive clumping perennial that forms long, green strappy foliage. During spring through to summer, this foliage houses blooms of violet flowers that sit high above the foliage. Main uses for Liriope Evergreen Giant include mass and feature plantings, specimen plants and as a border along paths and fencing. Liriope Evergreen Giant is well suited to sandy to clay soils, with positions of full sun and light to heavy shade. It remains as the most evergreen variety of Liriope. Liriope Evergreen Giant is unlikely to produce a viable seed making it a safe alternative as its chance of spreading is restricted. Water regularly until established. As Liriope Evergreen Giant is very tough and hardy, barely any maintenance is required. Trim as desired.Liriope Evergreen Giant will grow to a height and width of 50cm.
This variety performs well in low-light conditions. Dwarf variety can also be used as a border bedding plant. Prefers warmer temperatures for best results.  Beautiful blue flowers all summer
This variety performs well in low-light conditions. Dwarf variety can also be used as a border bedding plant. Prefers warmer temperatures for best results

These hardy annual succulents will flower from winter to spring all around Australia! They put on a striking display with colours of orange, yellow, pink, purple and bi-coloured flowers. They are frost hardy but also perform extremely well in hot and humid conditions. Good for rockeries, pots, containers and also as edging plants.
Evergreen, Grasses, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

A graceful fine leaf form of Lomandra longifolia from Ozbreed with deep green strappy foliage and attractive yellow flowers appearing in early spring. This Australian native plant has proven to be a tough survivor in many landscapes for the past ten years, including harsh roadside and medium strip environments to home gardens.Tanika is a low maintenance plant ideal for mass plantings and borders. This grass-like landscape plant tolerates full sun, moderate and full shade. Tanika only requires occasional watering in dry areas and times of drought and will tolerate most soil types but prefers to be well drained.Water regularly while establishing the plant. Water and fertiliser are rarely required after establishment as fertilizing will darken foliage. Trim to 15cm with sharp implement outside hot dry periods to generate new growth as required.Tanika grows to a height of 50-60cm with a spread of 65cm wide.
Evergreen, Grasses, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

This evergreen fine leaf form of Lomandra longifolia resembles a grass tree without the trunk. Its narrow, strappy leaves produce small striking yellow flowers from September to October which contrasts against its blue-toned foliage. Lomandra longifolia 'Nyalla' tolerates a wide range of soils and climates. This native is suited to full sun as well as shaded positions. The soil types Lomandra longifolia 'Nyalla' prefer tends to be sandy loam, clay loam and free draining light clay.  Often seen in coastal landscapes, other uses for Lomandra longifolia 'Nyalla' also include mass planting in gardens, roadsides, and residential and commercial planting. The foliage is also popular in flower arrangements as foliage filler.  Very little maintenance is required for Lomandra longifolia 'Nyalla'. Plant in a well mulched garden, fertilise with a slow release fertiliser early spring. Water well until established but avoid over watering in heavier soils.Lomandra longifolia 'Nyalla' will grow to a height and width of 80 centimetres.
Evergreen, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

A compact, clumping, ornamental grass with blue foliage. similar in habit to tussock grass, but rarely needs trimming. useful for mass plantings, foliage or grassy gardens, for borders or as an accent plant.Tolerates a wide range of climatic conditions, full sun to part shade. Very hardy, excellent drought and frost tolerance.Wingarra is an Australian native and is often used on roadside plantings where it performs and looks great, with no irrigation, only natural rainfall. In extra dry environments, occasional top up waterings may be required in the warmer months.
Evergreen, Grasses, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Lomandra fluviatilis 'Shara' is a relatively new form of Lomandra featuring an arching fine leaf with very soft blue grey tones. It is a productive flowerer with vibrant maroon bracts and golden margins which appear in spring and sit high above the foliage.  It is more compact and flowers more frequently than other forms. Testing has shown it is a strong performer in sandy, loam and clay loam soils. Uses for lomandra fluviatilis 'Shara' include mass planting in both wet and dry areas, roadsides and borders. Lomandra fluviatilis 'Shara' is a very low maintenance plant. Water well until established. Use a slow release fertiliser if necessary to encourage fresh re-growth. Lomandra fluviatilis 'Shara' will grow to a height of 40cm and a width of 50cm.
Evergreen, Grasses, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Lomandra 'Frosty Top' is a graceful, lightly weeping plant that produces fine grey-green foliage with silver frosted new growth. During late winter Lomandra 'Frosty Top' will bloom perfumed yellow flowers displayed on purple stems up until early summer. Lomandra 'Frosty Top' is an ideal specimen for borders along pathways or driveways. It is also appropriate for pots or containers. Lomandra 'Frosty Top' will tolerate moderate frosts and coastal conditions. Lomandra 'Frosty Top' is low maintenance. Trim spent flower stems. Feed with phosphorous native fertiliser early spring or late summer. Lomandra 'Frosty Top' can grow to a height of 15-25 centimetres and a width of 40-60 centimetres.

A compact selection with fine, lime-green leaves that stay lush all year round. in summer, fragrant, small yellow flower spikes emerge. This plant is extremely hardy and tolerates frost and dry conditions, grows in full sun to part shade and is adaptable to most clay, loam and well drained soils and performs well under trees. Lime tuff is a very hardy tufted plant that requires little maintenace. no pruning required. Apply slow release fertiliser once a year.

An unusual and exceptionally small compact Lomandra producing small cream flowers amongst the foliage in spring. provides structure to the landscape when planted in borders, great for mass plantings and rockeries.It tolerates a wide range of soils and climatic conditions, suited to full sun and partly shaded postitions, requiring little or no maintenance. occasionally fertilise with slow release fertiliser to keep leaves a deep colour, exhibits drought tolerance.

A low growing, clumping plant with grass-like foliage. small yellow, flower spikes are borne within the foliage. Perfect for creating borders, low informal hedges or as indivdual specimens in rockeries. also suitable for adding structure and foliage contrast in cottage gardens and perennial bordersPrefers full sun, but tolerates part shade and a wide range of climatic conditions.Little Pal is a very hardy tufted plant that requires little maintenance. no pruning required. To maintain plant health and vigour fertilise annually with a native slow release fertiliser.

The improved version of Lomandra longifolia 'Katrinus'. The difference being this variety is a more compact form with larger clusters of perfumed yellow flowers. Lomandra longifolia 'Katrinus Deluxe' also has a tall growth habit. This evergreen variety grows well in full sun and moderate to heavy shaded positions, whilst withstanding windy, frost and drought climates. Along with the Lomandra longifolia Katrinus, 'Katrinus Deluxe' can be applied for the same uses such as mass planting, borders and roadsides as well as specimen planting. Watering is necessary for the first 2-3 months to establish the plant. Once Established Katrinus Deluxe is waterwise.  Further occasional watering will be required in times of extreme drought. Lomandra longifolia 'Katrinus Deluxe' can grow to a height and width of 70cm.

With arching vibrant green foliage, Lomandra 'Katie Belles' is a graceful clumping perennial, blooming with an abundance of highly perfumed yellow flowers through spring. Flowers often stay in bloom for months at a time and can sometimes repeat flowering.
 Lomandra Katie 'Belles' is a full sized evergreen Lomandra hystrix, preferring most soil types and also tolerating dry conditions. It can also withstand windy salt laden, drought and frost positions with very low maintenance required. Plant Lomandra 'Katie Belles' in full sun to part shade locations.
A key advantage of Lomandra 'Katie Belles' is its' versatility. It can be used for mass plantings, screening on roadsides, commercial and residential gardens, and also erosion control. 
Using chunky mulch is recommended when planting Lomandra 'Katie Belles'. Watering is necessary for the first 2-3 months to establish the plant. Further watering may depend on locations in particular dryer areas such as WA and SA. 
Lomandra 'Katie Belles' can grow to a height of 2 metres and a width of 1.5 metres.

Savanna Blue has superb blue contrasting foliage and a nice texture. Low height, excellent drought tolerance and rarely, if ever, needs trimming. Ideal as a border or ground cover for smaller modern gardens.Very well suited to areas of Western Australia.Flowers August - September, plant April - OctoberUses - mass plantings and modern gardensPlant in full sun to part shade. Tolerates frost and drought. Suits a variety of soil types.Low maintenance once established; water in extreme droughtHeight and width 30cm x 30cm

Lonicera japoncia purpurea is a fast growing evergreen climber with dark green foliage that is tinted with purple. Produces clusters of fragrant, white and maroon tubluar flowers from summer through to autumn.Great for growing up trellises and over walls and fences. It can also be used as a ground cover when planted without a support structure. Thrives in a full sun to partly shaded position with moist, well drained soil.Prune well after flowering to promote fresh new growth. Flowers are butterfly attracting.Lonicera japoncia purpurea can grow up to 7m high.

The deepest, darkest coloured foliage found amongst Loropetalums year round. Long season of interest for entertainment areas, informal hedging or mass planting larger areasGrows well in most soils which are well draining. Add a touch of Australia to your garden with this stunning Kangaroo Paw. Macropidia fuliginosa is an eye-catching black and lime green variety that varies from the commonly cultivated Anigozanthos Kangaroo Paw, as black and green flowers are rarely found with Australian Native Plants. Theses flowers sit high above the sword-shaped, blue-green leaves. Macropidia fuliginosa is ideal for patio pots or containers. They are also a popular choice for cut flowers, rockeries and borders. Plant Macropidia fuliginosa in an area of full sun to partial shade, with well drained soil. Once established, Macropidia fuliginosa is highly drought tolerant. Being native, it can tolerate the dynamic Australian climate. Macropidia fuliginosa is relatively low maintenance. Water well until established, and occasionally throughout extended dry periods. Macropidia fuliginosa can grow to a height of 1.8 metres and width of 1 metre.

Magnolia Alta is an evergreen hedge or tree with a compact and upright growth habit. The glossy apple green leaves looks fantastic when lit up at night. Massive creamy white, scented flowers appear in warmer months. Great feature tree.Prefers moist, well drained, slightly acidic soil in full sun but will tolerate part shade.  It is ideal for screening or hedging as it can be pruned to shape. Water well until established and during drier months. Relatively quick growing for a Magnolia. Tip prune to maintain dense growth. Can be shaped into giant topiary balls or standards. Magnolia Alta will grow to a height of 9m and a width of 4m.

The 'Emerald Spire' Magnolia is a more narrow variety compared to most of the others magnolia.Popular for it's conical neat form of  glossy pointed green leaves and large fragrant flowers which in turn attract life giving birds and insects to your garden. Liking plenty of sun, protection from winds and frost are an advantage and fertile moist acidic soil  will promote the best performance.'Emerald Spire' are a hardy low maintenance variety suitable for screens or as a feature in your garden.Mulching is always advised to assist in retaining moisture along with regular fertilizing.

The Magnolia 'Greenback' is a winner when it comes to the evergreen varieties. The dense canopy of rich, shiny green foliage are a great selection for any landscape.Greenback' magnolia has large creamy-white flowers with a lemony fragrance which are produced during summer months at the branch tips.'Greenback' is a moderately growing tree with a narrowly pyramidal shape which will broaden as time goes on. Being tightly branched it has excellent uniformity. Very adaptable to a variety of sites and also has a good heat tolerance once established. Easily withstands drought, heat, humidity and pollution.The foliage is noted for the smooth velvet less backs on the mature foliage which, combined with the dense uniform and upright growth habit makes for an excellent specimen or screen.Ideal for use in private gardens, parks and other public areas or open spaces.'Greenback' will thrive in any moist organic soil although preferring acidic soil it will tolerate a slightly basic, even wet or clay soil.'Greenback' magnolia would be fine in generous sized containers while still young but planting out is recommended later.

Magnolias are one of the most spectacular flowering shrub or trees due to its stunning flower displays. This particular evergreen variety, Magnolia Kay Parris, is a dense small tree with dark green glossy leaves and brown velvety undersides. Kay Parris flowers in May and produces creamy-white, fragrant flowers that contrast against the dark foliage. Kay Parris differs from other varieties as it has a wavy edge to its foliage, as well as its bright pink new growth. Magnolia Kay Parris is a relatively fast growing variety and is ideal for screening or hedging as it can be pruned to shape. It can also be placed in large pots or containers. Plant Magnolia Kay Parris in an area of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil. Once established, Magnolia Kay Parris is a hardy and versatile plant that will tolerate a range of conditions and is relatively disease and pest free. Magnolia Kay Parris is waterwise and low maintenance. Water well until established and during drier months.  Use a slow release fertiliser during spring.Magnolia Kay Parris can grow to a height of 4 metres and a width of 3 metres.

Maireana oppositfolia is a great small feature Western Australian native shrub. They grow in an upright position with very tight narrow grey foliage. Mandevilla Classic Dark Red PBR is a fast growing evergreen that will remain as a small shrub if grown in a full sun position, reaching a height of approximately 1m. However, when planted in partial shade, the plant will produce trendils and become a climber.
Produces delicate deep red flowers during the warmer months.  It can flower all year round when planted in tropical areas.

Ideal for growing on a trellis or over fences, carports and verandahs. It also makes a fantastic potted feature for patio or alfresco areas.

Water regularly during warm weather, but do not allow soil to become waterlogged. Use a controlled release fertiliser to maintain good health and promote new growth.

Mandevilla Crimson Fantasy is an ideal for hanging baskets, patios and balconies, especially when grown on a trellis or frame.Plant Mandevilla Crimson Fantasy in an area of full sun to part shade. Crimson Fantasy is relatively low maintenance. Use a well drained, organically rich potting mix. Keep soil moist and ensure the soil does not dry out. Prune to maintain shape and dense growth. Mandevilla Opale Citrine PBR is the first yellow Dipladenia/Mandevilla ever created worldwide and was awarded "Best variety of the Year" by the jury of the IPM Essen show that was held in Germany in 2011. Opale 'Citrine' is still the only yellow Mandevilla available on the market!This evergreen climber has lush shiny foliage, complimented by distinctive bright yellow blooms that flower continuously from spring through to late autumn. Mandevilla Pretty Rose Pink is a climbing plant which will produce lots of beautiful Pink coloured flowers during the spring season. This attractive flowering plant is popular addtiton to an outdoor garden and would suit any garden.Pretty Rose Pink require trellis or a structure it can be supported by, such as a fence or pergola. As a potted plant though, they are suited to spend several days inside but will need to be taken out side once flowering for fresh air.They are best grown in full sun positions and will lose some, or all, of its leaves when the winter months come alone. Prune regularly to maintain the shape of this climber. Do not water to excessively and keep the soil dry, not to wet. As it is a high flowering plant you will need to apply fertilser regularly.Mandevilla Pretty Rose pink can grow up to 5m high and 5m wide.

Mango Kensington Pride is a large fruiting tree which will produce moderate crops of medium sized fruit. The fruit is yellow fleshed, uniquely sweet tasting and has a great aroma. It will start fruiting in spring through to summer.The fruit can be used in fresh salads, jucies, sauces, dried, the options are endless.When planting make sure you cultivate the soil well and dig twice the hole of the pot. Fill hole firmly and water well. Water regularly until the plant is full established and mulch well.Mango Kensington Pride will grow up to 12m high and 12m wide.

Marigold Boy O Boy Orange are petite plants that produce vibrant orange coloured double flowers on compact, bushy plants. They will provide beautiful flowers all summer long, especially if spent blooms are removed.Ideal for garden beds, borders, containers and rockeries Marigolds prefer a position in full sun and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly especially during dry periods. Add mulch on top of your garden bed to help retain moisture in the soil.Marigolds can sometimes attract mites, treat them with an insecticidal spray/soap or simply rinse them off with water. Leafminer can also affect Marigold plants but does not spoil flowering, it can only be treated with a systemic insecticide so is usually left untreated.Marigolds grow up to approx. 25cm high and should be planted 20cm apart.

Marigold Zulu Orange is a bushy, compact plant with large double flowers. It has vibrant orange blooms that make a beautiful display in garden beds, borders and pots. Plant Marigold Zulu Orange in a sunny position in your garden.
Marjoram is a perennial herb with flavoursome leaves, sweeter than oregano. It is ideal for use in pasta and meat dishes, soups or with tomatoes.

Marjoram is a perennial herb with flavoursome leaves, sweeter than oregano. It is a low growing herb that produces small, white to pink flowers in summer. It is ideal for use in pasta and meat dishes, soups or with tomatoes.

Melaleuca Green Globe is a dwarf Australian native which produces white to cream bottlebrush flowers in spring upon lush green foliage. Green Globe will form a compact, rounded mound shape in the garden. This plant is perfect for hedging, shaping or as a feature shrub in the garden. It can also be ideal for pots. It can tolerate full sun to part shade. Cultivate the soil before planting. Dig the whole twice a big as the container and place the plant in. Firmly fill the soil level to the plant and water regulary until established. Prune after flowering to maintain.Melaleuca Green Globe can grow up to 1.5m high and 1.5m wide.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

Melaleuca incana nana is an Australian Native shrub that forms fine grey-green leaves and an abundance of brush-like, pale yellow flowers during spring and summer. These flowers will entice birds to the garden. This variety is a dwarf form and fast growing, creating a dense and bushy appearance. Melaleuca incana nana is ideal for low hedging. This variety can also be placed in rockeries, containers and mixed borders. Plant Melaleuca incana nana in an area of full sun to part shade positions, with well drained soils. Once established. Melaleuca incana nana is a hardy specimen and will tolerate drought and light frosts. Melaleuca incana nana is relatively low maintenance. Prune as desired to encourage dense growth. Only two days of watering needed once established.Melaleuca incana nana can grow to a height of 1 metre and width of 1.5 metres.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Verge

Melaleuca Little Nessie a Australian Native dense round shrub with bright green foliage. It produces stunning gold tipped, mauve globular flowers in summer. This plant would be ideal for seaside gardens, headging and even in a pot. It would look stunning in any garden,Plant in a sunny to partly shaded position in all soil types. Once it is establised it will be a waterwise plant. It is also light frost and salt tolerant. Prune after flowering to maintain compact growth. Melaleuca Litlle Nessie can grow up to 2m high and 2m wide.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Melaleuca Little Red is a dwarf form, compact shrub that produces fragrant foliage. From April to October Melaleuca Little Red forms showy displays of brilliant purple-red new growth, contrasting from the soft grey-green. Melaleuca Little Red is ideal for a small, compact hedge. This variety can also be placed in rockeries, containers and mixed borders.Plant Melaleuca Little Red in an area of full sun to part shade positions, with well drained soils. Once established. Melaleuca Little Red is a hardy specimen and will tolerate drought and light frosts. Melaleuca Little Red is relatively low maintenance. Prune as desired to encourage dense growth. Only two days of watering needed once established.Melaleuca Little Red can grow to a height and width of 1 metre.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Melaleuca 'quinquenervia' is commonly known as the Broad-leaved Paperbark. This species is a small to medium sized tree with the trunk covered by a white, beige and grey thick papery bark; hence the name 'Paperbark'. During spring through to autumn Melaleuca 'quinquenervia' blooms white bottlebrush-like flowers that contrast against the grey-grey foliage. Melaleuca 'quinquenervia' is ideal for screening, windbreaks, rural properties, large gardens and parks. Plant in an area of full sun with well drained soils. Will thrive in wet ground but will tolerate drier soils as well as alkaline and salty conditions. Once established it will tolerate a range of climatic conditions, some of these including coastal positions, drought and light frosts. Melaleuca 'quinquenervia' is also fire retardant and will regenerate its foliage after damaging fires. Melaleuca 'quinquenervia requires low maintenance. Melaleuca 'quinquenervia' can grow to a height of 8 - 12 metres and width of 2 - 4 metres.
Evergreen, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree

Metrosideros Cream Ridge is a hardy trunked shrub or small tree that forms glossy green foliage, with rich, creamy white margins. During spring and summer, Metrosideros Cream Ridge blooms spectacular crimson pincushion flowers that are made up of fluffy stamens. This is an excellent shrub for bird lovers.Metrosideros Cream Ridge is ideal for hedging or screening as the foliage is incredibly dense. Metrosideros Cream Ridge will thrive in a sunny position with moist well drained soils. Once established this variety will tolerate coastal conditions.Metrosideros Cream Ridge is waterwise and relatively low maintenance. Water well until established and throughout hot, drier periods. Prune as desired to encourage compact growth. Protect from frosts. Feed with a long term fertiliser in late winter after frosts have cleared. Metrosideros Cream Ridge can grow to a height of 3 metres and a width of 2.5 metres.

A relatively recent release, Metrosideros Dalese is a low growing shrub that has small lime green foliage, growing in a compact habit. During summer this variety blooms red, petite flowers. This densely growing plant is ideal for low hedges and borders, especially grown in front of a patio or along a driveway. Metrosideros Dalese will thrive in a sunny position in well drained soil. Once established Metrosideros Dalese will withstand exposure to coastal conditions. Metrosideros Dalese is relatively low maintenance. Prune as desired to encourage compact new growth. Water well during extended dry periods.Metrosideros Dalese can grow to a height of 1 metre and a width of 1.5 metres.
Evergreen, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Tree

Metrosideros Fiji is a hardy trunked shrub or small tree that forms glossy dark green foliage, with deep burgundy new growth. During spring and summer, Metrosideros Fiji blooms spectacular crimson pincushion flowers that are made up of fluffy stamens. Metrosideros Fiji is ideal for hedging or screening as the foliage is incredibly dense. Metrosideros Fiji will thrive in a sunny position with moist well drained soils. Once established this variety will tolerate coastal conditions.Metrosideros Fiji is relatively low maintenance. Water well until established and throughout hot, drier periods. Prune as desired to encourage compact growth. Protect from frosts. Feed with a long term fertiliser in late winter after frosts have cleared. Metrosideros Fiji can grow to a height of 3 metres and a width of 2 metres.

Metrosideros Spring Fire is a compact, broad spreading shrub. It has lime green foliage and produces red-orange bottlebrush flowers during spring and summer. Spot flowering will occur throughout the year, bird attracting and butterflies to the area.Spring Fire looks great in any garden and is great for borders, mixed beds, hedging, feature pots and large containers. A full sun to partly shaded position is preferred with well drained soil.Tolerant of coastal conditions, light frost and is waterwise once established.Metrosideros Spring Fire will grow up to 5m high and 2m wide.

Mulberry English Black is a vigorous growing, attractive deciduous fruiting tree of dense dark green foliage. Plump edible fruit appear in late spring and summer and will colour from red to black as it ripens.An ideal specimen tree of in parks and larger gardens and the fruit from this tree would great in jams and desserts.Prefers to be in full sun positions and moist-well drained soils. It requires alot of watering in the warmer months. Mulch well, Prune and Fertilise regularly. Mulberry English Black can grow up to 10m high and 5m wide

Mulberry Hicks Fancy is a vigorous, small growing, attractive deciduous fruiting tree of green foliage. Small plump edible fruit appear in late spring and summer and will colour from red to black as it ripens.The fruit from this tree would great in jams and desserts.Prefers to be in full sun positions and moist-well drained soils. It requires alot of watering in the warmer months. Will need to be pruned yearly as fruit is produced on new growth.Mulberry Hicks Fancy will grow up to 4m high and 4m wide.

This attractive shrub is a must in any Indian-food lovers garden. The fresh leaves from this Murraya have a distinct, spicy, curry-like flavor and odor. Ideal in curries, vegetable dishes, chutneys and pickles. There is more flavor in the 'fresh' product than the dried herb range.This is the TRUE curry-leaf plant so don't get it confused with the 'Helichrysum' Grey-leafed perennial which are not used in cooking.Murraya koenigii is a good hedging plant or ideal as a screen, with scented leaves and fragrant flowers and is also often called 'Orange Jessamine' as is the sister plant Murraya 'paniculata'.Will tolerate most soils and needs only moderate watering once established.The Murraya 'koenigii' is also self pollinating and an evergreen shrub (may become deciduous in colder times) so you can cook with the fresh leaves any time of the year.This is a vigorous grower so if you have limited space it is advised you grow in a generous sized container, making it an attractive addition for your veranda or outdoor entertaining areas.Seeds could be harmful and should not be eaten.Murraya koenigii will grow to a height of 4m.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Commonly known as Orange Jessamine, Murraya paniculata is a tropical, evergreen large shrub. This variety is closely related to citrus hence why their creamy white flowers smell just like orange blossom.  These flowers appear in abundance in spring then again in late summer or early autumn. Murraya paniculata has a dense, twiggy habit making it excellent for privacy screening or hedging. It can also be used in containers or pots. Plant Murraya paniculata in a sunny area with well drained soil rich in organic matter. It is also well suited for warm-climate gardens.Murraya paniculata is relatively low maintenance. Prune lightly two to three times a year in spring or summer to maintain dense foliage growth. Water well until established and protect from frosts. Murraya paniculata can grow to a height and width of 3 metres.
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Banana's are a versatile plant in any landscape and can add a lush, tropical feel to any area. This variety produces large, exotic leaves and sweet, tasty fruit.  One of the most successfully grown banana varieties in Perth, William Cavendish is a small growing variety making it stable, wind resistant and easier to manage. Cavendish Banana is ideal for large pots, containers and planted in the garden bed. This variety will thrive in a sunny position with moist, rich soil, full of well rotted compost and manures.Cavendish Banana requires moderate maintenance. Use an organic fertiliser through the growing season that is rich in potassium e.g. Potash. Musa William Cavendish can grow to a height of 2 metres

Myoprum Parvifolium Pink is an  evergreen spreading groundcover with bright green, fleshy leaves. This easy to grow Australian native plant produces a profusion of pink, star shaped flowers in summer. An excellent plant for rockeries, gorund cover or embankments.Grows best in full-sun, but will tolerate some shade. Creeping boobialla tolerates coastal conditions and short periods of dryness, and will do well in a wide range of well drained soils. Prune well to promote compact growth.Myoporum parvifolium Pink can grow up to 2m wide and 30cm high.

Myoporum parvifolium 'Purpurea' ia a groundcover which produces small white, 'Starry' flowers which almost entirely cover it's fine, evergreen, purple tinged foliage during summer.An evergreen matting ground cover ideal for rockeries, dry sunny banks and low maintenance gardens. Small, white, 'starry' flowers are produced in summer, above attractive, purple tinged foliage which deepens in colour during winter.Performs best when planted in full sun or semi-shade, thrives in well drained soils and enjoys extra water over the hotter months of the year.Myoporum Parvifolium Purpurea can grow up to 40cm high and 150cm wide.

This small, slow-growing shrub is recognised for its glossy, aromatic, dark green foliage. During spring tiny cream toned flowers appear at the base of the leaves. The name Myrsine is from the Greek name for the similar-looking Myrtle. This plant is slow growing, but long-lived and definitely worth the patience to grant it a spot in your garden or landscape. Myrsine Africana is ideal for hedging, screening or potted in patio containers and pots. Plant Myrsine Africana in an area of full sun to part shade, with moist well drained soil. Myrsine Africana will however tolerate a range of soils and conditions and it drought tolerant once established. Myrsine Africana is a low maintenance plant. Protect from cold, drying winds. A regular, light pruning of the tips will encourage a busy growth. Myrsine Africana can grow to a height of 1.5 metres and a width of 75 centimetres.
Papilionaceous - Resembles A Butterfly, Pea Family
Lanceolate - Pointed At Both Ends/Strappy - Grass Like

Myrtus communis compacta is a versatile, slow growing evergreen shrub covered in tiny creamy-white flowers during Spring and Summer. An ideal plant for tubs, low hedges and small gardens. Prefers a full sun position but will tolerate partial shade with well-draining soil. Tolerant of coastal conditions and low water requirements once established. For best results feed with a long term slow release fertiliser in early Spring.Myrtus communis compacta will grow to a height of 1m and a width of 80cm.

Nandinas are an ideal addition to any domestic garden or landscape. These versatile plants are very forgiving of the many different conditions we expose them to. Nandina domestica 'Blush' has lovely pinkish-red coloured fresh growth tips throughout the growing season where most nana varieties have lime-green. During the cool months blush has the normal crimson winter colour so retaining this colour most of the year. Don't be misled by the common name of 'sacred bamboo'', it is not a bamboo!. Nandina blush is an erect evergreen shrub with numerous unbranched stems growing from ground level. In colder climates they may be deciduous.  This variety of nandina doesn't produce berries, although all parts of the plant are considered poisonous. Nandina 'blush' is ideal as a low hedge or borders, feature plant in cottage gardens or courtyards, great in decorative containers, as an under-planting for trees or can be mass-planted. As has been mentioned, nandina 'blush' is very versatile, so full sun, part shade, even moderate shade is fine. 'Blush' will also grow in a wide range of soils; free draining loams to heavier clay soils with good drainage. 'Blush' is also safe around bushland as it won't spread seed. It is very drought, cold and humidity tolerant. This is a low maintenance plant and requires little care due to being drought hardy. Mulching is always beneficial. 'Blush' will enjoy a light fertiliser, particularly chelated or acidified iron, and if you need to tidy your shrub, don't trim as a normal shrub, just cut out the taller or unwanted stems from the base. Nandinas do not reshoot from the stems.Nandina domestica 'blush' will grow to 60-70cm tall and 60cm wide.
Dwarf Sacred Bamboo, Dwarf Heavenly Bamboo

This dwarf, evergreen shrub with attractively coloured leaves in shades of light green, red-purple, crimson, orange or scarlet. leaf colour intensifies during the cooler months. Provides spectacular winter colour. perfect for adding an oriental touch to the backyard garden especially when planted in groups. Ideal for patio pots, borders and low informal hedges. Grow in a sunny position in well drained, averagely moist soil. Can grow in part shade, but best winter colour is obtained when planted in full sun. very low maintenance requiring only an occasional clipping to keep it tidy. Tolerant of moderate frosts

Nandina domestica 'obsession' is an improved selection of the fine leaf form.Nandinas are an ideal addition to any domestic garden or landscape. These versatile plants are very forgiving of the many different conditions we expose them to. Nandina domestica 'obsession' has bright pure red fresh growth tips throughout the growing season where most nana varieties have lime-green. During the cool months 'obsession' holds the red new-growth colour for several months, retaining this red colour through most of the year. Don't be misled by the common name of 'sacred'or ''heavenly bamboo'', it is not a bamboo!. Nandina blush is an erect evergreen shrub with numerous unbranched stems growing from ground level. In colder climates they may be deciduous. The white flowers are borne in early summer in conical clusters which are well above the contrasting, colourful foliage. This variety of nandina doesn't produce berries, although all parts of the plant are considered poisonous. Nandina 'obsession' is ideal as a low hedge or borders, feature plant in cottage gardens or courtyards, great in decorative containers, as an under-planting for trees or can be mass-planted. As has been mentioned, nandina 'obsession' is very versatile, so full sun, part shade, even moderate shade is fine. 'Obsession' will also grow in a wide range of soils; free draining loams to heavier clay soils with good drainage. 'Blush' is also safe around bushland as it won't spread seed. It is very drought, cold and humidity tolerant. This is a low maintenance plant and requires little care due to being drought hardy. Mulching is always beneficial. 'Obsession' will enjoy a light fertiliser, particularly chelated or acidified iron, and if you need to tidy your shrub, don't trim as a normal shrub, just cut out the taller or unwanted stems from the base. Nandinas do not reshoot from the stems.Nandina domestica 'obsession' will grow to 60-70 cm tall and 60-70 cm wide.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Nectarine 'fantasia' is one of the best garden varieties. Fantasia produces large, yellow freestone, and very edible fruit which is firm and fleshy when ripe, and very juicy. The flavour is sweet, tangy, and very rich. As fruit ripens about late August they turn a bright orange-red over yellow background. The crop from this lovely tree can be so abundant they may need thinning to acheive the best quality fruit. The foliage is longish, slender, rather gracefull, and an attractive rich shade of green. The fantasia is also self-fertile. Nectarines are deciduous during winter, while flowering attractive pink blooms along the upright branches closer to spring, and during this season is an excellant ornamental tree perfect for the domestic or cottage garden. Can also be espaliered across a wall.The fruit of this above-average plant can be eaten fresh, dried, made into conserves and fruit salads to mention a few. Nectarines are a valuable  food source as they are low in calories and packed with antioxidents, nutrients, minerals and vitamins. Nectarine Fantasia enjoys full sun, 6-8 hrs ideally, well-drained fertile soil. Fantasia is also cold and frost tolerant and if you are planting during winter, if the soil is workable and no hard frost expected, it is fine to plant almost anytime. Manure enriched soil is welcome along with compost and mulch to retain moisture and deter weeds. Pruning is required to maintain shape and health of your fruit trees.Nectarine 'fantasia' will grow to 2.5m high and 2.5m wide.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

A popular old cultivar. 'Goldmine' is still regarded by many as one of the highest flavoured nectarines.  Nectarine 'goldmine' is one of the best garden varieties, and produces fruit of medium size with white flesh. As fruit ripens about late February - March they turn a bright orange-red over green background. The crop from this lovely tree can be abundant, sweet and plump' especially if well watered. The foliage is longish, slender, rather gracefull, and an attractive rich shade of green. The 'goldmine' is also self-fertile. Nectarines are deciduous during winter, while flowering attractive pink blooms along the upright branches closer to spring, and during this season is an excellant ornamental tree, perfect for the domestic or cottage garden. Can also be espaliered across a wall.The fruit of this above-average plant can be eaten fresh, dried, made into conserves and fruit salads to mention a few. Nectarines are a valuable  food source as they are low in calories and packed with antioxidents, nutrients, minerals and vitamins. Nectarine 'goldmine' enjoys full sun, 6-8 hrs ideally, well-drained fertile soil. 'Goldmine' is also cold and frost tolerant and if you are planting during winter, if the soil is workable and no hard frost expected, it is fine to plant almost anytime. Manure enriched soil is welcome along with compost and mulch to retain moisture and deter weeds. Pruning is required to maintain the shape and health of your fruit trees.Nectarine goldmine will grow 3 - 5m tall.
Evergreen, Fern, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Vertical Gardens

Nephrolepis Pom Pom is a striking evergreen fern with bright green foliage and a rounded habit that resembles a cheerleader's pom pom. Plant in a partly shaded to full shade position with moist, well drained soil and requires protection from frost. This fast growing plant is perfect for the home and office or outside in pots or hanging baskets in a sheltered area. Apply liquid fertiliser during spring and summer for optimum growth.Nephrolepis Pom Pom will grow to a height and width of 50cm.
Evergreen, Fern, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Shrub, Vertical Gardens

Nephrolepsis  'Teddy Junior' is a compact dwarf evergreen fern ideal as an indoor decorative plant. 'Teddy Junior' forms a rosette of much devided arching fronds and provides a lovely contrasting foliage when in the company of other tropical plants. The new fronds emerge in a lime/fresh green and then slowly change to the rich darker green of mature foliage. Ferns are not difficult to grow but will not tolerate neglect.'Teddy Junior' is ideal in hanging baskets, path borders or mass under-planting  in tropical garden areas, look great in decorative containers, or as part of a green-wall in sheltered courtyards or alcoves. Dappled light or shade is recommended or early morning and late afternoon sun with care. Using rich well-drained loam, soils, or potting mix is advised. Nephrolepsis don't like to dry out and also enjoy humidity, a light liquid or slow release fertiliser according to manufacturers directions is recommended. If ground planted, use light organic mulch and remove any broken or dead fronds to encourage new growth. Allow space around your fern and avoid overcrowding them as fronds are quite fragile and delicate.Nephrolepsis 'Teddy Junior' will grow to a height of 40cm.
Funnelform - The Corolla Shaped Like A Funnel

Nerium 'Dwarf Apricot' is an extremely tough, hardy, upright and evergreen shrub. There are few plants that will grow almost anywhere in Australia and this is one of them. 'Apricot Dwarf' has dense foliage, although not woody. The leaves are strappy leathery green, elongated and pointed at the tip. The flowers are spectacular, in clusters, bell-shaped and apricot in colour. This dwarf form of nerium is one of the most useful of all garden plants. Perfect for hedging, , borders, courtyards and cottage gardens, or in decorative containers on balconies, and anywhere that nothing else will grow! Neriums prefer full sun, and well-drained soil. Neriums are wind-tolerant,drought tolerant, frost tolerant, and do well in coastal and exposed positions. As with all plants neriums enjoy regular watering until established while mulching is always advisable for water retention and weed control. Pruning after flowering will promote a magnificent plant which will flower profusely and maintain good shape.Nerium 'Dwarf Apricot'  can reach a height and width of 1.5-2m.
Advanced Plants, Coastal, Evergreen, Fruiting, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Olea Correggiolo is a traditional Tuscan olive with grey-green foliage and sprays of small yellow flowers that appear during spring followed by late ripening small fruits that are very high in oil content. This variety is generally considered self fertile, although pollinators are recommended to produce better crops. Crops are generally heavy and consistent.A fantastic fruiting feature tree for gardens, pots and large containers. It is also suitable for topiary and espallier displays. For best results, plant in a full sun position with well drained soil.Tolerates harsh coastal conditions and periods of frost. Water well during flowering and at the time of fruit formation.Olea Correggiolo can grow to 6m high and 4m wide.
Evergreen, Fruiting, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Add a Tuscan, Mediterranean vibe to your garden by planting an olive tree such as Olea 'Frantoio', also known as an olive tree. Olea 'Frantoio' is noted as one of the most highly acclaimed oil varieties in the world and is grown commercially in most olive growing areas. Olea 'Frantoio' is self-pollinating with high, consistant productivity. The tree is early-season fruit-set. The fruit ripens gradually and so allows for a longer harvest.This variety produces small to medium sized fruit, with a slightly nutty flavour when pickled. when mature the fruit are purple-black. Olea 'Frantoio' are a fast growing and crop well.Olea 'Frantoio is an ideal addition to garden and landscapes as attractive specimen, street or shade trees. They are also used as a hedging, espalier or planted in a pot. Olea Frantoio will thrive in warm regions with cool winters. Extended dry, hot conditions during summer months will encourage fruit development. Olea 'Frantoio' is drought tolerant and easily adaptable to coastal conditions. This variety is also very resistant to extreme cold.Olea 'Frantoio is relatively low maintenance. Fruit is ready for harvest from March through to September. Olea 'Frantoio' can grow to a height of 9 metres and a width of 6 metres.
Advanced Plants, Evergreen, Fruiting, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Add a Tuscan, Mediterranean vibe to your garden by planting an olive tree such as Manzanillo. This species is an evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean, Asia and Africa. A relatively low, spreading olive tree that is a fairly regular annual bearer with fruit becoming ready early in the season. Fruit is ready for harvest from March through to September, and has a briney, nutty flavour, it is this variety you will find in martinis, and also one of the worlds favourite table olives. Manzanillo olives have one of the best pit to flesh ratios and high fruiting yeilds.  Also known to produce good oil. An ideal addition to garden and landscapes as an attractive specimen, street or shade trees. They can also be used as a hedging plant, esplaier or potted specimen. Thriving in warm regions with cool winters. Extended dry, hot conditions during summer months will encourage fruit development. Olea 'Manzanillo' is relatively low maintenance, drought tolerant and easily adaptable to coastal conditions. Olea Manzanillo can grow to a height of 9 metres and a width of 6 metres.
Evergreen, Fruiting, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Tree

Add a Tuscan, Mediterranean vibe to your garden by planting an olive tree such as Nedavillo Blanco. This Spanish variety of olive is prized for the high oil content of the fruit. They are a reliable, heavy and constant cropper and ripens early to mid season. It is also a dual purpose olive, suitable for table as well as oil. Fruit is ready for harvest from March through to September. An ideal addition to garden and landscapes as an attractive specimen, street or shade trees. They can also be used as a medium sized hedge. Thriving in warm regions with cool winters. Extended dry, hot conditions during months will encourage fruit development. Nedavillo Blanco is relatively low maintenance, drought tolerant and easily adaptable to coastal conditions.Olea Nedavillo Blanco can grow to a height of 9 metres and a width of 6 metres.

A tough evergreen shrub with dense, small, grey white foliage which is highly ornamentalThis plant is superb for hedging and foliage contrast, especially in coastal and exposed gardensPrefers a sunny site with well drained soil, tolerates coastal exposure, strong winds, salty or poor soils and extended dry periods.Water after planting until established, lightly trim hedges regularly to maintain a tidy habitGrows to a height of 1-2m high and wide.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Olearia Ghost Town is a small Australian native upright shrub, with a very unique appearance of  spiky grey foliage with occasional flushes of tiny white flowers.  the compact shrub is well branched and will provide year round colour and texture to the garden.Great for native and waterwise gardens, mass plantings, pots and containers.  Excellentt for adding contrast to mixed garden beds and borders.  Plant in full sun position with well drained soil.Tolerates periods of drought and coastal conditions.Olearia Ghost Town can grow to 70cm high and 1m wide.
Onion Brown has light brown skin with mild, cream coloured flesh. It is ideal for the home vegetable garden. Use Onion Brown in salads, sandwiches, wraps and as a garnish.

Onion Red Legs is a red-skinned bunching onion which produces elongated bulbs. Onion Red Legs is ideal for the home vegetable garden. The mild, sweet taste is ideal for use in cooking, or raw in salads, sandwiches and wraps.
Onion Red is a mild, sweet tasting onion. It is purple-red in colour and is ideal for the home vegetable garden, where it likes a full sun position. Use Onion Red in salads, hot dishes and pickling.

Onion White is a round, flavoursome onion with light, white skin and flesh. It is ideal for the home vegetable and likes a full sun position. Onion White can be used in salads, hot dishes and for pickling.
Linear - Parallel Margins, Elongate/Strappy - Grass Like

Ophiopogon jaburan is the larger growing variety of the popular mondo grass with strap-shaped leathery leaves. In summer, it has drooping racemes of small, white, bell-shaped flowers, followed by violet-blue fruit.This evergreen perennial is a popular border choice for dividing garden and pathways, poolside plantings, rockeries and containers. Grows well in most soils and conditions but for best results choose a sunny or partly shaded well-drained position. Responds well to an application of fertiliser in spring.Ophiopogon jaburan will grow to a height of 60cm and a width of 50cm.
Evergreen, Grasses, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens
Linear - Parallel Margins, Elongate/Strappy - Grass Like

Ophiopogon japonicus forms tufts of slender, grass-like foliage that can spread rapidly once established. Around mid-summer this Japanese native will bloom white to pale lilac flowers, slowly followed by a small navy berries.This evergreen perennial is a popular border choice for dividing garden and pathways. It will also grow as a dense ground cover in areas of deep shade to semi-sun locations. Flourishing is soils that are sandy, loam as well as clay based. Ophiopogon japonicus will tolerate frost and wind. Water well until established and keep soil moist during dry weather. Use slow release fertiliser annually. If planting in containers, use a premium potting mix. Ophiopogon japonicus will grow to a height of 25 centimetres with a width of 50 centimetres.
Evergreen, Grasses, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens

Ophiopogon japonicus nana is a low growing dwarf form of Mondo Grass. A clump forming evergreen with short and attractive dark green, strappy foliage. Growing to only 10cm tall, it is ideal for edging around pots, thin borders and in between pavers. Plant in a full sun to partly shaded position with moist well drained soil.Low maintenance once established but keep moist during dry weather. Apply a controlled release fertiliser annually to maintain healthy foliage.  Clumps can be divided during spring.Ophiopogon japonicus nana can grow to 10cm high and 20cm wide.
Evergreen, Grasses, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens
Linear - Parallel Margins, Elongate/Strappy - Grass Like

Ophiopogon Nigrescens forms tufts of slender, grass-like foliage that can spread rapidly once established. This evergreen perennial variety differs as it produces striking purplish-black leaves that will prove an excellent contrast against green leaved plants.Mondo grass is a popular border choice for dividing garden and pathways, it will also grow as a dense ground cover in areas of full sun to part shade. Flourishing in soils that are sandy, loam as well as clay based; given they are well drained and will tolerate frost and wind. Water well until established and keep soil moist during dry weather. Use slow release fertiliser annually. If planting in containers, use a premium potting mix. Ophiopogon planiscapus Nigrescens can grow to a height and width of 25 centimetres.
Evergreen, Grasses, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens
Linear - Parallel Margins, Elongate/Strappy - Grass Like

Ophiopogon Stripey White forms tufts of slender, grass-like foliage that can spread rapidly once established. This particular variety produces contrasting green and cream striped foliage, hence the name Stripey White. During summer it blooms upright flower spikes, with small white flowers.This evergreen mondo grass is a popular border choice for dividing garden and pathways.  Stripey White will also grow as a dense ground cover in areas of deep shade to semi-sun locations. Flourishing in soils that are moist and well drained, while tolerating frost and wind. Water well until established and keep soil moist during dry weather. Use slow release fertiliser annually. If planting in containers, use a premium potting mix. Ophiopogon Stripey White can grow to a height and width of 40 centimetres.
Cordate - Heart-shaped, Stem In Cleft/Lanceolate - Pointed At Both Ends

Origanum Bellissimo is a stunning new ornamental compact groundcover with an attractive weeping habit and aromatic foliage. It has large stunning plum coloured blooms in summer and early autumn. Great to brighten up any garden throughout the warmer months. Ideal for rockeries, borders, spilling over retaining walls, embankments and containers. For best results plant in a full sun position in a well drained soil, remove old growth and apply a slow release fertiliser when new growth appears in spring. Low water requirements and tolerant of hot and dry conditions. Requires only an occasional deep soak during periods of extended heat.Origanum Bellisimo will grow to a height of 20cm and a width of 40cm.
Evergreen, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

A very ornamental clump forming plant with long strappy leaves, with attractive blue flowers are borne in September through to December.A great addition to rockeries, borders, coastal sites and perfect for well draining pots.Prefers a full sun to part shade position and a rich, well drained soilFor best results, fertilise in spring. mulch well to conserve soil moisture and suppress weeds. Remove old flower stems to encourage further flowering.Grows to a height of 1m high.
Parsley Afro is a biennial herb forming a rosette of crispy, green leaves rich in Vitamin A, B and C. It can be used as a garnish and to flavour sauces, salads, soups and casseroles.

Parsley Italian is a biennial herb with flat, dark green leaves. Parsley is great for the home herb or vegetable garden and can also be planted in pots. The leaves can bu used to flavour salads, sauces, soups and casseroles. The plant matures in 6-8 weeks, however the leaves can be picked at anytime for use. Tip prune regularly to maintain compact growth.

Passionfruit Black is a vigorous climbing perennial with deep green leaves. It has striking, fragrant purple/white flowers. The fruit matures to a deep purple-black colour with a sweet, edible pulp. Passionfruit Black is ideal for desserts, juices and eaten fresh.

Passionfruit Gold is a vigorous climbing perennial with deep green leaves and fragrant purple and white flowers. The fruit matures to a deep gold colour with a sweet, edible pulp. Passionfruit Gold is ideal for desserts, juices and eaten fresh.
Evergreen, Grasses, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Verge
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

A tough, attractive, tuft forming Australian native with beautiful blue to purple flowers which resemble Irises. Flowers appear in late spring and early summer. Perfectly suited for the backyard, courtyard or in landscaping.Plant in a sunny position with a moist to wet soil. Tolerates light frost and some seasonal dryness once established. Mulch well to conserve soil moisture and suppress weeds. Fertilise in spring with a slow release fertiliser. Pruning rejuvinates old plants.Patersonia occidentalis can reach a height of 80cm and a width of 30-60cm.

Older style, early maturing peach with some red blush. Pale greenish-white, juicy flesh. Freestone. Suitable for fresh fruit and juice. Self fertile.An early season variety Peach producing heavy crops of large, white fleshed fruit. Ideal for eating fresh.Prefers an open, sunny position in moist, well-drained soil. For best results apply a complete fertiliser in winter and prune after harvest to manage branch growth and to prevent overcrowding. A great assest to any backyard.Spraying to prevent leaf curl is recommended.Self PollinatingGrows to a height of 6m high and 6m wide.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

Beurre Bosc pears are medium to large sized fruit with heavily russeted skin and a sweet flavoured yellowish-white flesh, making it an incredibly popular variety grown. The fruit is ideal for plucking straight off the branch and eating fresh, or for cooking and preserving. The tree itself is deciduous with an upright, spreading habit. Ideal for planting in backyards, large pots and containers or training into an espalier along fencing or wires. Plant in an area of full sun, although they can tolerate partial sun. This variety prefers light, rich soils with good drainage but will tolerate heavier, clay-rich soils. Beurre Bosc requires moderate maintenance. Protect from pear and cherry slug. Mulch well to conserve moisture. Prune after harvest to manage branch growth and to prevent overcrowding.It will benefit from cross-pollination, including varieties such as Nijisseiki, Williams and Sensation.Pear Beurre Bosc can grow to a height of 10 metres and a width of 8 metres.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

A popular Asian pear variety producing, round apple like fruit with russeted brown skin and mildly sweet, crisp white flesh.The fruit is ideal for plucking straight off the branch and eating fresh, cooking in desserts and for preserving. he tree itself is deciduous with a dense, upright, spreading habit. Ideal for planting in backyards, large pots and containers and for training as an espalier. Plant in an area of full sun, although they can tolerate partial sun. This variety prefers light, rich soils with good drainage but will tolerate heavier, clay-rich soils. Chojuro requires moderate maintenance. Protect from pear and cherry slug. Mulch well to conserve moisture. Prune well after harvest to manage branch growth and to prevent overcrowding.It will benefit from cross-pollination, including varieties such as Nijisseiki.Nashi Chojuro can grow to a height of 8 metres and a width of 4 metres.
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

A most popular Asian pear variety producing, round apple like fruit with yellowish-green skin and mildly sweet, crisp white flesh. The fruit is ideal for plucking straight off the branch and eating fresh, cooking in desserts and for preserving. The tree itself is deciduous with a dense, upright, spreading habit. Nijisseiki is a great tree for small garden, ideal for planting in backyards, large pots and containers or trained as an espalier. Plant in an area of full sun, although they can tolerate partial sun. This variety prefers light, rich soils with good drainage but will tolerate heavier, clay-rich soils. Nijisseiki requires moderate maintenance. Protect from pear and cherry slug. Mulch well to conserve moisture. Prune after harvest to manage branch growth and to prevent overcrowding.It will benefit from cross-pollination, including varieties such as Williams and Sensation. Nashi Nijisseiki can grow to a height of 8 metres and a width of 4 metres.

A very attractive Pear variety producing bright red, medium sized fruit with creamy white flesh that is sweet and well flavoured.Prefers an open, sunny position in well drained soil.For best results keep moist until established and mulch well to conserve soil moisture.Prune after harvest to manage branch groth and to prevent overcrowding.Protect from Pear and Cherry slug.Pollinators - Nijisseiki, Beurre BoscGrows to a height of 12m high and 10m wide.
Evergreen, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Pennisetum Red Riding Hood is a hardy, clumping dwarf perennial grass that blooms an abundance of fluffy arching red-pink plumes from spring to autumn. The flowers sit high above the burgundy toned foliage and provide a stunning colour display.Red Riding Hood is fast-growing, an ideal border for or those with small spaces in their gardens and can be use in containers. This variety has also shown to help with erosion control on embankments. Thriving in fertile, free draining soils, in full sun to part shade positions. Once established, Red Riding Hood is a low maintenance plant, tolerant of high temperatures, humidity, and wind as well as being able to withstand light frost. Fertilise with slow release once a year in spring. Prune back every few years to encourage new growth. Pennisetum setaceum Red Riding Hood can grow to a height and width of 75 centimetres.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Shrub, Vertical Gardens

Peperomia Jade a short but broad growing evergreen plant, with rounded, thick, glossy green leaves.It is a fantastic indoor plant and is ideal for pots and hanging baskets in alfresco areas in a well lit position away from direct sun. In tropical and sub tropical climates it can also be planted underneath trees and large shrubs.Prefers part to full shade with moist well drained soil and best to apply a liquid fertiliser from spring through to autumn.Peperomia Jade will grow to a height and width of 30cm.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Seedling, Shrub

Peperomia scandens is a semi-trailing plant with dark green, waxy heart shaped leaves and reddish stems.Ideal for well lit positions indoors and sunrooms but out of direct sunlight, pots and hanging baskets.Keep moist at all times during the growing season and drier during winter. Apply liquid fertiliser from spring to autumn to keep plants growing strong.Peperomia scandens will grow to a height of 15-30cm and a width of 30cm.

Peppermint is a green fragrant herb which generally grows best in moist, sunny locations with some shade and also grows well in pots. Great as an addition to salads, desserts or as a garnish to a refreshing drink.

Petunia Avalanche Pink is a mix of light and dark shaded pink petunias. Petunias are remarkably tough flowering plants. They come in a wide range of colours and markings. Petunias should be planted in spring for full flowering in summer. They can be deadheaded to produce even more beautiful flowers and perform best in a full sun position. Petunias can be used in garden beds and trailing varieties look amazing cascading over the sides of planter pots.

Petunias are remarkably tough flowering plants. They come in a wide range of colours and markings.Petunias should be planted in spring for full flowering in summer. They can be deadheaded to produce even more beautiful flowers and perform best in a full sun position.Petunias can be used in garden beds and trailing varieties look amazing cascading over the sides of planter pots.

Petunia Bonanza is an annual Petunia that produces large double and semi-double blooms in a mix of various different colours ranging from pink, purple, white and bi-coloured flowers throughout summer to autumnIdeal for garden beds, borders, rockeries, containers and hanging baskets Petunia's are remarkably tough flowering plants. They perform best in a full sun position and need at least a minimum of five hours of sun each day to flourish. Plant in well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting and water regularly to ensure the soil stays moist. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Petunias are fairly easy to grow and maintain and are rarely attacked by insects. Prune regularly, pinching off dead flowers to prolong the flowering period and improve the overall bushiness of the plant. Be cautious of overwatering, overwatering will cause the leaves to turn yellow  and ultimately result in the death of the plant. Once they have finished their season the plants can be recycled into compost or mulch and redistributed in the home garden.Petunia's can grow up to approx. 30cm high and should be planted 25cm apart.
