Philodendron Little Phil is far more compact than other philodendrons as it's leaves don't elongate as much as others meaning it's better in low light levels.It has the ability to cope with heavy shade, along with it's small size makes it a perfect green wall or indoor plant. A perfect plant for the table on the patio.Position in light shade to moderately heavy shade. Tolerates drought and cold. Suits reasonably drained soil with some organics. Philodendron Little Phil will grow to a height and width of 35cm.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Vertical Gardens

Philodendron cordatum is an attractive climber with beautiful heart-shaped glossy green leaves. Perfect as an indoor plant or for shaded areas of the garden. Perfect for hanging baskets, or for training up poles in pots. Best with some warmth and plenty of light but no direct sun. Liquid fertilise in spring. Provide support for the climbing varieties and keep soil moist but dryer in winter.Philodendron cordatum will grow to a height and width of 30-60cm.CAUTION: Harmful if eaten. Skin and eye irritant.

Add a tropical feel to your indoor or outdoor garden with Philodendron Xanadu. This evergreen, compact plant produces glossy lime green leaves that are dramatically lobed, creating a dense tidy growth habit. An ideal addition to any shaded garden, excellent along borders, or mass planted as an understorey plant. Plant in an area of full sun to semi shade. It can be grown in the garden in tropical and subtropical areas. In colder parts, it is best grown as an indoor or patio plant, under high light conditions. Philodendron Xanadu is low maintenance and pest free. It does not produce aerial roots and has a wide climatic tolerance. Remove old and damaged leaves and protect from frost.Philodendron Xanadu can grow to a height of 90 centimetres and width of 70 centimetres.
Evergreen, Fern, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Shrub, Vertical Gardens
Linear - Parallel Margins, Elongate/Strappy - Grass Like

Phlebodium Blue Star a beautiful compact fern featuring deeply lobed. alluring blue-green foliage.  Plant in free draining soil in a shaded location in a rock garden, under planting, borders or indoors in pots.  Keep moist during dry periods.  Apply a slow release fertiliser during spring and a liquid fertiliser every 4 weeks during the warmer months, take care to dilute your solution to half the recommended dose to avoid burn. Protect from frost.Phlebodium Blue Star will grow to a height of 60-90cm and a width of 30-40cm.

Also known as the Canary Island Date Palm, Phoenix canariensis is a solitary, tall palm with a strong trunk structure that is scarred with old leaf bases and long, gracefully arching fronds.  A popular palm due to its hardiness, appearance and growth speed, a definite tropical 'stand out' tree in landscapes.   An ideal palm for roadsides, parks and avenues and will add a tropical, Mediterranean feel. Due to its eventual size, it is not suited to domestic or suburban gardens. Plant in an area of full sun, with well drained soil. Tolerant of frost, salt spray and is drought tolerant; perfect for coastal positions. Prune the fronds as required but care needs to be taken when removing old fronds. Keep plants well watered, particularly while establishing. Phoenix canariensis can grow to a height of 10-20 metres and a width of 8 metres.

Phoenix roebelenii is a small, extremely versatile palm with gorgeous, bright green foliage.Can be grown indoors or outdoors, this variety is very popular as a pot or tub specimen. Ideal uses are also landscaping in parks, gardens and around pools.Thrives in full sun to partly shaded position outdoors and will grow well in dry areas once established. To grow indoors, place in a well lit position and keep moist, drier in winter. Do not over water. Regular watering and application of fertiliser in the warmer months will enhance leaf colour and speed up growth. Phoenix roebelenii can reach a height of 2m and a width of 3.6-4.7m.
Evergreen, Grasses, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf

Sweet Mist provides stunning colour contrast for the modern garden with its exceptional bronze colour and is ultra-compact.Excellent choice for W.A as it grows in full sun and shaded positions, tolerates heavy frost and moderately dry conditions. Needs adequate summer irrigation.Plant March- OctoberUse for for mass plantings, low borders, fill in plant, containers and patio potsPlant in full sun or shaded positions. Grown for its stunning dark chocolate coloured foliage edged with bright green, Phormium Chocomint Mist PBR provides a great alternative edge to the garden.Ideal for mass planting as a low border or fill in plant. Being a smaller form, Chocomint Mist PBR is well suited to the smaller modern garden. It is also great for containers and patios.Thrives in full sun to partly shaded positions. Tolerates heavy frost and moderately dry conditions. Suitable for most soil types, in more humid areas care should be taken to plant in well drained soils. Low maintenance once established. When planting ensure the crown or base of the plant is not planted below the soil level. Every couple of years prune back and fertilise. Dont mulch around the base of the plant.Phormium Chocomint Mist PBR can grow to height of 40cm and a width of 40cm.

Phormium Golden Ray is a large tender perennial with clumps of colorful evergreen leaves. The striking strap-like foliage has vertical stripes of yellow, cream and shades of green and yellow and often edged with a hint of orange-red. In spring it produces long, upright floral spikes that are tall, open and branched and covered with small, tubular, orange flowers.  Phormium's are perfectly suited to coastal gardens and low maintenance gardens and container growing. Great for beds and borders, as an informal screen, and the foilage and flower spikes can be used for cut flower arrangements. For best results plant in a full sun position or part shade in moist well drained soil. Be careful not to over water as too much soil moisture can cause root or crown rot.  Trim to remove spent foilage and flower spikes.Phormium Golden Ray will grow to a height and width of 1.2-1.5m.

The 'Betel Leaf' is a very useful plant to add to your garden as a creeper, in hanging baskets in cooler areas, or as a potted specimen.The attractive shiny heart-shaped leaves can be eaten raw or cooked and ideal for wrapping tasty foods like spiced rice. The younger leaves are better. Also very nice in salads or use to line a plate prior to serving a nice dish.This evergreen, self-pollinating perennial creeper can reach 90cm and bears small white flower spikes.After flowering, the small fruit can also be eaten.'Betel Leaf' prefers rich, well-drained soils in partial shade and kept moist but won't tolerate water-logging.Frost may damage the leaves but won't kill the plant once it is well established.Piper sarmentosum also has many traditional medicinal uses.

Commonly known as the London Plane Tree, Platanus acerifolia is one of the most successful trees for growing in southern Australian cities. The bark is grey and mottled, similar to Spotted Gum. The arching habit of the branches forms a high and spreading crown, which is a stunning feature in large avenues, with bright green foliage and stunning autumn colour of dull-golden colours. Ideal for roadside plantings, parks and an excellent shade tree and is easily grown on most sites except those extremely compacted and waterlogged. Plant in areas of full sun with well drained soils. Once established, Platanus orientalis is is relatively low maintenance and significantly drought tolerant and can withstand urban environments and pollution. Water well until established, especially during extended dry, hot periods. Platanus acerifolia can grow to a height of 30 metres and a width of 10 metres in 20 or more years

This variety is considered to be one of the best plums. Santa Rosa is a fast growing variety, producing large rounded fruit, with a purplish-crimson skin and flavoursome yellow mildly sweet flesh with a red blush just below the skin.  The fruit is ideal for juice, jam, stewing or plucking straight off the branch and eating fresh. The tree itself is deciduous with green foliage that turns yellow before falling in autumn followed by pale blue flowers during spring. An ideal specimen for those with small to medium gardens. Plant in an open, sunny position in well drained soil. This variety will benefit greatly when a pollinator such as Mariposa, is planted in proximity as this will encourage added fruit development.For best results keep moist until established and mulch well to conserve moisture. Requiring moderate maintenance, prune after harvest to manage branch growth and to prevent overcrowding. Santa Rosa Plum can grow to a height and width of 4 metres.

Frangipani is the most common name for Plumeria in Australia. With an array of varieties and colour, the Plumeria continues to be an all round favourite for the avid gardener and those alike. During summer this particular variety called Plumeria Pink produces stunning, rose-pink flowers with orange-yellow centres that are sweetly fragrant. Plumeria's are ideal for feature trees as the colour variation provides excellent colour and contrasts against the lance-shaped dark green leaves. They can also be grown in containers or pots. These deciduous trees give an overall sense of tropical paradise, peace and tranquillity. Plumeria's thrive in areas of full sun to part shade, with well drained soils. This variety is drought tolerant, and can tolerate a range of soil types. Plumeria Pink requires low maintenance. It does require shelter from frost and cold winds. Keep dry in winter when the plant is leafless. Stem tips can be cut to induce branching.Plumeria Pink can grow to a height of 8 metres and a width of 6 metres.

Portulaca Sundial Fuchsia, also known as Sun Plant are a hardy, low growing plants that produces masses of large, fuchsia coloured semi-double blooms throughout summer and autumn atop it's green succulent foliage.Ideal for garden beds, borders, containers and hanging baskets Portulaca's enjoy a position in the garden exposed to full sun all day and should be planted in a well-drained soil that has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly until the seedlings are established then water heavily once or twice per week. Add mulch on top of your garden bed to help retain moisture in the soil.Portulaca's are very easy to maintain and even self seed frequently in the optimum surroundings and soil. Be cautious of over watering, keeping the soil too wet for long periods of time can result in the rotting and eventual death of the plants. Portulaca's grow to approx. 15cm high and should be planted 20cm apart.

Radermachera Summerscent is one of the most versatile plants to become available. Originating from Southern China, Summerscent has lush, glossy, compact foliage. This very hardy attractive palm is a slow growing multi-stemmed palm which makes a fantastic indoor plant.Rhapis excelsa prefers a moist well-drained soil in a sheltered temperate location but will adapt to a wide range of climates, soils, and environments making for a very versatile specimen.Also known as 'slender lady palm', 'bamboo palm', 'fan palm', finger palm', and 'parlor palm', 'Lady Palm' is the most recognized. In it's natural habitat this palm can reach 14' tall and can form clumps of similar width.Rhapis excelsa bears large thick leaves with blunt tips and wide segments on sturdy canes or stems which are covered with a fibrous sheath of course dark brown fiber.Rhapis excelsa is fairly cold hardy and can tolerate tropical and subtropical temperatures, handling both humid and dry climates.Being a prolific producer of rhizomes adds a fullness to the plant, although growth rate mainly depends on the environment and culture.This lovely 'air-purifying' plant is easy to grow, and possibly the easiest of all palms, tolerating low-light areas better than other palms although it prefers bright, indirect light, so near windows and skylights is preferred.Rhapis excelsa prefers a moist well-drained soil and drying out severely can cause damage to the foliage and tip burn.The best way to prune these palms is to trim off the lower leaves as they age or become discolored. If the new growth dies this usually means that the whole trunk will need to be cut out. It is a sign that the trunk has rotted so the other green leaves will eventually go brown and die.Fertilizer is rarely required as they are so slow growing. If the leaves start to go yellowish it needs some nutrients, so fertilize at half the strength recommended for other plants. Avoid over fertilizing.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Succulent
Acicular - Needle Shaped/Linear - Parallel Margins, Elongate

Rhipsalis cereuscula, Coral cactus, is an interesting perennial with long slender branches and cylindrical fleshy green stems. Perfumed creamy-white flowers bloom abundantly during spring and summer.Best planted in a sunny position in well drained soil, perfect for both indoors and outdoors in hanging baskets,rockeries and succulent gardens. Protect from frost and periods of extreme heat, is able to tolerate dryness and periods of drought.Rhipsalis cereuscula will grow to a height of 0.6m and a width of 0.4m
Campanulate - Bell Shaped, With The Segments Gently Flaring/Terminal Clusters

Rhipsalis clavata cascades from hanging pots and baskets with narrow cylindrical pale green pendent stems, up to 5mm in diameter and can reach 2.1m in length!The blooms are sporadic all season and consist of very small, white 'bell' flowers, followed by small yellow/red fruits.Rhipsalis do not appreciate direct sunlight as they can burn, turn yellow or become spotted. However without sunlight they will not flower and growth may become stunted. Rhipsalis does best with morning sun and full shade in the afternoon.Rhipsalis also do well indoors but have a little care with placement, not too close to windows receiving afternoon sun.Rhipsalis are not drought resistant so regular watering; but not over-watering, as this may cause the roots to rot.Ideal situation is a sheltered position in a shaded area, under trees and indoors in hanging decorative containers.
Evergreen, Ground Cover, Outdoor, Perennial, Vertical Gardens

A perfect addition to any garden, Rhoeo discolour Compactum, commonly known as Moses in the Cradle, is an evergreen, semi-succulent, clump forming perennial. Grown for its attractive dark leaves with purple undersides. Rhoeo makes an ideal groundcover, rockery plant or used for edging as well as an excellent  landscaping plant or just in a container or trough on its own. Requires minimal attention.Prefers a well drained, moderately fertile soil in full sun to part shade.Grows 30-40cm wide and reaches a height of 40cm.
A sweet delicious rhubarb with long, crimson stems. It is ideal for the home vegetable garden and makes a wonderful jam, crumble, tart pudding or sauce. perfect for any occasion.

Rocket has a long toothed, purplish-green foliage with a mustard like taste. It is ideal for use in salads, pasta dishes, burgers and sandwiches. Combine with Parmesan cheese, semi-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, balsamic vinegar and olive oil for a delicious and tasty Italian salad entree.

This over 400 year old heirloom variety is still popular today because of its sublime flavour and fragrance. The vine is compact and the fruit small making it the perfect melon for most suburban gardens.
Evergreen, Hedge, Herb, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Rosmarinus Benenden Blue serves as both a kitchen herb and an ornamental plant that adds beauty to any perennial garden. Dark blue flowers appear in abundance during winter and contrast beautifully with its fine foliage, forming a unique small compact upright growing shrub.Benenden Blue makes for an ideal low hedge for any backyard garden and is great for adding a mediterranean feel. These attractive herbs have a multitude of uses for their foliage and flowers like flavouring meats for that Sunday leg of ham. Some people have been known to use the aromatic essential oil for medicinal purposes like relaxing aching joints and even as an antiseptic.Growing best in a hot, dry, sunny position with moist well-drained soil. It is drought tolerant once established and prefers to stay fairly dry in winter. Prune after flowering to maintain a bushy, compact habit.Rosmarinus officinalis Benenden Blue grows to a height and width of up to 1 metre.

Rosmarinus Blue Lagoon is an attractive, small shrub. It has scented green foliage with a bushy habit. Prefers full sun areas.Rosmarinus Blue Lagoon can grow up to 1-1.5m high and 0.8-1.2m wide.

Wendy's White is an upright fast growing shrub with deep grey green leaves and smokey white flowers, and the classic aromatic foliage.Good for hedging, topiary and large pots and also makes an attractive border to any backyard garden.Plant in any well drained to general soil in a sunny and airy position. Rosmarinus Wendy's White can grow to a height of 1.2m and a width of 1m.

Roman Beauty is a compact evergreen shrub with aromatic needle-like dark green leaves with contrasting silver undersides. Suitable in hot dry climates as it will tolerate poor soil drought and salt spray. Requires little or no maintenance.Grows 60cm high x 60cm wide

Russelia equisetiformis is an fast growing evergreen shrub with rush-like stems that carry bright deep green foliage. Orange/scarlet tubular flowers in spring and summer Plant in full sun with summer moisture and shelter from cold winds. Survives light frost only. Prune some of the older stems to induce bushier new growth Perfect plant for hedges, background plant, mixed shrubberies, bank stabilisation, erosion control spillover plant.Russelia equisetiformis grows to height of 1.5 - 2m and spreads to 2m.

Sage is a small, evergreen, woody perennial with grey-greeen aromatic leaves and attractive purple flowers. Sage is great for the home herb or vegetable garden. Leaves can be used fresh or dried in fish, chicken, pork, veal and egg and cheese dishes. Tip prune to maintain a compact, bushy shrub. For best results liquid feed regularly.

Salvia Blaze of Fire, is a neat, compact bush that produces plumes of free flowering vibrant scarlet coloured blooms from spring to summer.Ideal for garden beds, pots, planters and mass planting Salvia prefers a position in full sun  to partial shade and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly, keeping the soil moist throughout the growing season. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Remove spent blooms on your plant to encourage new growth. Once they have finished their season the plants can be recycled into compost or mulch and redistributed in the home garden.Salvia Blaze of Fire grows to approx. 30-35cm high and should be planted 20-30cm apart.

Sansevieria cylindrica is a very striking succulent with striped, round leaves that are smooth and a green-grey in colour. It grows fan-shaped, with its stiff leaves growing from a basal rosette. If grown in bright enough light this plant can produce a spike-like raceme of pink-budded white flowers. Sansevierias are best placed in bright or filtered light. Good locations include a spot in front of a north-facing window or in front of a bright, sunny window covered by a sheer curtain. Although the plant tolerates low light, bright light brings out the colors in the leaves.  Allow the soil to dry completely before watering, and then water deeply until water drips through the drainage hole.  Never allow the soil to become soggy and never let the pot stand in water. Water sparingly throughout the winter.Sansevieria cylindrica will grow to a height of 0.9-2.1m.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub, Succulent

Sansevieria cylindrica is a very striking succulent with striped, round leaves that are smooth and a green-grey in colour. It grows fan-shaped, with its stiff leaves growing from a basal rosette. This hybrid dwarf variety of Sansevieria makes the perfect indoor and desk plant. Maintaining a nice compact size and being excellent natural air fresheners they also make a nice addition to your entertainment areas as table decoration or in small corners, nooks and windowsills when planted in attractive containers. Sansevieria Hahnii Jade is one of the most distinctive of the Hahnii group due to the foliage displaying no markings or chevrons on the deep-jade thick semi-shiny pointed leaves overlapping to form a rosette creating tight upright cups. 'Jade' will, over time form clumps averaging 30-50cm across.This is also the ideal plant for those landscaping jobs requiring low-growing hardy evergreen edges and borders. Good draining soil mix is preferred along with bright indirect light and regular watering, this is not a picky plant and is adaptable to many soil types. Hardy to brief overnight periods of frost.
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

Sansevieria Hahnii Jade marginata is one of the most distinctive of the Hahnii group due to the foliage displaying no markings or chevrons on the deep-jade thick semi-shiny pointed leaves, edged with a bold gold margin, overlapping to form a rosette creating tight upright cups. 'Jade marginata' will, over time form clumps averaging 30-50cm across.This is also the ideal plant for those landscaping jobs requiring low-growing hardy evergreen edges and borders. Sansevieria Superba  is an ornamental structural, succulent plant, with a clumping, upright habit. Has been recommended by NASA as one of the best plants for improving indoor air quality by absorbing toxins.  The foliage of this perennial plant is beautifully coloured. The dark green leaves are banded with grey-green and have a broad yellow margin. Grows best in a partly shaded, warm position protected from frost. Excellent for use indoors. Ideal for container growing where its stunning foliage can best be displayed. It is tolerant of low light levels and irregular watering. Water only when dry and protect from snails & slugs. Sansevieria Superba will grow to a height and width of 60cm-1m.

Scaevola Blue Print is a well branched mounding form with bushy, green foliage and small lavender-blue fan-shaped flowers that appear during spring and bloom throughout the warmer months. Ideal for hanging baskets or containers, where it will grow to the edge of the pot and begin to trail. It can also be planted in the garden, as a border or along retaining walls. Plant in an area of full sun, will well drained soils. Once established, Blue Print is low maintenance and is extremely heat and drought tolerant. If planted in pots, allow the flowers to dry out between watering. Scaevola Blue Print can grow to a height of 25 centimetres and a width of 60 centimetres.

Scaevola crassifolia is a West Australian native shrub that grows naturally on sandy coastal sites where there is full sun and exceptionally free draining sandy soils. It has lavender blue, clear blue or occasionally white fan flowers on the tip of each branch. The main flowering season is from winter thorugh to late spring, and then there is often a second flowering during late summer.Ideal for mixed beds, borders, native and coastal gardens and looks great when mass planted.Plant in a sunny position with well drained soil.Tolerates coastal conditions and periods of drought.Scaevola crassifolia  grows to 1.5m high and 1.5m wide.

Scaevola Fandancer is a hardy, fast growing native ground cover with lush green foliage. Produces masses of purple, fan shaped flowers, from spring to autumn. Forms a dense mat of foliage and is ideal for rockeries, retaining walls and garden beds. Requires minimal watering once established. Fertilise well in spring to promote new growth.Scaevola Fandancer  can reach a height of 50cm and width of 1.5m

A very popular Australian native, Scaevola put on a terrific flower show from Spring to Autumn. These quick growing varieties feature clusters of unusual fan-shaped flowers, which characterise the Scaevola family. Scaevolas are very versatile plants suitable for gardens, rockeries and containers.

Mauve Clusters, produces masses of purple flowers which cover the lush, bright green foliage. Ideal for patio pots, rockeries and garden beds. It is also stunning planted around the house in hanging baskets or as a ground cover in general gardens and landscapes needing a pop of colour. Plant in an area of full sun with well drained soils. Once established, Mauve Clusters is waterwise, relatively low maintenance and will tolerate light frosts. Feed with a slow release native fertiliser in spring. Prune lightly after flowering to maintain a tidy appearance.Scaevola Mauve Clusters can grow to a height of 30 centimetres and width of 1 metre.

Aussie Spirit, is a semi-woody shrub that produces fleshy leaves and delicate blue flowers which appear at the terminals displaying more flowers than the plain crassifolia.Ideal for a sandy coastal location, rockeries and garden beds. Plant in an area of full sun with well drained soils. Once established, Aussie Spirit is relatively low maintenance and is waterwise.Feed with a slow release native fertiliser in spring. Great in any backyard garden, courtyard or cottage garden.Small purple flowers from Sept- Dec and most other times of year. Plant Mar-NovPlant in sun to light shade, cold tolerant, tolerates drought and frost. Suits most soil types.Trim edges as required.Scaevola Purple Fusion PBR grows 20cm high and 1.5m wide.

This compact form of Scaevola, developed by Kings Park Botanic Gardens, is a great addition to any garden. Sedum americanum is a low maintenance spreading perennial grown for its decorative foliage and drought hardness. The succulent has needle like leaves which form masses of chalk blue tufted stems. Plant in full sun in free draining soil, ideal in rockeries, containers, pots and hanging baskets. Benefits from summer watering and an occasional application of liquid fertiliser.Sedum americanum will grow to a height of 20cm.

Sedum Donkeys Tail or 'Burro's Tail' is a flowering perennial succulent which produces trailing stems up to 60cm long with bright red flowers appearing on the ends in summer. It performs well indoors and outdoors as long as it is not exposed to extreme heat. Be careful not to over water in winter as Burro's tail is susceptible to rot.

Sedum Copper Mound is of the succulent family and portrays coppery tones with green edges. It is not as waterwise as other succulents however still great for use in hanging baskets, pots and can be planted in sunlight or shade.

Sedum Jelly bean is green with a red/ burgundy tinge during warmer periods. Short, oblong leaves form grape like bunches and Sedum Jelly Bean is great for use in waterwise gardens as it is drought resistant and once established requires minimal maintenance.

Sedum Little Gem is a stonecrop and great for use as a ground cover or to decorate indoors as it thrives in sun or shade. It flowers all year round, and needs very little care to maintain. Sedum Little Gem is a bright green with coppery red tinge when in full sunlight.

This dainty Sedum is a lovely addition to your collection. The cute heart-shaped cream and light green leaves are edged in pink and look lovely cascading over small walls in rockeries, succulent bowls, miniature gardens, vertical green walls and hanging containers.Most Sedum like a well-drained, porous soil. Additional grit or sharp sand will help with drainage.  'Mini Variegated' has tiny leaves in green & cream with pink edges. Sedum 'Mini variegated' bares white blooms in summer. Allow Sedum to dry out between waterings and dryer during cooler months.Heat and Drought tolerant. Full sun to part shade.

Sedum purpureum is an appealing perennial plant forming masses of striking fleshy leaves.Tiny rosettes of intense reddish-purple make this plant fascinating for both colour and texture during winter.Excellent in pots, rockeries and dry gardens.Plant in full sun in well drained soil, do not over water.Sedum purpureum will grow to a height of 20cm and a width of 15-20cm.

'Jelly Bean' is an excellent term to describe Sedum rubrotinctum, with chubby little green leaves with red tips. During the summer months the leaves will turn red as a protective adaptation. Small yellow flowers are borne above the foliage in winterThis vibrant succulent creates a tropical affect and will add character and colour to your garden or landscape. Jelly Bean is an ideal potted specimen as it will slowly spill out and over the sides. Well suited for rockeries and garden beds. Plant in an area of full sun, with well drained soil. Once established, Sedum rubrotinctum is relatively drought tolerant and is relatively low maintenance. Ensure that the plant is protected from frosts. Caution: Sedum rubrotinctum is poisonous and may cause irritation when ingested or touched.Sedum rubrotinctum Jelly Bean can grow to a height of 20 centimetres and a width of 50 centimetres.

Sedum variegatum is a very attractive low growing Sedum that has succulent, fleshy, oval leaves edged in pink and white and has beautiful star shaped, pink flowers which appear in Summer and into Autumn.Plant Uses perfect as Groundovers, trailing over banks, as borders, pots or rock gardens. PositionFull sun to light shade with well drained soil.Not alot of water needed, they tolerate hot, dry weather well, once established and too much water makes them rot and susceptible to fungal diseases. Sedum variegatum grows 7cm high and 20cm wide.

Blue Chalk Sticks is a very attractive spreading succulent with fleshy, chalky blue finger shaped leaves. Insignificant white daisy like flowers appear in summer. Prefers a full sun or part shade position in well drained soil. Very drought tolerant requiring little water once established, but will grow quicker with regular watering.Great for garden beds,borders,rockeries and when mass planted. Also ideal for pots and containers and coastal gardens. Senecio Blue Chalk Sticks will grow to a height of 30-60cm and a width of 60-90cm.

Senecio radicans is a trailing succulent with fast growing crescent-shaped leaves that cascade down. Tiny white daisy-like flowers that have a pleasant cinnamon-like scent during Summer. Great plant for growing indoors and in sheltered patios, hanging baskets, pots and containers. Plant in a sheltered position outdoors or indoors in a well lit position with free draining soil. is drought tolerant. Water when the soil feels dry to the touch, but don’t allow it to remain bone dry. Senecio radicans will grow to a length of 90cm.
Ground Cover, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Succulent

The Senecio 'String of Pearls' has a creeping/trailing habit making it perfect for hanging containers.Quite often grown indoors  this delightful Senecio bears small white, trumpet-shaped, spicy scented flowers which appear in autumn and last about 4 weeks.The leaf shape is a natural adaption in order to minimize moisture loss in dryer times.'String of Pearls' prefers a moist, well-drained, compost-rich soil but allow it to dry out between waterings. Also reduce watering during the colder months. Despite its delicate appearance, this unusual succulent house plant is a vigorous grower, quickly creeping across the surface of the pot, then cascading down the side.Trim if they reach the ground or lift and drape back into the pot to thicken pot growth.Best in semi or full-shaded positions, but will tolerate full sun. Ideal in patios, shaded areas under trees and greenhouses. Re-pot every 3 years or so to create growing space and maintain the happiness of your 'String of Pearls'.Feed occasionally with a half strength liquid fertilizer.It is advisable to keep out of reach from children and pets.
Lilaceous - Like The Blossom Of A Lily In General Form

Butterkin is a low spreading shrub whose buttery-orange flowers resemble a miniature Hibiscus. Flowers occur in prolific terminal clusters for most of the year, particularly in warmer subtropical climates. Butterkin can be used as a low hedge, a tidy edging plant, a colourful filler or an ideal groundcover for the garden.Butterkin can grow in a full sun or lightly shaded area. Prune regularly to maintain prolific flowering and appearance.Butterkin will grow to a height of 1 metre and a spread of 1 metre.

Silverbeet Fordhook is an easy to grow crop producing an abdundance of flavoursome leaves and stalks over a long period. It's stalks and leaves are edible, and can be eaten raw or cooked. Silverbeet Fordhook likes a full sun position in your home vegetable garden.

Silverbeet Fordhook is an easy to grow crop with large, tasty leaves. It can be harvested over a long period of time. Try Silverbeet Fordhook lightly blanched and drained. Melt butter, add silverbeet and saute until tender. Season with salt and pepper and fresh lemon juice.

Diggers Rainbow Chard is a colourful and nutritious mix of silverbeet heirloom varieties. This punnet selection is taken from Chard with midribs of red, orange, yellow, pink and white. Rainbow Chard Silverbeet can be used fresh, lightly steamed or in casseroles. Plant in soil enriched with organic matter for garden beds. Use premium potting mix for container plants.

Silverbeet Rainbow Chard has brilliantly coloured stalks and leaves which are ornamental as well as tasty. Colours include pink, cream, yellow, red and white. Silverbeet Rainbow Chard can be used as flavouring for cooked dishes or as a garnish. It is best eaten when leaves are young and tender.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Perennial, Shrub, Strappy Leaf, Vertical Gardens

Spathiphyllum Sensation offers beautiful style and symmetry to any indoor space, office or home. These varieties are very forgiving during periods of no water and will recover quickly. The strong dark green foliage is a perfect frame for the elegantly shaped white flowers.Sensation is known for its durabilty with beauty and versatility. It is the largest and most popular of all Spaths and is very popular in the indoor plant hire sector. Sensation has a strong upright habit and dark green, tough foliage with an attractive ribbed texture. It produces large, well shpaed white flowers.Extremely ideal for indoors but can tolerate filtered light outdoors. Protect from frost, requires moderate watering.Spathiphyllum Sensation grows to 1m high and 1m wide.
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Spathogplottis Mellow Yellow is a vigorous growing, early flowering garden orchid with beautiful yellow flowers and palm-like green foliage. This variety produces flower spikes with large clusters of flowers, each producing flowers for months.  Spathoglottis orchids are easy to grow and make excellent container plants for the summer garden as well as the home. Best in light shade to full sun conditions with well-drained soil. Keep plants evenly moist.  Over watering may cause fungal problems, especially in young plants. Don’t allow plants to dry out.  Spathoglottis are fast growing and require a higher-than-average orchid nutrient supply. Requirements will vary with light and temperature conditions.Spathoglottis PMellwo Yellow will grow to a height of 30-36cm.

Spinach English is packed with vitamins, in particular iron. Pick outside leaves before they reach full size and use the same day as picking to retain flavour. Spinach English is ideal for salads, sandwiches, wraps or lightly cooked. It is also very popular in Asian cuisine.

Spring Onion has white, edible stems and bulbs with green leaves. It likes a full sun position, but should be watered well in dry weather. Use Spring Onion in salads, sandwiches, wraps, Asian cuisine or as a garnish.

Lambs Ear's are perennial herbs with grey/silver soft foilage and bright purple flowers in late spring. It is commonly grown in childrens gardens because of its soft feel. It can also be used as an edging plant.

Statice Petite Bouquet, also known as Sea Lavender, produces have tall slender spikes of colourful, ruffled papery flowers in shades of pink, purple, white and yellow atop bushy plants throughout summer.Ideal for costal gardens, pots, rockeries and containers Statice Petite Bouquet prefer a position in partial shade and should be planted in well-drained soil that has been has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly until the seedlings are established then water heavily, once or twice per week. Adding mulch on top of your garden bed will help retain moisture in the soil.Their everlasting flowers are ideal for cutting and displaying either fresh or dried. Statice Petite Bouquet grows to approx. 30cm high and should be planted 30-40cm apart.
Evergreen, Indoor Foliage, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Commonly known as the Bird of Paradise, Strelitzia reginae is a large, evergreen plant that produces long-stalked leaves with striking orange and blue flowers that resemble an exotic bird. These stunning flowers appear on long stems during spring and summer, and provide a stunning contrast against the blue-green foliage. Strelitzia reginae will add a definite tropical-paradise feel to any garden or landscape.Strelitzia reginae is an ideal feature plant in the garden bed, or pots and containers. The flowers and foliage are also used in flower arrangements. Plant in an area of full sun to part shade, with well drained soil. Strelitzia reginae is relatively low maintenance. Keep soils moist during the growing season, and through extended hot periods. Strelitzia reginae can grow to a height of 2 metres and a width of 1.5 metre.
Very popular with children, this dwarf sunflower variety will grow well in pots or garden beds. Bright golden yellow petals will flower in the first year.

Sweetpea Colourama makes a great screening plant. They can be attached to a screen, trellis and fence to great effect and produce a range of beautiful pink, blue, red and white coloured, fragrant flowers that bloom though summer and autumn. Sweetpea's can also be staked and used in garden beds and pots and thrive in a position in full sun. Plant in well-drained soil that has been has been enriched with compost or manure prior to planting. Water regularly, keeping the soil moist throughout the growing season.Deadhead the plant, removing spent blooms to prolong flowering and encourage new growth. Be cautious of over-watering, over-watering and poor drainage in soil can cause the foliage to yellow and can be lethal to the plants.Sweetpea Colourama grows to approx. 120-180cm high and should be planted 15-20cm apart.
Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

Commonly known as Lilly Pilly, Syzygium are one of the most popular Australian Native plants. Lilly Pillies are evergreen rainforest plants with glossy, deep green leaves. Many varieties have flushes of colourful new growth, ranging from bright pinks, to red and browns. This particular variety, Pinnacle, is very narrow, tall and compact, producing glossy green leaves, with contrasting red-brown new growth.Pinnacle is ideal for hedging, screening and topiary and can be grown in containers. Plant in a warm area, protected from frost and well drained soil. Being native, this variety is well accustomed to Australia's diverse climate and soil conditions and once established will tolerate coastal and drought conditions. Water well until established and during extended hot periods. Prune to shape to encourage dense growth habit. Syzygium Pinnacle can grow to a height of 10 metres and a width of 1.5 metres.
Advanced Plants, Evergreen, Hedge, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Acuminate - Tapering To A Long Point

A fast growing evergreen native shrub or small tree with dense foliage. Hinterland Gold is a feature plant throughout the year with its attractive green glossy foliage and feathery, cream-white flowers followed by purplish-pink, fleshy, edible berries. A highlight of this Syzygium is regular flushes of golden, copper toned new growth which turn to green as they mature.Ideal plant for screening and hedging.Plant in an open, sunny position in well drained, composted soil with a good mulch layer around the base of the plant. keep mulch away from the trunk to avoid rotting. To encourage a compact habit or maintain a certain shape prune back lightly several times throughout the year.Hinterland Gold can grow to a height of 6 metres and a width of 3 metres.

Aussie Boomer is also fast growing in comparison to other species. Aussie Boomer is ideal for hedging, screening and topiary and can be grown in containers. Plant in a warm area, protected from frost and well drained soil. Being native, this variety is well accustomed to Australia's diverse climate and soil conditions and once established will tolerate coastal and drought conditions. Thryptomene Mingenew Form is a small spreading evergreen shrub with masses of tiny, dainty, deep pink flowers in Winter. Great for adding winter colour to containers and garden beds. Plant in a full sun to partly shaded position with moist, well drained soil. Prune lightly after flowering to maintain compact growth. Avoid cutting into old woody stems. Thryptomene mingenew Form will grow to a height of 40-80cm and a width of 100-150cm.
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Native West Australian Plant, Outdoor, Shrub, Verge

A native evergreen shrub of Western Australia, Thryptomene Paynes Hybrid has masses of dainty pink flowers during winter and spring with tiny heath-like leaves that are aromatic when bruised.This plant thrives in most areas of Australia, except for the very hot or very cold zones.  Thryptomene Pynes Hybrid is an excellent coastal plant, for mass planting, revegatation, roadsides, parklands or a feature in the home garden.  Pynes hybrid will suit any native garden or fit right into a cottage garden with a long flowering period that attracts butterflies to the garden.  Hardy, drought tolerant once established and low maintenance.Thryptomene saxicola Paynes Hybrid grows to about 1 metre tall and 1.5m wide
Evergreen, Native Australian Plant, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub
Rotate - Petals Turn Around On An Axis Or Center, Wheel-shaped

Thryptomene Supernova is a charming small spreading shrub with a horizontal branching habit and tiny aromatic needle-like leaves with white flowers. Main flowering is in Spring with spot flowering at other times throughout the year. Likes full sun to part shade and well drained soil, best to water during dry periods. Thryptomene is a good cut flower and is a tough drought tolerant plant and is good for a low maintenance gardens. Lightly trim to shape the plant if desired. Thryptomene Supernova will grow to a height of 0.8m and a width of 1.5m.

Thuja occidentalis Smaragd is a native to North America and Canada.  An attractive cone-shaped conifer with dense bright green glossy foliage.  Excellent as a hedge, border or screening plant, or use as a specimen plant. Smaragd is also suitable for containers.Grow in an open sunny position, of well drained soil.  Smaragd is tolerant of cold and humid conditions and will also tolerate light frost.  Pruned to maintain shape in Spring.Thuja occidentalis Smaragd is a very slow growing conifer variety which grow to a height of approximately 2 metres in 10 years.

Thuja orientalis aurea nana is a slow growing dwarf conifer forming a dense, neat oval shape.  During summer the foliage turns brilliant golden yellow and green/yellow during winter. Foliage is arrange in flat vertical sprays, with small grey cones, hense the common name Bookleaf. Aurea Nana can be used as an accent plant in your garden, as a small hedge or in potsPrefers moist well drained soil in full sun, protect from drying winds, especially while establishing plant.  This conifer variety requires very little maintenance but does prefer regular watering, Thuja orientalis aurea nana will grow to 1 metre tall and 60 centimetres in width.
Herb, Outdoor, Perennial, Seedling, Shrub, Vertical Gardens

Thyme is a low growing perennial herb that is ideal for the home herb or vegetable garden. Thyme will add flavour to a variety of dishes such as poultry, fish, casseroles, pate and egg and cheese dishes. It can be used either fresh or dried. Tip prune to maintain compact growth. For best results liquid fertilise regularly.
Bamboo, Evergreen, Hedge, Outdoor, Perennial, Shrub

Tiger grass is an attractive feature plant which looks like a bamboo but is in fact a fast growing , non-invasive perrenial grass. Tight clumps of slim stems and lush leaves reach 2.5m high, and are ideal for blocking fences while adding a tropical feel to the garden. It is also excellent as a specimen plant in garden beds or pots. Tiger grass prefers full to partly shaded area of moist rich soil and protected from frosts.  Cut back old stems as required.Grows to 2.5m high by 1m wide
Elliptic - Oval-shaped, Small Or No Point

Commonly known as the Rosewood tree and Pride of Bolivia, Tipuana tipu is a native of South America. This stunning ornamental is a fast growing, deciduous shade tree, of beautiful lacy light green foliage and masses of bright apricot-yellow flowers that are displayed briefly in Summer.Widely used in lawns, carparks, gardens and as street trees, Tipuana will grow nearly anywhere in Australia, can adapt to most soil types and is tolerant to drought, frost and beachside conditions.  Tipuana tipu can grow to a height of up to 20 metres and a width of 12 metres
Rich sweet flavour for salads as well as a hearty texture for pasta and sauces. Yields 15.7kgs per plant.
